story:
Short Summary

My name is Hish Fernando and I'm in the business of management consulting. Having spent my entire working career in projects with limited resources, I've developed a passion for inspiring as many people as I can to have a go in their lifetimes and make something from what the already have. Some would call this "a positive difference." That's Adrian Morgan taking photos in the video above, and Keith Wiggins the skipper of the boat.

Late last year we formed a venture to take one continuous photo of the entire coastline of Australia. Why? Because its an amazing thing to do and one of our greatest assets remains undocumented to a degree. There are 10,685 beaches in Australia and not everyone will have the opportunity to see all of these in their lifetimes.

So on fathers day in 2013, we kicked off "Picture The Coast" with a pilot leg covering the NSW coastline in a proof of concept. It was funded primarily through a small group of donors and through some of my personal financing. The more we shared the vision with everyone, the more interest we gained and there was plenty of press that covered the story. You can read all about it at http://www.picturethecoast.org

Fast Forward to today and this is what Picture The Coast means to us.

"One Photo, Many Uses, A Better World"

How you may ask?

-We plan to increase Tourism into Australia via a destination marketing exercise, and are in the middle of discussions with Tourism Australia and the MCG (among other stadiums) to host the final images around the boundaries of the stadium. Imagine being able to walk around the stadium in circles and gain a complete perspective of the Australian coastline - and keep walking around endlessly!

-The images and venture will provide input into coastal conservation and education, and we have partnered with Deakin University to bring the output of this venture into their research. In particular, the Commerce faculty is keen on introducing Social Entrepreneurship into their curricula and this venture will provide students with a living laboratory. Imagine bringing a different style of teaching to Universities that inspire the students of today and tomorrow!

-The educational theme has attracted the support of the Lego Foundation from Denmark who have pledged 5 shipping containers of Lego for educational purposes. The Lego Foundation has a strong Social Enterprise footprint in South Africa (via Hands On Technologies) and are keen to explore the Oceania footprint with us. Imagine the publicity, fun and communities we could impact with that much Lego!

-We are in discussions with GigaPan to partner with us as they are the world leaders in large stitching of photos and GigaStitch will be an important part of our journey to realise the final product. GigaPan have introduced us to Time Magazine, Google and National Geographic and we are in the middle of discussion on how to collaborate with all of them. Have a look at our latest stitching on GigaPan: http://www.gigapan.com/gigapans/cc3fd8815902ef4b6df2b438f17a1137

-We plan to inspire as many kids in Green Super Camp who provide programmes with personal leadership, academic acceleration and environmental awareness camps for children aged 10 to 18 years of age.

-We have appointed Stirling Mortlock OAM and former Wallabies captain as our ambassador. A proud Australian and a recognised leader of Australians on an international level through his professional sporting career and beyond.

-We have a few Media Partners on standby and a documentary crew ready to film the exercise with a well known TV personality to narrate the story.

These are just a few of the facts, but there are many applications (physical and digital) from the final images. The 3 key themes are INFORMATION, EDUCATION and TOURISM. All of these are among Australia's greatest exports, and we wish to contribute to all of these.

What We Need & What You Get

The main aim is to get the asset. For this we need $5M in AUD. A complete project plan and budget outlines what this will be used for. Primarily it will be for the purchasing the boat, camera equipment, fuel, food, IT and other costs related to completing the asset capture.

If we reach our target, we will send everyone who contributes a very long image of the coastline (their favourite part up to 3M in length with a plaque), and have them featured on the documentary or other publicity if they so desire - perhaps even to help their ventures get off the ground.

You will also become a lifetime community member of PTC and be involved in the Social Enterprise and its direction as it takes off and becomes a global phenomenon. Finally, you will be invited to attend the exclusive launch of the physical gallery where I hope to meet and greet you personally.

Those who contribute $10,000 = 1 share in the PTC company. There is a total of 1500 shares.

The Impact

This venture is the first of its kind in the world and I am a real person, putting my credibility, and current businesses I run on the line. One way or another, we will finish this project, but we want to do this before the 2015 Cricket World Cup in the MCG. Will you help us?

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute and we understand that, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Tell all your friends to like our page on  http://www.facebook.com/picturethecoast and promote our campaign at least.
  • If you know someone who could really help us make this really awesome, please get them to contact us.
  • Also remember the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
I'm Jennifer of Jennifer Lynn Hennigan Photography, a creative portrait photographer and Texas State Alum who began the Beards of Texas State last year with our 2015 Calendar. It was completely self funded, and I printed 100 calendars featuring some of the most manly and fuzzy faces on Texas State University's campus. This year I'm back again with the 2016 calendar, which will feature different bearded men around the school, and The City of San Marcos itself.

I am hoping to raise $600 to cover production costs of the project, as well as printing and promotion. This project focuses on Texas State, and the unique, creative, silly side of the students who attend. Many of the photos are hysterical, others are classy, but all of them are attractive. This project is about entertainment, and making people smile. These men have something unique about them and they want to showcase that.

Right now we are looking for our cover photo for the calendar, and this is an awesome way for our funders to get involved. If you look at our perks you'll see that for a $10 donation to the indiegogo campaign you will get a calendar! Once they are produced the price for sale will be $15. Also, when you donate $10 and choose the calendar perk, comment on the campaign, and let me know who you want to be on the cover! The guy who has the most votes will get to be on the cover for the 2016 Beards of Texas State Calendar!  

If you have a company and want to have your business advertised on the calendar, select our gold, maroon, or black perk depending on how much you want to donate. Then email me at jennifer_hennigan@yahoo.com a graphic of your ad and I will publish it in the calendar.

Even if you can't donate, but you are a supporter, and Bobcat fan please share this campaign on your facebook, twitter, or other social media accounts to help get the word out. It would be most appreciated! Also like us on facebook on the Beards of Texas State page.

story:
A Bit About the Project

Hello! Austin Ledzian and I are photographers and design students at Virginia Tech, and we have spent the past few months interviewing and photographing women farmers in southwest Virginia. We focused on our pocket of Appalachia because it’s a region that has been relevant to our lives for the past four years as students.

Our initial inspiration for this project began at the Blacksburg Farmers market, where our preconceived notions of a male-dominated agricultural realm were challenged.  We immediately were drawn to the local farming movements, focusing specifically on representation of women. We wanted to know what it meant to be a woman in agriculture, especially in a region where stereotypes and male representation dominate. We want to share their stories.

For a further look at the series, please visit our website, www.wfarmers.com

 

What We Need & What You Get

We are raising $1800 for the execution of this project, set to show on July 29 at the Palisades Restaurant in Eggleston, VA. We decided to show first here, because this farm-to-table restaurant sources only locally grown and raised goods, and it is geographically relevant to the women we met. Once the photographs are printed we would like to show in other locations throughout Appalachia.

The exhibit comprises 25 photographs: 20 27”x34” prints and 5 54”x68” prints. Then the funds raised will go towards printing to make the exhibit happen. Here’s a detailed breakdown of how we will use the $1800:

  • $250: Professionally scanned film negatives (25 negatives total)
  • $900: Photographic paper for the archival prints
  • $500: Ink for printing
  • $150: Installation supplies (clips, wood, cord, etc.)

Perks: This is a documentary photographic series, so the perks are pieces of art! Each size is an edition of 10. By pre-ordering a print through this campaign you will receive a 15% discount. All photographs can be seen in the gallery section of our website, www.wfarmers.com. 

 

Obstacles

An alarm goes off: it’s 4:00am. Austin and I throw our coats on and gather our equipment. We rush to get on the road, where we drive for two hours—all so we can catch the first rays of light and morning rounds on the farm. Rinse, repeat. Expect your camera to malfunction. Expect it to be raining. And expect to walk through cow s**t in 20 degree weather.

This became our routine from the latter months of 2016 to early 2017, all while navigating our class schedules. Austin and I had to plan early morning sessions in order to make it back for our 9:00 AM’s, or afternoon sessions before the sun went down. Missing one chance to shoot could mean we miss a bloom or a harvest, a challenge we met every week. Schedules revolved around the women we wanted to learn from, and nothing every really went as planned on the farm.

We restricted ourselves to using analogue film, the only photographic medium we felt did justice to the intense manual labor of these women. Therein lay a challenge—not knowing if the photos were good until we got them developed, photographing situations that already had little margin for error, and adding time to the already lengthy process. The photos were blemished by the analog process, and we celebrate these blemishes. 

The experience humbled us and motivated us to refine and improve our process with each shoot. At times it was messy, but we learned immensely from our time spent on and off the farm with these incredible women.

 

Our Goal

Over the past few months, we have made five new friends. The project allowed us to connect with incredible women farmers in our community that we may not have crossed paths with in our daily lives. By supporting this project, you are supporting the reason there is food on your table. This project is to shed light on a population that doesn’t garner widespread representation. To support this project is to appreciate local farming, the women that make up the fabric of agricultural history, and the stories they have to tell.

 

How You Can Support

If you are unable to contribute to the project at this time, there are other ways that you can help! Post this on your Facebook! Watch the video and share it on your social media! Spread the word. In the meantime, appreciate your local farms and farmers. Visit and share our website, www.wfarmers.com!

story:
Hello everybody!

No, that's not me in that photo although I do shoot with a Nikon :) My name is Trina Baker and I am a Fine Art Photographer from Lawrece, Kansas. I graduated from the University of Kansas with a Bachelor of Fine Arts in 1993 and have been creating images ever since. Photography is my passion and I would love the opportunity to learn some new techniques to take my work to the next level.

Attending this workshop and working with the amazing Brooke Shaden is an opportunity I just can't miss. Ms. Shaden is known for here creative portraits that are both whimiscal and dreamy. Combining her unique techniques with my Lensbaby and creative vision will be the edge that I need to discover new imagery. Ms. Shaden only hosts three of these workshops per year, two are in London, and this one just happens to be the closest one to my area that she has ever had. I simply can't miss out!

So I need your help raising $2000 so I can go off to Chicago, be inspired and create some amazing images to share with you.

Here's the breakdown on how the money will be spent:

$1300 for the workshop and accommodations
$400 for air travel
$300 for fulfilling the perks

Now for the goodies you get for your generosity!

$10 Donation: For your contribution you will receive a 5x5 print of an image created during the workshop.

$20 Donation: For your contribution you will receive a 8x8 print of an image created during the workshop.

$50 Donation: For your contribution you will receive an 8x8 Limited Edition signed print of an image created during the workshop. These images
will only be printed for this campaign.

$100 Donation: For your contribution you will receive a 10x10 Limited Edition signed print of an image created during the workshop. These images
Will only be printed for this campaign.

If you can't donate money I would appreciate your time to help me promote my little campaign via social media.

Thank you for your time.

Sincerely,

Trina Baker

story:
Hallo und Hallöle von Happy Berry ;)

Ich habe diese Seite erstellt, da diese Paypal anbietet, wie es sich einige von euch gewünscht haben. ^^


ich habe ein großes Anliegen und brauche dafür eure Hilfe !

Ihr seid meine Fans , die die meine Bilder mögen und täglich auf meine Seite klicken und bestaunen meine Werke und das freut mich richtig dolle und bin froh solche Menschen wie euch um mich zu haben !

Täglich stecke ich viele Stunden in das bearbeiten der Bilder und die Shootings hinein , viele Ideen und tägliches "brainstorming" gehören somit zum alltag.

Nun brauche ich eure Hilfe v.vIch habe Faszinierende Projekte geplant , von riesigen Wänden aus Blumen bis hin zum Cyborg Projekt .

- ihr könnt mir so viel Geld geben wie ihr wollt-das Geld kommt bei mir an und es wird für die Projekte ausgegeben

- ihr spendet für eine großartige Sache für ein Hobby / eine Leidenschaft / für HAPPY BERRY

- für alle Projekte bis Mai brauche ich eine hohe summe die ich durch mein Lehrlingsgeld leider nicht stemmen kann :(

- ich werde von allem was Posten ( das Einkaufen was wie viel etc)- wenn das Shooting dann stattfindet , werden Videos gemacht die online gestellt werden.

- alle die gespendet haben , werden Namentlich in einem Video erwähnt !

Also warum dann nicht helfen? Warum nicht tollen Projekten durch euer Geld Flügel verleihen?

Ich danke jedem einzelnen der was spendet ! und meine Modellen und mir helft !Danke vom Happy Berry Team

story:
Short Summary

Welcome to Flight! We are graduating from the University of Georgia with a BFA in Photography. Our exit show is the culmination of our undergraduate education. Everything at our show, from the tablecloths to the food, will be funded by this site. Any donation helps a tremendous amount!

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is to raise at least $500 through the sale of our work. Options are listed below but we are open to negotiation.

The Impact

We want our exit show to be the best that it can be! We need support from friends and family to help fund food, drinks and any promotional items for our show. The more money we raise, the better the party!

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word! Tell your friends and family, anyone who might be interested in helping, purchasing our work-or both. We can't succeed without your help! We would love to hear from you, so email us at flightexit@gmail.com. 

Thank you and we can't wait to see you on December 6th from 7-9!

story:
Focusing Hope

I cannot thank you enough for stopping by to check out my campaign!

Inspired by the last few months I had with my father before he lost his fight to Pancreatic Cancer, Focusing Hope is an organization for photography for families and individuals affected by terminal illness. It includes donation based packages for portraits with loved ones, photos of individuals and families completing life goals (checking off their "bucket list"), and well crafted videos of stories, speeches or well wishes to give to the ones you love now or in the future.

This coming coming year will mark the start of my full time career as a photographer and as a founder of my non profit organization- any and all support with this fantastic and terrifying time of my transition will be appreciated more than you know!

Kayla Coleman Photography

 As many of you know/have seen/have experienced, my life has taken a lot of crazy turns over the past few years, but the one consistently amazing and joyful part of my life has been my photography- It is something I have had to work up the courage and confidence to pursue as a full time career, and I am finally ready to move forward.

I graduated from Kent State University with my undergrad in Art Education and then to a semester at SCAD for my Masters of Photography. My hope for this coming year is to transition my personal photography into my full time career, as well as to develop my non-profit organization, Focusing Hope. 

Needs

Your donation to Focusing Hope could mean business cards, brochures to give to our local terminally ill support groups, website registration, business registration, a new lens, the ability to travel to a client with an urgent timeline, or help with meeting any of the necessary goals to develop my organizations. With your support, I will also be building and maintaining my websites, upgrading my equipment, designing and implementing my marketing base and completing legal registrations and paperwork for each business.

See this link for more information on the basics of starting a non profit-

http://www.wikihow.com/Start-a-501c3-Nonprofit-Organization

Other Ways You Can Help

If you or someone you know has been diagnosed with a terminal illness and would like some of your time and moments together to be documented, please reach out. If I cannot travel to you to take your photos, I will dedicate my time and energy to {hopefully} finding a photographer in your area to help my cause! Please spread the word and please keep your loved ones close <3 

Contact: focusinghope@gmail.com 

Webpage for Focusing Hope coming soon!

www.kaylacolemanphotography.com
story_txt:
Focusing Hope
I cannot thank you enough for stopping by to check out my campaign!
Inspired by the last few months I had with my father before he lost his fight to Pancreatic Cancer, Focusing Hope is an organization for photography for families and individuals affected by terminal illness. It includes donation based packages for portraits with loved ones, photos of individuals and families completing life goals (checking off their "bucket list"), and well crafted videos of stories, speeches or well wishes to give to the ones you love now or in the future.
This coming coming year will mark the start of my full time career as a photographer and as a founder of my non profit organization- any and all support with this fantastic and terrifying time of my transition will be appreciated more than you know!

story:
Mongolia, a country renowned for its ancient traditions and ruthless crusaders is transforming. With the demand for its raw minerals to feed the insatiable appetite of China’s resource boom and a rapidly developing tourism industry, ancient traditions are being swept away by cocktail bars, internet cafes and modernized, internationally educated youth. Despite being one of only three true democracies in Asia (Japan and South Korea the others) it is still one of the poorest. With this transition to modernity, the growth of the mining sector and the desire to attract the lucrative tourism industry, are the traditions of the nomadic agricultural pastoralists at risk of being lost forever?


Along with four friends I will trek by horseback across the historic Mongolian Steppe to photograph the landscape, traditions, people and animals that make this a culture worth saving.

Mongolia is one of the only remaining horse-based cultures left in the world. Outside the capital, the horse is still the main mode of transportation and children begin riding as soon as they can sit up. Mongolians greatly cherish their horses, something I am intrigued to capture in my photography.

 

As an avid horse lover I’ve long heard of the famous horse festival Nadaam. The festival brings together the best horsemen (and children), archers and wrestlers from around the country to compete in two days of frantic activities culminating in the infamous Ikh Nas – a 30km bareback race across the steppe where children as young as three compete. There are historical records citing the festival as far back as the 13th Century.


My four-week journey by horseback is the realization of a dream to ride across and photograph this region. I plan on publishing a book and displaying the photographs at an exhibition in Stockholm in August and other destinations later.

 

Your donation will assist in the costs associated with the adventure and the production of the book and exhibition. I am required to buy a horse, saddle, saddle bags, food etc. and have many other expenses related to our trek across the steppe. We will only be using local guides and, when not camping on our own,  be staying with families in villages. 


In the end we will donate our horses to families that have either made an strong impression on us or families we feel are in need of a horse to sustain their traditional living. Also saddles and other equipment will be donated to where it's most needed. With horses being such an important part of the Mongolian life I feel that this is a good thing to do, instead of just selling the horses back on the market.

 

Please donate as little or as much as you are able.


Thank you so much!


Lisa

story:
Hidden Women: The Lampshade Project

Wouldn't it be great if there were more women artists represented in major museums? Donate a little and you have a chance to help make that happen. My name is Jenny Ashley--I'm an emerging fine art photographer from San Luis Obispo, CA with my first solo exhibition coming up March 6 through May 12, 2020 for International Women's Day at Cultural Center Tijuana. The exhibit will include 20  large scale 40" x 60" archival photographs from Hidden Women: The Lampshade Project, a subversive fine art series that confronts the audacity of how women are overlooked, objectified, silenced and even made to feel replaceable. 

How to Support the Project

Thankfully, the cost of fine art printing is substantially less in Mexico. And the museum is graciously covering half the expenses of printing the exhibition and catalogue. But that still leaves $5000 to pull together to make this large scale exhibition happen. 

Ways to Support the Project:

Donate $250 to sponsor the printing of one 40" x 60" archival fine art print and you will receive a signed 11" x 14" photograph (chosen by the artist) and two signed and numbered exhibition catalogues 

Donate $100 to sponsor the printing of 5 exhibition catalogues 

Donate $20 to sponsor the printing of 1 exhibition catalogue (pre-order a catalogue) 

If I don't reach my goal, the drawing will still take place and the project will still proceed (but just with fewer prints in the exhibition). 
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this fundraiser if you have friends who are interested in supporting emerging artists, women in the arts, women in business, art as resistance, art and feminism, gender equity, women and gender studies or fine art photography. 

 

Find Out More


About the exhibition March 6 - May 12th at CECUT, Baja California Mexico:
https://www.jennyashleyphotography.com/upcoming...


About "Hidden Women: The Lampshade Project" My Artist Statement https://www.jennyashleyphotography.com/cv1

Images from the project: 
www.jennyashleyphotography.com 

Follow me on Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/jenny_bsides/

Friend me on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/jlisaashley

To purchase a print: https://www.jennyashleyphotography.com/purchase

story: I have fallen on some pretty harsh times in the financial department, and my current photo equipment is not really up to par with the quality I need to convey to clients. I am a professional, and right now, I don't always look the part. I try my best to work with what I have and am very thankful my photography has taken me this far. I am now reaching out in hopes that there are some kind hearted people out there willing to contribute to my business because at this point, it's important that I expand, but have been having a rough time making ends meet and providing for my daughter. Any little bit helps and I will be forever grateful for all donations. Thank you so much. <3

story:
Having been a concert photographer for over three and a half years now, I decided it was finally time to host the first exhibit of my work. When trying to decide a theme for the gallery, I realized that--because I was raised in Huntington Beach-- would be nothing more fitting than honoring HB's hometown heroes - Avenged Sevenfold. 

A huge Avenged fan myself, I have been fortunate enough to photograph them a number of times in various settings--press conferences, concerts, autograph signings, and so on. "A Little Piece of Heaven", as I have named the exhibit, will feature dozens of photographs of the band, many never-before-seen, that I have taken over the years. 

However, there are many startup costs to hosting an exhibit, which is where this Indiegogo comes in. While I have already gone ahead and had the images for the gallery professionally printed, there is still a lot to get done before September 20. My highest priorities are ordering frames and matting for the prints, as well having postcards and photo books for the exhibit designed and printed.

With your generous support, I am set on making "A Little Piece of Heaven" an exhibit that will earn your Critical Acclaim.

-Charles

story:
Why we need a little help

The Womanhood Project  needs YOU to grow and stay alive.

In the past 4 years, we’ve done everything ourselves, spent our own money and invested all our time and energy in the project and we need your help now . We are convinced that this project is necessary to our community and to bring more diversity to the sea of images we see on social media. The interviews and portraits have helped thousands of people in the past years, and we would love to continue on this journey. We're hoping to keep doing this long-term and we have so many awesome stuff we want to accomplish (a book, an exhibition, merch and so much more) but it's hard to manage this with a full time job and school. So this campaign is the little push we need to focus on the project and the upcoming edition. 

Every dollar counts so even if you can only contribute $5, it would still mean the world to us and be a huge help. If you can’t contribute, a simple share on social media would be of great help to us, as it is the best way to spread the word!

 

The Project 

Through a series of interviews and portraits The Womanhood Project explores different aspects and complex issues related to womanhood with a more intimate view.

All kinds of womxn open up on their realities and talk about topics like gender, motherhood, abuse, mental health, abortion, rape, menstruation, body hair and much more. Each of them are photographed in their own environment depicting who they really are in the most personal and natural way possible.

These womxn are on a journey of self-discovery. We aim to give them a safe space to share their own reflection on the deep and beautiful subject that is womanhood. This award-winning project,  exclusively shot on film, also stems from the need to break from the constant flow of pictures only suggesting the desirability and the objectification of the “perfect” womxn.

 

What international press said about us

“ There are no answers or “guidelines” to follow, it’s just about creating a space of free expression on womanhood.” - Vogue Italia

 

“Les femmes du vidéoclip sont toutes des participantes du Womanhood Project. Cacheiro et Hini mènent un projet mondialement reconnu où des photographies et des entrevues brossent le portrait de la féminité dite par des femmes.” La Presse


“The womanhood project is the new photography platform urging women of the world to unite” - i-D Vice

 

“Dans un monde d’images irréalistes et hyper léchées, où la superficialité prédomine, cette authenticité pure fait un bien fou.” - La Gazette des Femmes

 

“Elles promeuvent la diversité corporelle et culturelle, aidant du même coup des milliers de femmes à se sentir bien dans leur peau.” - Elle Québec

 

Here’s exactly where the funds will be invested:

 

The Team

Sara Hini is also the co-founder, editor and creative director of the online magazine AYE. After her first year in university, she decided to buy a camera and learn photography by herself while travelling. She lived in Indonesia and Guatemala while treeplanting in the British Columbia’s wilderness to pay for her travels. After 3 years on the road, she decided to come back in Montreal, with a strong desire to experiment and realize the ideas she had in mind.

Cassandra Cacheiro started shooting women a few years ago and was naturally drawn to nudity. For her, it’s a way to explore a deeper level of vulnerability with her subjects. She slowly started to make her mark in Montreal’s scene and was a breath of fresh air on social media with her untouched and raw pictures. She is now exploring and diving even further into her artistic endeavours.

“Born in Algeria, but moved to Montreal at a young age, Sara always felt like the odd one out. With her darker skin and frizzy hair, she stood out from the rest of the girls at school, which is something Cassandra could relate to, having been bullied about her weight since she was just a kid. But after a chance meeting at a party, the pair decided to tackle these problems head on, which is why they set up The Womanhood Project, an online platform that invites a diverse cast of women to share their personal stories to women around the world.”  (Tish Weinstock – i-D Vice)

Photo by Lawrence Fafard

 

What We Need & What You Get

We collaborated with our good friend and talented illustrator Alexandra Laflamme to create illustrations of some of the lovely participants we'll have in our next edition, Sandra and Chloé. We wanted all of our contributors to have a chance of having a part of the Womanhood Project in their own space with these images. 


Suggestion one - $5: You’ll be in our thoughts forever.

 

Suggestion two - $15: Lots of hugs and kisses.

 

Suggestion three - $30: You have our unconditional love.

 

Suggestion four - $60: Our unconditional love + two digital illustrations of Alexandra’s Laflamme x The Womanhood Project collaboration sent to you by email. * (These will be sent once the campaign is closed)

 

Suggestion five - $160: Our unconditional love + two 8 ½ x 11 print illustrations of Alexandra’s Laflamme x The Womanhood Project collaboration. * 

 

Suggestion six - $300: Our unconditional love + two 8 ½ x 11 print illustrations of Alexandra’s Laflamme x The Womanhood Project collaboration* + a personal photoshoot with The Womanhood Project. ** 

 

* : Canadian, US and European residents only

** : Montreal residents only

story:
The concept:

Publishing houses be damned, I want to make this myself, exactly the way I like it. A limited edition of 111 photos, 15/22cm in size.  It'll be pretty punk, and maybe pretty ghetto, but it will be pretty. It might not be perfect, but it will be handmade, and I’m ready to bleed on them during the cutting process if I have to.

About the book:

It's a photobook about Ion, with whom I've lived with for about a week last year in the Sureanu Mountains, documenting his everyday life. It features Ion, his parents, their dog, and their livestock.

About the author:

Gabriel Amza is a Romanian photographer and photojournalist with an MA in Photojournalism at Mittuniversitetet, Sweden. Gabriel usually works on long-term documentary projects.  As a photographer, he focuses on the surrealism of everyday life, and documentary.

What you are paying for:


The cost of printing the book is about 750 euros, which is coincidentally the aim of the crowdfunding – that’s going straight there, once it passes some banking fees, the indiegogo fee and whatever else comes up along the way; That's the first goal.
The second goal is to make the work put into this project worthwhile, from travel expenses to living costs, as I carefully fold the paper myself and put it in a neat black cover, on which I’ll personally draw the title and number. It's a limited edition, after all.
That's the pipedream, really: To make this sort of thing affordable.

  • You'll be getting a handcut, handbound and carefully drawn photobook that will be one of its kind. I'll also add a workprint to each book.

Risks

For the contributors? Not really. The worst risk about this is that I’ll have to ask some loan sharks (read 'friends') to loan me money in order to publish it, but one way or another, it's getting out there.

Would you really like to help, but are flat broke?

Sharing is caring, and much appreciated.

story:
[A hardback photobook; 200 pages on matte archival paper]

Hey everyone, my name is Allen Henson.  I am a photographer and filmmaker; I call Brooklyn, New York home.  What originally began as a hobby, after my time spent as an infantryman in the Army, has become something more than I could have ever expected.  After five years of hard work I am happy to say that now is the time to compile a selection of my photographs into a book.

This book is not just a compilation of visually appealing images, but serves as a vehicle and a means to further fund our overall goals at Allen Henson Productions.  With the help of you guys, this can be the next step in the direction of eliminating artistic censorship. (eh hem, instagram) Your contributions will enable the production of this book, which provides the unique and never before seen perspective of a U.S. Veteran in the current dialogue of senseless censorship in "modern" America.  In supporting the creation of this book, you will not only be taking a stance on censorship, but purchasing one kick-ass piece for the bookshelf, bathroom, or coffee table.

In this era of advanced technology and omnipresent social media sites like Indieagogo, instagram and facebook, a photographer no longer has to solely sustain projects like this just through avenues used by photographers in previous decades. And frankly I wouldn't be inclined to. This is why I'm asking for your contributions, whether you have five dollars to offer or fifty thousand.  Anyone have 50K? It is now up to my friends and supportive viewers to play their part in the publication of our book.  I've always felt a degree of support and encouragement; but now I need a little help from my friends.

The minimum dollar amount for the production of this book has been set at $17,000.  This amount of money will allow me to maintain the integrity of the imagery, while creating an affordable and accessible book for my fans.  In support of my fans, new and old, I have created an awesome perks section, located on this page.  Look there to view the numerous perks in store for those who participate in this artistic endeavor.  There is something for everyone in this section, whether you are a friend, co-conspirator, model, photographer, or just someone looking to help fan the social commentary surrounding the effects censorship.

To those that have been along for the ride since the beginning or if you’ve just recently come aboard, Thanks for your support.  I really mean that. This is my life, literally, it’s practically an obsession and you guys make it possible every day.

Allen



“We need to make books cool again. If you go home with somebody and they don't have books, don't fuck them.”
― John Waters

story:
Portrait-Fotografie - Das nächste Level

Ich bin Laloriel und gehe seit 1,5 Jahren mit großer Leidenschaft der Portrait-Fotografie nach. Meine Bilder könnt ihr auf Facebook unter https://www.facebook.com/laloriel/ oder auf meiner Webseite unter www.laloriel.de verfolgen.

Im vergangenen Jahr bin ich auf dem Gebiet der Fotografie stetig gewachsen und habe neue Erfahrungen gesammelt. Dabei merke ich mehr und mehr wie meine aktuelle Kamera nicht mehr ausreichend ist. Ein gutes Objektiv habe ich bereits, doch zwischen meiner Kamera mit APS-C Sensor und Vollformat liegen in Sachen Qualität trotzdem Welten.

Aus diesem Grund habe ich diese Kampagne auf die Beine gestellt. Ich möchte mir eine professionelle Kamera + Equipment zulegen um weiter wachsen zu können und noch bessere Fotos zu machen.


Was habt ihr davon?

Ich brauche Eure Hilfe! Und dafür bekommt Ihr auch so einiges geboten. Ihr könnt ein Shooting bei mir buchen, denn nur im Rahmen dieser Kampagne gibt es diese stark reduzierten Preise. Zum Vergleich könnt ihr gern die normalen Preise unter http://www.laloriel.de/preise einsehen.

Des Weiteren bekommt Ihr im Gegenzug für verschiedene Spenden Prints Eurer Wahl in verschiedenen Größen oder Euer Bild in meinem Stil bearbeitet.
Ich freue mich auch über einfache kleine (oder große ;) Spenden. Dazu müsst Ihr einfach rechts auf den Button "Unterstützen" gehen und könnt dort einen Betrag Eurer Wahl eingeben. Jede kleine Spende hilft mir, meinem Ziel ein Stückchen näher zu kommen.

Mitmachen lohnt sich also auf jeden Fall! Für die Shootings könnt Ihr z.B. nach Dresden in mein Home-Studio kommen oder wir shooten Outdoor an einem Ort Eurer Wahl. Wer sich vor der Kamera unsicher ist und soetwas noch nie gemacht hat, kann sich ganz entspannt fühlen. Ich leite Dich locker an, mache Dir gegebenfalls Posen vor und es werden wunderschöne Bilder entstehen. Gerne komme ich auch zu Dir. Außerhalb Dresdens muss ich dafür dann aber eine Anfahrtspauschale berechnen.

Wenn Du ein Shooting über diese Kampagne buchst, vereinbaren wir schriftlich per E-Mail (info@laloriel.de) oder über meine Facebook-Seite einen Termin. Du musst übrigens nicht warten bis die Kampagne zuende ist. Sobald Du Dich für ein Paket entschieden hast, können wir einen Termin vereinbaren und das Shooting beginnen. Wenn Du selbst nie Make-Up anlegst, das aber für diese Gelegenheit einmal tun möchtest, so kannst Du gern noch das kleine Make-Up-Paket dazubuchen. Dafür schminke ich Dich dann dezent oder auch auffälliger je nach Wunsch für das Shooting.

Was bekomme ich dafür?

Wenn wir das Funding-Ziel erreichen kann ich mir meine Wunschkamera und verschiedenes Equipment finanzieren. Dazu zählen professionelle Studioblitztechnik und ca. 2 hochwertige Objektive.


Wird das Funding-Ziel nicht erreicht so wird erstmal nur die Kamera finanziert. Ich habe mein Auge auf die Nikon D750 geworfen, die momentan bei ca. 1.900,-€ liegt.

Sollte auch dies nicht erreicht werden, so kann wenigstens mit der Summe aufgestockt werden bis zum Kaufpreis. 


Deine Schönheit ist meine Leidenschaft

Diese Kampagne liegt mir sehr am Herzen. In der Portrait-Fotografie habe ich meine Leidenschaft entdeckt. Leider habe ich es noch nicht geschafft, sie "zum Beruf zu machen". Ich habe sie in meine Selbstständigkeit aufgenommen, doch leider trägt sie sich noch nicht selbst und ich musste jetziges Equipment über andere Aufträge finanzieren. Das soll sich nun endlich ändern und sich selbst tragen. Denn ich wage zu behaupten, dass meine Fotos schon ganz gut sind und sich hier etwas wirklich Tolles entwickeln kann.
Meine Nische sind dabei die Plus-Size-Frauen. Sie trauen sich oftmals nicht, weil sie meinen sie wären zu dick oder nicht hübsch. Also habe ich es mir zur Aufgabe gemacht Ihnen zu zeigen, dass sie auf Fotos genauso schön sein können! Und überhaupt möchte ich Frau einfach einmal ihre Schönheit vor Augen führen. Zu oft verliert sie sich im Grau des Alltags und der vielen Aufgaben des Lebens. Meine Fotos sollen sie einmal inne halten lassen. "A moment in time" der Dir für immer bleiben wird!

Fragen zur Kampagne?

Bei Fragen zur Kampagne oder den Shooting-Paketen kannst Du mich gern schriftlich per E-Mail an info@laloriel.de oder meine Facebook-Seite kontaktieren.

Bitte unterstützt mich

Und sei es auch nur eine kleine Spende. Ich freue mich über jeden Beitrag. Wenn Ihr mich unterstützen möchtet, Euch das finanziell aber nicht möglich ist, würde ich mich wahnsinnig freuen wenn Ihr die Kampagne einfach weiterempfehlt. Auf Facebook teilen oder der besten Freundin erzählen. 
Ich freue mich über jegliche Unterstützung.
Es wäre doch gelacht wenn wir gemeinsam das Ziel nicht erreichen können!

story:
Short Summary

Zanmi Lakay has been teaching Photography Workshops in Haiti for over 15 years, from film to digital, providing tools and resources so our students can learn new skills, explore stories from their own point of view, and be part of the modern world.

Jouk Li Jou Kan Foto is an annual Photo Camp offering over 45 students a better future. We bring volunteer photojournalists and other professionals to Haiti to teach and share ideas in a 10-day intensive Workshop where student photographers from Cité Soleil and Jacmel, age 11-21, work together learning how to make photographs, shoot assignments, use computers, and then share their work in a month long exhibition with an opening night community celebration at the Fosaj Art Center in Jacmel.

These students are photo ambassadors learning how to share and inform people about Haiti from a Haitian point of view. In our group discussions, the students talk about important issues affecting their lives such as poverty, trash, sanitation, and the environment. With the simple addition of a camera, and the technical training, children become more a part of their own society to make it better. 

Your support will have a positive and direct impact improving and uplifting their lives, as well as empowering them to promote progress within their own community.

"What can photography do for my life?"

Last year at the end of our second Youth Photo Camp, Djimmy, who is 18 and lives in Cité Soleil, and has also been one of our star students since 2009, asked us, "What can photography do for my life?" He is inspired and wants to be a photographer, and interested in how it can benefit his future.

How will we help him accomplish his dream? This year, we are answering Djimmy's question by incorporating business development curriculum into our Jouk Li Jou Kan Foto schedule to create employment opportunities by establishing a mobile portrait studio that will lead to future photography studios in Haiti, professional training about pathways into social media technology, and including more intensive photography and computer instruction.

Progress is already happening. Another star student, Fedno Lubin, age 20, is now the Photography director at ACFFC (Art Creation Foundation for Children). He has been shooting assignments that include special events, mural installations, and daily activities, and emailing them out weekly since September 2012 utilizing the skills and tools he's received through our Photo Workshops. His enthusiasm is contagious, and we are all very proud of him!

What we need and what you get

Funding is needed to pay for lodging, food, and transportation for photo students to come from Cité Soleil to work together with students in Jacmel. We are hiring two translators and a local driver, all of whom have worked with us during previous Photo Camps.

We need equipment and supplies for the daily progress of the Photo Camp and production of the exhibition including badges, batteries, hard drives, printers, ink, photo paper, and other materials. A fee is given to the gallery, and we sponsor artists and local performers that participate in the opening night community celebration. (See link to our WISH LIST below.)

When you contribute to our program, you are helping Djimmy, Fedno, and all of our students get the vital skills they need to use photography as a means to earn a living, receive critical training to give them an advantage in other endeavors, qualify these youth to have the confidence and the tools to give back to their own communities, and appreciate the beauty and dignity of their own expression. The support we receive from you, our investors, will have a direct impact on the futures of these talented budding photojournalists, and you can receive their photos of life in Haiti on cards, prints, and our limited edition calendars when you make a donation.

The Impact

There is no other program like ours in Haiti. Zanmi Lakay has been supporting street children in Haiti for many years through School Sponsorship and Outreach Programs, along with the Photography Workshops, for youth with no other opportunities available. Our purpose is to improve the lives of these children in whatever ways we can. In our Photography Programs, the camera is our tool, and we're proud of the accomplishments our students have made while learning to use it.

Our Photojournalism students have been published on the New York Times Lens Blog and the Globe and Mail, and have had many exhibits in the U.S. and Haiti.

Every student takes home a camera, and the photographers from ACFFC have continued to make photographs under the leadership of Fedno documenting events, activities, and visitors. Other photographers visiting ACFFC throughout the year supplement the work we began with further fostering of skills and offering new experiences. Zanmi Lakay's Photography Workshops have led the way for the creation of a solid Photography Program at ACFFC.

2013 Jouk Li Jou Kan Foto - July 26-August 6, 2013

Opening Night Reception for the exhibition -Saturday August 3, 2013, at the Fosaj Art Center in Jacmel. 

Check these links to view the students galleries and for information about our past Photo Camps:

2011 Jouk Li Jou Kan Foto

http://www.zanmilakayblog.org/jouk-li-jou-kan-foto-2011-project-overview-and-exhibition-slideshow/

2012 Jouk Li Jou Kan Foto

http://www.zanmilakayblog.org/jouk-li-jou-kan-foto-2012/

 

Other ways you can help

If you believe in what we do, please show your support. Help get the word out and make some noise about how we're improving the lives of youth in Haiti through photography! Share our campaign with your friends, families, and networks directly from the Indiegogo site to give us a wider reach.

There are many other ways you can help. We understand that not everyone has the extra funds to support our project, so each year we create a WISH LIST outlining equipment and supplies we need from working digital cameras and laptops, to batteries and reporting notebooks. Check it out here: http://www.zanmilakayblog.org/

On behalf of all our talented Haitian students and the entire volunteer Jouk Li Jou team, we are incredibly thankful for your support! Mesi Anpil!

story:
This campaign supports my photography site at smugmug which I need to renew at the end of July.

The $500 will more than cover that, but it's the lowest level an indiegogo campaign can be listed at.  Any amount beyond the amount needed to continue paying for my site through July 2014 will go towards my many other photography-related expenses.

I'm offering two different sorts of perks : prints of my travel photos, and prints of my photos of performers (primarily bands.) Images from any of my Travel Galleries can be made into prints. Or, you can ask for a print of one of the band images as a perk for contributing, if you're a fan of Big Bad Bollocks, Left Spine Down, or Hate Dept. s

Anyone else I've photographed who would like photos of themselves also available as a perk to their fans, please let me know, and I will add those photos to my travel photos as images that people can have prints of as perks.

story:
Hieroglyph Photography


Short Summary

Todd Gardiner is a professional photographer in the Seattle area who is known for stunning event photography and portraits.  He often gifts his time at local events related to one of the organizations he works for as a staff photographer.  At one of these events on October 4th, one of his equipment pieces was attached to a light stand in one of the main event areas, and somehow went missing.  Todd offered a no questions asked return policy for the equipment, and it was hoped that it had perhaps just fallen off the stand and/or been misplaced.  Unfortunately after clean up of the event and advertising to the community, the equipment was not recovered.  Todd relies on his photography equipment for paid work he does as an event photographer and the loss of the flash and attached transceiver has an impact on his livelihood.  As he was working this event as a gift to the community, we as a part of his community would like to fund the replacement of that equipment.  

What We Need 

What Todd lost as a result of working this event was a Canon 580EXII flash with a Youngou transceiver.  He paid approximately $600 for this equipment.  If the campaign does not reach the entire goal, the money will go towards a used flash of the same model and will help him to replace the equipment he needs to keep bringing his photography talents to Seattle and many other places.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    If you aren't in a financial position to help right now, please share this campaign on social media and with your friends.  Thanks!
story_txt:
Hieroglyph Photography

Short Summary Todd Gardiner is a professional photographer in the Seattle area who is known for stunning event photography and portraits.  He often gifts his time at local events related to one of the organizations he works for as a staff photographer.  At one of these events on October 4th, one of his equipment pieces was attached to a light stand in one of the main event areas, and somehow went missing.  Todd offered a no questions asked return policy for the equipment, and it was hoped that it had perhaps just fallen off the stand and/or been misplaced.  Unfortunately after clean up of the event and advertising to the community, the equipment was not recovered.  Todd relies on his photography equipment for paid work he does as an event photographer and the loss of the flash and attached transceiver has an impact on his livelihood.  As he was working this event as a gift to the community, we as a part of his community would like to fund the replacement of that equipment.     What We Need  What Todd lost as a result of working this event was a Canon 580EXII flash with a Youngou transceiver.  He paid approximately $600 for this equipment.  If the campaign does not reach the entire goal, the money will go towards a used flash of the same model and will help him to replace the equipment he needs to keep bringing his photography talents to Seattle and many other places.

  
Other Ways You Can Help

 If you aren't in a financial position to help right now, please share this campaign on social media and with your friends.  Thanks!

story:
Welcome to Sucker Punched 3! The first two iterations of Sucker Punched were so well received, we're bringing it back for more! 

For those of you who are back, welcome! Thanks for joining us for another go 'round! 

To those of you who are new to us, come on in! We are FightGuy Photography - a photography studio based in Northern Virginia, specializing in portraits and events. Sucker Punched is one of our babies. 

What is Sucker Punched?

I'm glad you asked! Sucker Punched is a photography series, wherein we take some of the many amazing, talented, inspiring women we know and we give them the SP treatment, a transformation into an original action hero. These women, in cooperation with our creative team, become bad ass, dangerous, gorgeous, iconic figures to match anything you'd find in a comic book or action movie. A character of their own making, an alter ego they get to become. 

Sucker Punched was primarily inspired by the Zack Snyder film, Sucker Punch. When we started doing a few test shoots,matching the tone and style, the project later grew and took on a sense of empowerment and agency. We had a lot of models interested in doing a shoot of this style and a lot of fans interested in seeing more. With great power came great responsibility, so we launched the last two year's campaigns to make a full series of these shoots and connected with RAINN (The Rape Abuse and Incest National Network) to make sure we gave back with this project.

Our goal with Sucker Punched is to present original characters created in the style of powerful archetypes. We've got designs drawn from the best of fiction, local and regional models who will knock it out of the park,  fine photographic skills, and the costumes/hair/makeup/props to bring it all together. The models involved are presented as a celebration of powerful women, dangerous and strong. This is no "bikini babe" project here, quite the opposite really.

More than just a traditional "ladies with weapons in skimpy outfits" project, Sucker Punched is looking to showcase women at their strongest. There is no need to sacrifice femininity for strength. The women of this work are strong, powerful, beautiful and deadly. By subverting and reworking the stereotypical archetypes of "sexy girls" into powerful icons, we create a world where women aren't powerful in spite of their gender, but because of it. The goal is the celebration of empowerment, not debasement.

Drawing from sources large and small - the Valkyrie mythos, Sarah Connor, Johanna Dark, Aeon Flux, The Hunger Games, Kill Bill, Tomb Raider, Firefly, Appleseed, Resident Evil, and many more - we've crafted a series of characters and set ups that we think showcase a strong, solid and fun concept.

When you play a video game or watch a movie, you as the viewer always accompany the hero from behind, facing nameless foes in an agreed battle of your right vs their wrong. It's bloody and you punch your way through and get the girl in the end. In Sucker Punched, you know your female hero, you stand beside her and see her strengths, but the faceless foe is by no means nameless. That foe is abuse, insecurity, discrimination. It's prejudice and doubt and it's a battle women fight daily in the war of life. Sucker Punched is the pictorial upper cut to those shared enemies. Seeing a woman be glorified for her strengths, celebrated for her femininity, and embraced for her willingness to fight is something we as a culture are starved for. Instead of teaching girls to shut up, to make themselves smaller, to only chase boys, we are showcasing a breed of women who can help themselves - no rescue mission needed here. Perhaps seeing a woman who looks like your sister, your girlfriend, or your best friend presented as the bad ass superhero she is on the inside, we can foster an atmosphere of independence and individuality that is grossly lacking in our media.


What We Need and What You Get

Here's the deal:

  • We're looking to raise money to offset our expenses. We need props, costumes, makeup artists and studio time! I'm also very keen on paying the artists who are on board with this project.
  • We're offering you exclusive content including prints, posters, books, calenders, merch and services (Including portrait sessions!) All perks can be found right there ----->
  • We are also donating 10% of all funds raised, now and in the future, to RAINN, to help them in their crusade to defend, educate and empower. 
  • Additionally, a large number of our purchases will be made from small, independent artisans, to help support local businesses and artists. 
Our first time doing this, we raised $2176 to put towards this project (less Indiegogo's fees). $217.60 immediately went to RAINN. The second time, we raised $1863 (less IGG fees) and $183.30 immediately went to RAINN. After RAINN gets their cut, we pour the rest into making the magic happen. 10 characters in season 1 and 12 characters in season 2 were created, built, refined and photographed. We produced prints, calendars, a photo book, mugs, and posters and shipped them all over the country to eager fans. This year we're doubling down. 14 models, plus additional returning models from previous years. We've got big dreams and we want you to be in on them!

SPECIAL MILITARY PERK!

For all active service members, any donation over $15 will include a bonus personalized print and letter from the character of your choice. Just our way of saying "thank you" to all who serve. (Please indicate this when picking your perk)

The Impact

What is this project all about? Well, first, it's a heck of a lot of fun. Moreover, it's a project that creates and promotes a positive message. These characters are feminine and powerful. They have full agency over who they are and what they're doing. In today's world, we can't get enough of that.  Additionally you'll help provide exposure and experience to a number of talented young professionals, dancers, actresses, models, makeup artists and costume designers.

Other Ways You Can Help

Obviously this project isn't everybody's cup of tea, I completely understand that. If you like what we've done, but aren't interested in joining us, we ask that you:

  • Please share this campaign with your friends. Anyone who's into supporting local projects, indie artists, or photography...someone who loves action movies... beautiful women.... Indiegogo provides lots of ways to share the word around.
  • Take a moment to check out RAINN and the good work they do there. 
About FightGuy Photography

    FightGuy Photography was launched in 2010 by Craig Lawrence, a professional actor, stunt man and fight choreographer. Building on his extensive performance skills, particularly in the realm of movement and theatrical violence, Craig set out to develop a photographic style that could capture the energy, grace and story of any subject. FightGuy Photography has worked with a number of different companies and individuals, providing event, promotional and production photography. For more information, contact us through our website www.fightguyphotography.com

    **FightGuy Photography and the Sucker Punched project are not affiliated with Warner Brothers, Legendary Pictures or the film Sucker Punch. The work presented is original material inspired by a number of sources.**

story:
While my first book, CONCORDIA, describes a lost place of entertainment, I dedicate my second book, PYRAMIDEN, to a lost place, which is on the way to becoming a place of entertainment as well. On our first visit in 2015, the mine and the town of PYRAMIDEN were still largely untouched. Only five part-time residents spent their time here in the months of May to September. They were joined by only a handful of adventurers and day-trippers, in rare cases someone stayed overnight.

Während mein erstes Buch CONCORDIA einen untergegangenen Vergnügungsort beschreibt, widme ich das zweite Buch PYRAMIDEN einem untergegangenen Ort, der auf dem Weg ist, zu einem Vergnügungsort zu werden. Bei unserem ersten Besuch im Jahr 2015 waren die Mine und der Ort PYRAMIDEN noch  weitestgehend unberührt. Nur fünf Bewohner verbrachten hier in den Monaten Mai bis September ihre Zeit. Zu ihnen gesellten sich eine Handvoll  Abenteurer und Tagestouristen, in seltenen Fällen blieb mal jemand über Nacht.

Today, the situation on ground is completely different: The refurbished city-hotel is used by numerous visitors and huge ships packed with tourists arrive every day. Buildings are gradually renovated or modernized, the city begins a new, second life. The place is to be further developed in the coming years to a luxury resort - the former decay is replaced by an unthinkable revival. The pictures in the book probably show the original PYRAMIDEN for the last time.

Heute ist die Situation vor Ort eine völlig Andere: Das sanierte Hotel der Stadt wird von zahlreichen Besuchern genutzt und täglich kommen große Schiffe mit Touristen. Die Gebäude werden nach und nach saniert bzw. modernisiert, in der Stadt beginnt zur Zeit ein neues, zweites Leben. Der Ort soll in den kommenden Jahren weiter zu einem Luxusresort ausgebaut werden — der einstige Verfall wird von einem vor wenigen Jahren noch undenkbaren Aufleben abgelöst. Die Bilder im Buch zeigen wohl zum letzten Mal das ursprüngliche PYRAMIDEN.

No pictures of the interior of this mine above the city were to be seen yet! With great effort and risk, we have managed to gain access to this labyrinth and to penetrate unique ice worlds. The mine was closed since decommissioning in 1998, we were the first to enter the facility ever since. What we found was a gigantic pristine time capsule, preserved and transformed by eternal ice.

Bilder aus dem Inneren des Bergwerks über der Stadt gab es bisher nicht zu sehen. Mit großem Aufwand und nicht ohne Risiko haben wir es geschafft, uns Zugang zu diesem Labyrinth zu verschaffen und in einzigartige Eiswelten vorzudringen. Das Bergwerk war seit der Stilllegung 1998 verschlossen, wir waren die Ersten, die seitdem die Anlage betreten haben. Was wir vorfanden, war eine gigantische unberührte Zeitkapsel, konserviert und umgestaltet durch ewiges Eis.

 

 

Two expeditions to Spitsbergen were associated with high logistical, time and above all financial expenses. Design of my artist book PYRAMIDEN is completed, for an uncompromising implementation with the White Press publishing house a financing gap of 4.000 Euro must be closed - therefore we ask you to participate. 5color UV offset printing and a manufacture binding of my upcoming PYRAMIDEN will surpass the craftsmanship of my first book CONCORDIA, I promise! In return, you shall receive: the right side perks, you can browse, order, give away on the right ...
My special note applies to the Indigo PYRAMIDEN book! as a "Best Deal" for all those who are willing to support: This signed book, limited to 100 copies, is exclusively available as part of this campaign and will be shipped beginning of December, before Christmas and 6 weeks before the official book presentation in  Forum für Fotografie, Cologne.

Zwei Expeditionen nach Spitzbergen waren mit hohem logistischen, zeitlichen und vor allem finanziellen Aufwand verbunden. Der Entwurf des Künstlerbuches PYRAMIDEN ist vollendet. Für die kompromisslose Umsetzung mit dem White Press Verlag muss eine Finanzierungslücke von 4.000 Euro geschlossen werden — daher lassen wir Euch teilhaben. 5 Farben UV-Offset-Druck und eine Manufakturbindung meines kommenden Künstlerbuches PYRAMIDEN werden die handwerkliche Qualität meines ersten Buches CONCORDIA noch übertreffen, das verspreche ich!
Im Gegenzug bekommt ihr: Perks, die Ihr rechts sehen, bestellen, verschenken könnt...
Mein besonderer Hinweis gilt dem Indigo PYRAMIDEN Buch! als "Best Deal" für alle diejenigen, die uns unterstützen: Das signierte, auf 100 Exemplare limitierte Buch gibt es exklusiv im Rahmen dieser Kampagne und erreicht Euch Anfang Dezember, vor Weihnachten und 6 Wochen vor der Buchpräsentation im Forum für Fotografie in Köln.

We appreciate any kind of participation: Please share this project with friends, talk about it, post the link and our updates in social media. That, too is a lot of help!

Wir freuen uns über jede Art der Teilnahme, teile bitte dieses Projekt mit Freunden und rede darüber, poste den Link und unsere Updates in sozialen Medien. Auch das hilft uns auch sehr!

 

Update 1 - Cover and Perks

Dear friends and followers, cover design of my photo book PYRAMIDEN is finally displayed and we go to next level: worldwide funding. All remaining perks and posts come bi-lingual ger./en. from now on. All claims stay claimed. Many thanks to all German backers for getting this started. JDK

Liebe Freunde und Follower, das Cover-Design meines Fotobuchs PYRAMIDEN ist final und wir gehen auf das nächste Level: Internationale Verbreitung. Alle verfügbaren Perks sind nun zweisprachig dt./en. Alle Buchungen bleiben erhalten. Vielen Dank an alle deutschen Unterstützer für den tollen Start. JDK

 

Update 2 - New Book Details

Our book is in shape now : Design of content and title are completed in cooperation with the White Press publishing house, the cover design can be seen in the new perk. 
Oversize Landscape Format, 320 x 255mm, 128 pages, 81 photographs full bleed on Condad Perigor paper, 16 pages text ger./en. (colored printed on colored Fly paper) by Hans Christian Andersen, Dr. Christoph Schaden, (historischer Expeditionsbericht) hardcover, printed paper over boards, dustcover, 1,000 copies.

Unser Buch nimmt Form an : Die Gestaltung des Inhalts und des Titels sind nun in Zusammenarbeit mit dem White Press Verlag abgeschlossen, das Cover ist im neuen englischen Perk zu sehen. 
Das Buch wird ein großes Querformat, 320 x 255 mm, 128 Seiten, 81 meist ganzseitige Aufnahmen auf Condad Perigor-Papier, 16 SeitenText dt./en. (farbig auf farbigem Fly-Papier gedruckt) von Hans Christian Andersen, Dr. Christoph Schaden, faden-gebundene Ausgabe, bedruckter Papierüberzug auf 1,5mm Karton, Schutzumschlag, 1.000 Exemplare. 

 

Update 3 - Pyramiden Exhibition

Announcement of PYRAMIDEN presentation and special exhibition within the framework of the German Photo Book Award:
PYRAMIDEN by Jonathan Danko Kielkowski in Forum für Fotografie, in 50968 Cologne, Schönhauser Straße 8, from January 12, 2019, 4:00 pm (vernissage) until February 23rd, 2019.

Ankündigung meiner Buchvorstellung und Sonderausstellung im Rahmen der Präsentation des Deutschen Fotobuchpreises: PYRAMIDEN von Jonathan Danko Kielkowski im Forum für Fotografie, in 50968 Köln, Schönhauser Straße 8, vom 12. Januar 2019, 16:00h (Vernissage) bis 23. Februar 2019.
 

Update 4 - Making-Of Movie

Dear fellows and followers! I'm proud to introduce the final version of our PYRAMIDEN making-of movie:

Liebe Freunde und Unterstützer,
Ich freue mich, endlich den Making-Of Film zu meinem PYRAMIDEN-Buch vorzustellen:

 

Unlike in the book, we reach the underground world only at the end. Be assured, the book will be everything but redundant to the movie.

Anders als im Buch erreichen wir die unterirdische Welt erst zum Schluss. Seien Sie aber versichert, das Buch bringt noch einige Überraschungen zutage.

 

Update 5 - PYRAMIDEN Typography

In coop with Tim Kaufmann, Office for Graphic Design, Nuremberg, the original typography PYRAMIDEN is reconstructed from the original photographs. The font refers to the great graphic tradition of the newborn Soviet Union of the 20s, last century.

Gemeinsam mit Tim Kaufmann, Büro für grafische Gestaltung, Nürnberg wurde aus den Fotos die Originaltypografie PYRAMIDEN rekonstruiert. Die Schrift verweist auf die große grafische Tradition der neugeborenen Sowjetunion der 20er Jahre des letzten Jahrhunderts.

 

Update 6 - Book Dummy Sneak Peek

 

 

 

Update 7

Dear friends and backers,

we made it! Thanks to you, we reached the goal by 102%!
During the next days, my Partners Helge and Thomas will keep you posted with updates on the production process as we progress.
White Press has taken over and supports the project 24/7.
Now again to thank you and I can’t wait to prepare the books for shipping to you.

Cheers,
Jonathan


Liebe Freunde und Unterstützer des PYRAMIDEN Projekts,
wir haben es geschafft! Dank Euch haben wir das Ziel mit 102% erreicht.
In den kommenden Tagen werden meine Partner Helge und Thomas das posten übernehmen, und von den weiteren Aktivitäten der Buch Entstehung berichten.
Die Produktion des Buchs wird jetzt rund um die Uhr von White Press betreut. Das Team wird Euch in den kommenden Tagen auf dem Laufenden halten.
Jetzt nochmals der Dank an Euch und ich freue mich Euch bald Eure Bücher auf den Weg zu schicken.

Euer Jonathan

JDKLiebe Freunde und Follower, das Cover-Design meines Fotobuchs PYRAMIDEN ist final und wir gehen auf das nächste Level: Internationale Verbreitung. Alle verfügbaren Perks sind nun zweisprachig dt./en. Alle Buchungen bleiben erhalten. Vielen Dank an alle deutschen Unterstützer für den tollen Start. JDK Update 2 - New Book DetailsOur book is in shape now : Design of content and title are completed in cooperation with the White Press publishing house, the cover design can be seen in the new perk. Oversize Landscape Format, 320 x 255mm, 128 pages, 81 photographs full bleed on Condad Perigor paper, 16 pages text ger./en. (colored printed on colored Fly paper) by Hans Christian Andersen, Dr. Christoph Schaden, (historischer Expeditionsbericht) hardcover, printed paper over boards, dustcover, 1,000 copies.Unser Buch nimmt Form an : Die Gestaltung des Inhalts und des Titels sind nun in Zusammenarbeit mit dem White Press Verlag abgeschlossen, das Cover ist im neuen englischen Perk zu sehen. Das Buch wird ein großes Querformat, 320 x 255 mm, 128 Seiten, 81 meist ganzseitige Aufnahmen auf Condad Perigor-Papier, 16 SeitenText dt./en. (farbig auf farbigem Fly-Papier gedruckt) von Hans Christian Andersen, Dr. Christoph Schaden, faden-gebundene Ausgabe, bedruckter Papierüberzug auf 1,5mm Karton, Schutzumschlag, 1.000 Exemplare.  Update 3 - Pyramiden ExhibitionAnnouncement of PYRAMIDEN presentation and special exhibition within the framework of the German Photo Book Award:PYRAMIDEN by Jonathan Danko Kielkowski in Forum für Fotografie, in 50968 Cologne, Schönhauser Straße 8, from January 12, 2019, 4:00 pm (vernissage) until February 23rd, 2019.Ankündigung meiner Buchvorstellung und Sonderausstellung im Rahmen der Präsentation des Deutschen Fotobuchpreises: PYRAMIDEN von Jonathan Danko Kielkowski im Forum für Fotografie, in 50968 Köln, Schönhauser Straße 8, vom 12. Januar 2019, 16:00h (Vernissage) bis 23. Februar 2019. Update 4 - Making-Of MovieDear fellows and followers! I'm proud to introduce the final version of our PYRAMIDEN making-of movie:Liebe Freunde und Unterstützer,Ich freue mich, endlich den Making-Of Film zu meinem PYRAMIDEN-Buch vorzustellen: Unlike in the book, we reach the underground world only at the end. Be assured, the book will be everything but redundant to the movie.Anders als im Buch erreichen wir die unterirdische Welt erst zum Schluss. Seien Sie aber versichert, das Buch bringt noch einige Überraschungen zutage. Update 5 - PYRAMIDEN TypographyIn coop with Tim Kaufmann, Office for Graphic Design, Nuremberg, the original typography PYRAMIDEN is reconstructed from the original photographs. The font refers to the great graphic tradition of the newborn Soviet Union of the 20s, last century.Gemeinsam mit Tim Kaufmann, Büro für grafische Gestaltung, Nürnberg wurde aus den Fotos die Originaltypografie PYRAMIDEN rekonstruiert. Die Schrift verweist auf die große grafische Tradition der neugeborenen Sowjetunion der 20er Jahre des letzten Jahrhunderts. Update 6 - Book Dummy Sneak Peek   Update 7Dear friends and backers,we made it! Thanks to you, we reached the goal by 102%!During the next days, my Partners Helge and Thomas will keep you posted with updates on the production process as we progress.White Press has taken over and supports the project 24/7.Now again to thank you and I can’t wait to prepare the books for shipping to you.Cheers,JonathanLiebe Freunde und Unterstützer des PYRAMIDEN Projekts,wir haben es geschafft! Dank Euch haben wir das Ziel mit 102% erreicht.In den kommenden Tagen werden meine Partner Helge und Thomas das posten übernehmen, und von den weiteren Aktivitäten der Buch Entstehung berichten.Die Produktion des Buchs wird jetzt rund um die Uhr von White Press betreut. Das Team wird Euch in den kommenden Tagen auf dem Laufenden halten.Jetzt nochmals der Dank an Euch und ich freue mich Euch bald Eure Bücher auf den Weg zu schicken.Euer Jonathan

story:
Hello and welcome to Falmouth University’s fundraising pledge for the BA (Hons) Photography graduate show for 2014, I hope this message finds you well. As I’m sure you’re aware photography has permeated modern cultural thinking and has become the most democratic form of visual expression available to the public’s art and commercial consumption and our end of degree show, entitled f/14, held at Free Range, Brick Lane in June 2014 is one of the best opportunities to see some of the most varied, talented and eclectic young practitioners currently working today. 

We are the graduating year of BA Photography from Falmouth University 2014 and this is our opporunity to share our work with you the general public which represents not only our dedication our craft but also our desire to share the work with a wider audience, As part of our fundraising efforts we are asking for pledges in order to fund one of the most exciting and ambitious degree shows to date. The money will go towards printing and framing of the work to the highest professional standards as well as a publication catalogue (available in print to purchase) and a short term online web presence that would enable a full gallery of all the student work to be publicized. 

The impact of your patronage will not only enable our 3 years of solid and consistent hard work to reach a platform for which it deserves, but will also allow you to participate and own prints and other rewards from some of the most talented young practitioners to date. By donating, or even sharing our pitch you will be helping to further the exposure of one of the most exciting end of year shows to date as well as helping to further the careers and exposure of a remarkably ambitious cohort of photographers. 

 If you are unable to donate please feel free to come along to the exhibition regardless and enjoy a varied collection of photographic imagery ranging from fine art film practitioners to some of the very best digital, fashion and commercial talent available.
