story:
MECCA METROPOLIS

Greetings, 

My name is Reese. I am a 30 something young professional and mother of 5, born and raised in Columbus, OH and I am a visual artist and photographer.

For several years, I have been on a quest to discover myself and realize my purpose. After working for many years (since age 14) as a customer service rep for several major companies from retail, to banks to satellite providers, I promised myself that I would break free from the world of 9-5 and pursue my passion as an artist and young entrepreneur.

Being a mother, especially of the African American "working class" demographic-the road to success trying to pursue my dreams as a successful full-time artists has been a challenging one. Along the way I have experienced many life lessons as well as beautiful highs and tragic lows. Through it all, I have promised myself and my family that I will never stop and I will never quit.  In the summer of 2012 while dealing with a heavy bout of depression during the start of a trying custody battle, I embarked on a journey to find myself and conquer the monster of depression and a hefty anxiety disorder.

I began to ask the Universe to reveal to me the truth of my existence and to guide me into my calling to help me understand my gifts, fine tune my passion and to usher me into becoming the woman, artist, teacher and mother that I know I was born to be.

In March of 2013-I had a revelation one morning as I sat in my bed during meditation. I had just purchased my first "pricey" camera-a Canon EOS t3i. At the time, it was an expensive purchase. The most I'd ever spent outside of buying a car. I didn't know what I was going to do, all I knew was that I had a passion and undying love for photography since I was a little girl. I began learning black and white photography with a manual Vivitar camera back in 2002 and have been in love ever since. 

That beautiful morning I sat giving thanks for all that I had in that moment and it was then that this far fetch and "crazy" idea came to me...I heard a voice in my head and it said: "You have to go to New York." I said to myself--"What?!" I had always dreamed of going to New York. I'm not an experienced traveler, had no idea where to start and could not imagine just going on a whim. I had day dreamed and watch films and read articles about the architecture, the people, the business the art scene and have even been asked many times if I was from there because of my big energy and flair. But I NEVER thought I'd just-Up and Go....

The next thing I knew, I was booking a Grey Hound ticket and a 4 day hotel stay in SoHo at a hostel on Bowery Street. Somehow, I managed to stretch $350 with $75 to spend and took the trip of a life time. During my stay I walked the city, took the subway and taxi cab like a native, met some of the most AMAZING people and had some of the most life changing experiences and I did alone on a "whim". Or was it?

As I braved the "city that never sleeps"-just me and my camera, I found a new level of self awareness and confidence that I had NEVER known. All of a sudden, the noise and chaos that once riddled my mind had come to a stand still and I felt alive for the very first first time. There I stood, leaning against a skyscraper at the corner of 6th Ave and Avenue of Americas holding a grande chai latte with my camera around my neck, watching what seemed like the WORLD zip and buzz past me going a million miles a minute. In that moment-I found the most overwhelming sense of peace and calm. I had "tapped in".  When I returned home I soon came to the understanding that my experience in NYC was a personal pilgrimage to pay homage to the vibrant energy and essence of artists and photographers that have paved the way for me and many other young, dazed and confused artists alike. I realized that I had just experienced a glimpse of what it was like to be moving in my calling and in my craft with no inhibition.

My trip to NYC not only assisted me in silencing the chaos, it opened me up to a new and refreshing way of thinking. I had epiphany after epiphany on life, what it means to be a creative, an artist, a teacher a leader in the community and most of all--a leader. I even developed a concept for another upcoming community art project and a book for others that struggle with finding themselves in the world.

I humbly introduce to you a project that has been 31 years in the making. A project that gives you a close up and first hand look at my experience, the streets, avenues, sights and life changing moments frozen in time of a culturally, artistically and historically rich city.      

MECCA METROPOLIS

This campaign is designed to raise funds for supplies, equipment, printing, framing, reception space and a follow up trip to catch additional images that I did not get a chance to capture during my brief stay. The funds raised during this campaign will assist me in revealing my story and personal journey as a photographer and will be my introduction to the world during my FIRST gallery exhibition here in my home town by telling my story and experiences as I explore NYC aka The Art Mecca.

I plan to use this showing as the start of a series of works which will include multiple cities across the US and eventually world wide. With your love and contributions, I intend to capture images from major cities across the country and bring them home to share them with other struggling young artists and photo enthusiasts-especially our youth, to be an inspiration and show them that if "If I can make it here, I can make it anywhere." I want to teach them that there is no limit to what we can do and that we ALL can realize our wildest dreams and do amazing things if we just "Listen" to that voice inside that guides you to EXACTLY where you are destined to be.

The Details

I am seeking your help for the following:

  • funding for another brief stay which includes travel and hostel accommodations to shoot more images to add to the collection. (I just couldn't get it all the last time)
  • printing and framing of the pieces for viewing during a cocktail and hors d'oeuvres reception at a well known up and coming gallery here in Columbus
  • a limited series of coffee table photo books and small prints to raise funds for the next pilgrimage and series of images. (Next stop--Chicago)
What you get:
  • A special invitation (for all of you local contributors) to a public Showing event at the gallery with live music, poetry and tasty snacks while you get a first look at the collection which will also be for sale. (All proceed will go towards upcoming projects and ART.Mobile)
  • A signed and numbered 5x7 print of one of my favorite images
  • My deepest and most heartfelt appreciation for making my dreams a reality
  • Please see PERKS for more "Special" goodies for contributions of $50 or more

The Impact

I am just a vessel. You are just a vessel. WE are all--Vessels. 

This is an epiphany that I had during my trip. I realized that we all are creators and creatives buzzing around trying to find our way. For those of us that express ourselves and define our existence and reality through the arts--it can be a hard road. I know first hand the look on people's faces when you tell them that you are an artist (especially here in Ohio). It's not an easy task to gain the trust and respect of others let alone position yourself if you don't come from a well known college or art collective. I am a natural born artist with passion, drive and a desire to reach, teach and motivate others-from toddlers to senior citizens to be the best vessel you can be (no matter your calling ) by listening to that voice within that leads and guides you to serve your higher purpose during this life time.

This will be the PREMIERE of my work to the world and the start of a new chapter of an epic life story that I hope to some day share with my grand children, your children, the kinky haired girl down the way and the young teenager who sees the world in a very unique way.

Risks & Challenges

I.. Am not a quitter.  Whether this campaign is successful or not-I want you to know that it was revealed to me that if I stick to my path and walk with no fear-that the story will be told, lives will be changed and work will be done. 

I have overcome losing my family, battled depression and anxiety, managed to work my way out of homelessness, joblessness, attempted suicide and believing the world was against me. 

Like all things, there will come challenges. But with a level head, a clear mind and an entire COMMUNITY of supporters and FAMILY behind me, I have come to discover that ALL things are possible if you KNOW with molecule of your being that-that voice within is the voice of The Creator whispering to you. Guiding you to do what you born to do. 

Over time I have had the blessing to befriend some amazing people also aspiring to live their dreams as artists, event planners, accountants and managers and I have learned from studying world know entrepreneurs that if there is something that you don't know how to do-find someone with the know how that you can trust to make it happen.

Other Ways You Can Help

So you can't make a contribution today. If what I have shared with you touches you or inspires you.... Just SHARE...Share with everyone that you know. Even the smallest effort will make a difference....

Thank you

story:
WELCOME TO SNAPPPED

I'm Thorsten Haak an experienced Web Developer and Designer. In my very exciting career as a professional Web Developer and Designer I had the possibility to participate in various creative projects where I gained a lot of experience in Web Development and Design.

I've always wanted to use my professional abilities and experience as Web Developer and Designer to start my own creative project which should be useful and dedicated to the general public. As a very passionate photographer I decided to create a new photo community according to my own vision of an exceptional photo community with new innovative features where everyone can simply create a professional and beautiful photography portfolio which will be inspiring and meaningful to photographers around the world.

After the detailed preparations with a few workmates and the very promising design templates we started the development of an awesome new photo community for creative and professional photographers which became Snappped. Snappped is now almost finished after a very exciting development time of 2,5 years and we would like to launch the Snappped Beta in Spring 2014.


WHERE WE ARE

We have already completed the development of Snappped because of the outstanding groundwork in the last 2,5 years and right now we are constantly testing Snappped.

If you would like to see more about Snappped and what we have already created then please visit us on Dribbble: http://dribbble.com/thorstenhaak or like us on Facebook: http://facebook.com/snappped and follow us on Twitter: http://twitter.com/snappped for the latest updates about Snappped.


WHY INDIEGOGO

Snappped is now almost finished because of the outstanding groundwork in the last 2,5 years and we would like to launch the Snappped Beta in Spring 2014. But it will be very difficult for us to launch the Snappped Beta without your support because our financial reserves are exhausted and that's the reason why we need help now to cover the further development costs, web hosting services and other additional expenses which is required and allows us to finally complete Snappped.

1. We secured several domains (snappped.com, snappped.de, snappped.co.uk, snappped.org, snappped.net, snappped.us, snappped.me) for safety reasons and need help to cover the web hosting service expenses.

2. We would like to extend Snappped with a powerful API (Application Programming Interface) which for example will allow members to share their beautiful photography portfolios from Snappped with live updates on their own websites.

3. We are convinced that guidelines and personal rights are very important and should be carefully crafted and created. That's why we would like to hire an experienced lawyer who will help us to create the Terms of Use and Privacy Policy for Snappped.

4. Web security is very important to us and that's why we would like to hire a web security specialist who will help us to improve the security of Snappped.

5. We would like to purchase an authorized SSL (Secure Socket Layer) - Certificate for the important Domain's like http://snappped.com to ensure a secure data communication in the internet which is required to improve the security of Snappped.

6. We would like to extend Snappped with a powerful photo album function whereby members are able to create their own photo albums with beautiful photos created by creative and professional photographers from around the world.


THANK YOU

We really appreciate every support and help we receive and if you can't support us with a financial contribution you can still become an important part of Snappped and help us to create an awesome new photo community for creative and professional photographers.

Please help us spread the word and share our Snappped Indiegogo campaign with your friends and family, and like us on Facebook: http://facebook.com/snappped follow us on Twitter: http://twitter.com/snappped and Dribbble: http://dribbble.com/thorstenhaak and Behance: http://behance.net/thorstenhaak for the latest updates, and subscribe on Snappped: http://snappped.com to the Snappped Beta. Thank You!

We would like to extend Snappped with a powerful photo album function whereby members are able to create their own photo albums with beautiful photos created by creative and professional photographers from around the world.THANK YOUWe really appreciate every support and help we receive and if you can't support us with a financial contribution you can still become an important part of Snappped and help us to create an awesome new photo community for creative and professional photographers.Please help us spread the word and share our Snappped Indiegogo campaign with your friends and family, and like us on Facebook: http://facebook.com/snappped follow us on Twitter: http://twitter.com/snappped and Dribbble: http://dribbble.com/thorstenhaak and Behance: http://behance.net/thorstenhaak for the latest updates, and subscribe on Snappped: http://snappped.com to the Snappped Beta. Thank You!

story:
Hello, 

Amateur photographer since always, I want to become a professional and wants to create a show to let me know. 

I am disabled adult and that is why I have very little money. 

This budget represents the cost of printing photos as well as their managers, purchasing all materials for presentation, protection and transportation pictures. And also the cost of advertising, publishing flyers for example. 

With the help of a friend, this budget should also allow the online web site.


Bonjour,

Photographe amateur depuis toujours, je souhaite devenir professionnel et souhaite créer une exposition afin de me faire connaitre.

Je suis adulte handicapé et c'est pourquoi je n'ai que très peu de moyens financiers.

Ce budget représente les frais d'imprimerie des photos et aussi leurs cadres, l'achat de tout le matériel permettant la présentation, la protection et le transport des photos. Et aussi les frais de publicités, édition de flyers par exemple. 

Avec l'aide d'un ami, ce budget devrait permettre également la mise en ligne d'un site web.

And also the cost of advertising, publishing flyers for example. With the help of a friend, this budget should also allow the online web site.Bonjour,Photographe amateur depuis toujours, je souhaite devenir professionnel et souhaite créer une exposition afin de me faire connaitre.Je suis adulte handicapé et c'est pourquoi je n'ai que très peu de moyens financiers.Ce budget représente les frais d'imprimerie des photos et aussi leurs cadres, l'achat de tout le matériel permettant la présentation, la protection et le transport des photos. Et aussi les frais de publicités, édition de flyers par exemple. Avec l'aide d'un ami, ce budget devrait permettre également la mise en ligne d'un site web.

story:
Hello! My name is Laura Nichols Stanley of Laura B Photography. I've been taking photos for friends and families for 3 years now, but my passion for photography did not start there. My love for photography started many years ago through my love of my father's photos. As a child and teenager I was an artist, drawing sketches of everything I could see and imagine; leading me to study Art at Morehead University. As I have grown in age and experience, so too have my abilities to see beauty and art in everything around me. I turned to photography as a way to preserve that beauty, to look back on it whenever I wanted. I love being able to offer this to my clients; to capture moments of love and happiness for them to treasure. In this way, a little part of me is carried with each person and each family. I love knowing that when they look back at those images, it was I that saved those moments for them. I offer my services for families, high school seniors, expecting mothers, newborns, pets, and much more!  

By contributing to Laura B Photography you will be helping me push forward toward my dream of being able to focus all of my time, attention, and talent on this business. You will be donating funds toward the purchase of higher quality equipment, which will allow me to surpass the limitations of my current equipment and be able to offer the best quality photographs possible to my clients. Therefore, allowing me to build a larger client base, making it possible to establish photography as my career. Everyone dreams of turning their passion into their career, you can help me do this. Thank you! 


Testimonials:

Beth M.-  "Love, love, love the photos that Laura took for my Fiance and I. Laura is very professional and creative. She allowed us to pick our location and even suggested a few that we hadn't even thought about. I love looking at our photos and everytime I do, I am always impressed on how they turned out. She captured the naturalness of our relationship and those quirky moments that make you who you are. I absolutely recommend her everytime I hear someone wants some photos done."

Jenny T.- "The photographs that Laura has taken of my family are simply beautiful. She is truly gifted, especially with children. I recommend her to anyone I can, and we will never use anyone else again. Thank you Laura, for making my family come to life!"

Anna N.- "Laura takes amazing photos. She knows how to make your families true selves shine through her pictures. No stiff old poses. She catches the life in you and your loved ones."

Mary M.- "Laura, Angel Rose was one of your first efforts. Her pictures are still beautiful and we have enjoyed watching your talent blossom over the years...well, it has only been three years, but I can only imagine what you will be like in the next three years."

Hannah K.- "If anyone out there every ever needs any photos I highly recommend Laura Nichols Stanley with Laura B Photography. She EXCEEDED all my expectations I ever had of how good my senior pictures could look. She has an artistic eye. She made me feel comfortable and made me look beautiful. Thank you very much!"

Amy K.- "Just have to say a HUGE THANK YOU! Laura Nichols Stanley,you made my daughter and myself so very happy. You are a true artist behind the camera. Her brother even said she was beautiful and that is saying something for a sibling...lol. Would gladly refer all my friends and family. We will be back. If you ever need a recommendation, you have us!"

Linda M.- "You did my 2 granddaughters Senior pics and they were awesome! Your the best Laura I would never have anyone else do special photos!"

Cassie C.- "Girl...you sure have the touch! I have seen so many pics that you've done that are just amazing! Everyone I recommended you to has used you and has been so very happy with their pics! i just wanted you to know that you are doing an amazing job and keep it up!!"

story:
About Us:
3rd Year Photography students from Swansea (University of Wales Trinity Saint David) are creating an end of year degree show, to take place in London, in June, we greatly need your help to make this a success. 
All the students participating in the exhibition are dedicated and passionate about photographic art, having developed their practice for the last three years we are very excited about the high standard of work which is being created and will be exhibited with your help. 

Funding:
The money raised will go towards the cost of the venue and if we exceed our goal we would like to put money towards an exhibition catalogue and other marketing materials. 
All students participating have donated a sum of their own money, the university is also making a contribution and as a team we are organising various fundraising events such as bake sales, quiz's and print sales, but we need your help too! 
Donating towards our cause will ensure a high standard exhibition for everyone to enjoy, an important milestone in our photographic careers which we would love to utilize to its full potential and you can be a part of that too.

Perks/Rewards:
Our perks include custom high quality prints of your choice, in postcard and print format, an exhibition catalogue; including statements and images from all photographic artists exhibiting, and an honourable mention at the exhibition opening, check them out. 

Image Gallery:
Take a look at some of the stunning work by the students in our image gallery or on our facebook page and see for yourself the incredible talent on offer.

Spread The Word:

If can't donate, that doesn't mean you can't help, please share our campaign on social media sites and spread the word, if you think there might be any other way in which you can contribute please don't hesitate to get in contact, we'd love to hear from you.

Thank you for your time, your contribution will help to make this possible.

story:
What I will thank you with

If you donate even just a dollar to this campaign you are very, very generous, and to reward you for that I will be glad to offer you some of my pictures in exchange. Check out the perks to see what the donations correspond to, and the video to see a sample of my pictures. 

I chose flexible funding because in case I don't reach the exact amount I will put it in a savings account and find the job next summer to pay the rest

story:
The idea for this project came to mind after much deliberation of how we could use photography to positively change peoples life and to make something that is bigger than ourselves.

We didn't want to create a traditional photo project where a photographer goes to a remote location, take some snaps of some exotic people to come back and show it to his friends as a piece of decoration on the coffee table. We wanted our project to be about the people and for the people and their places and trying to find a way to make our pictures benefit their lives.

So we started thinking and researching online on similar projects where people used art as tool for social change. and we discovered there are quite a few of them around, so we decided to take a different track on our concept.

That’s when it hit us: It was pretty simple, so here is what we are going to do: We will go to places where people have no or very little access to a camera. And we will take professional portraits of the people in those places. Then we will use a portable Polaroid printer to print these peoples pictures and give it back to them. So they can treasure their memories for ever.

I mean, think about the significance of a family portrait. Think about the amount of memories and feelings your family photos bring you. I know this because this is what I do for a living. That moment in time that is never coming back is priceless.

Now imagine if you didn’t have any moments like this to remember. If you grew up with no cameras or if your family could never afford to get their pictures taken.

If your house was on fire and you could only take one thing out of the house what would it be? If you answered "family photo album" you already understand what this project is about.

So our proposal is to take as many pictures of people as we can, our focus is not on the "misery and poverty award winning sad photos". We want to take photos that give people a sense of identity, pictures that bring them joy, pictures that they can keep for generation to come. Pictures like the ones below that I have taken in previous photo travel expedition. (If you would like to see more please visit www.nandoazevedo.com)

But on my previous trips I had no way of giving those pictures back to the people right on the moment. I mean, I could leave a roll of film with them or a CD but most of them wouldn't know what to do with that, I have sent back some of my pictures before but the reality is I can never be sure if they ever reach their destination.

But now with these Polaroid they can see and touch their pictures right there and then. but also keep them for years and years. And we will be able to be there and witness and record their reactions.

in fact we are filming the entire trip and making a webshow on it. You can follow on my website www.nandoazevedo.com just click the JOURNAL section.

We are starting our project on June 2013 in Bangkok, Thailand, and from there we will make our way trough Burma, Bangladesh, Bhutan, India, Nepal & Sri Lanka, China, Vietnam, Laos & Cambodia.

The trip is happening no matter what, The tickets are bought and the backpacks are pretty much packed. The contribution we are asking for is just to help us get more of this ZINK POLAROID PAPER, a few extra batteries for the printer so we can print more and more pictures for more and more people, and a bit of money for unexpected travel expenses. We are equipped with all the necessary camera gear and skill to do it.

There is no limit, the more contribution we have the more people will have photos to treasure.

Make sure to check our perks list. and please please please spread the word, maybe if you can’t help someone else can. And if you can’t help with money contributions contact us if you know any groups in any of these countries we are visiting that would benefit from having their pictures taken.


I hope that by now you are as keen as we are to get this project going. So thank you very much and we’ll see you in Asia.

story:
PROJECT INTRODUCTION

Hi, my name is Abby and I am photographer. Over the past 6 months, I have been working on a project called ‘in.visible’ together with the HOPE CENTER in Faribault, Minnesota. ‘In.visible’ is a project about stories. We all have stories to tell - I believe that is one of the reasons that make us unique as human beings. The stories we have to tell make us who we are. 

‘In.visible’ is about the stories of 5 brave women who at one point in their lives experienced sexual assault and/abuse. 6 months ago, I conceptualized ‘In.visible’ as an image-making project intended to advocate for greater awareness of sexual assault and abuse as well as provide an outlet of healing and validation for the women. I believe strongly that for healing to begin and continue for women , who have these experiences, we must allow these stories to be spoken openly. As a community, we must be willing to listen attentively. In.visible is committed to provide and outlet for these deeply wounded women to tell their stories.

I have been working with these women: listening to their stories, interacting with them and photographing their lives. These images along with short films will be displayed at a multi-media art installation and exhibit held from the 29th April to 10th May at Carleton College, Northfield, Minnesota. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

I am three quarters through my project and almost done photographing most of the women. In my project, I used both film and digital photography that involved experimental methods as well as digital video.

However, for the exhibit to happen, I need funds to help with printing and additional materials that will go to making the exhibit possible. In the not so distant future, I also hope to publish these images in a book.

**Check out the reward section for what you will receive if you donate generously to this project! ----->

 

I am raising $5000 for this project:

** NOTE: if more than $5000 is given, it will help to cover the administrative costs that will go into using indiegogo to fundraise!

  • $800 - 35mm black an white film, darkroom materials, paper to make black and white film prints, additional materials to make experimental prints on materials like glass and wood.
  • $200 - polaroid films and necessary equipment for exploring experimental methods using polaroid film
  • $2000 - digital printing, inks, professional printing paper.
  • $2000 - final touches on the images in preparation for exhibit, framing, matting, video-equipment to display the videos

If it pleases you, please give generously to this project. It will go a long way to helping validate the stories of these women and also help other women to speak up about their experiences. 

** This project is done under the HOPE CENTER and your donations qualify for tax deductions. 

*** If you donate $500, you will receive one framed art work from Rose Johnson.

SAMPLE OF ROSE JOHNSON's ART WORK:

*** If you donate $800, you will receive one framed art work from Chloe Mark.

SAMPLE OF CHLOE MARK'S ART WORK:

 

 

The Impact

Contributing to this project will greatly validate the stories and the healing process of these women. It will encourage women in similar circumstances who view this exhibit to speak up about their experiences. This exhibit will not only be a testament to how far these women have come but also provide hope and healing for other women.
 

Other images

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please tell all your friends about this exhibit!! Even if you can't come for the exhibit, there will be digital copies of the documentation and films you will receive if you donate to this project. Your donation will also allow you receive actual art work made for the exhibition. I am willing to ship these art works internationally without any additional costs :)
 
If you have any questions or further comments please email me at: abigail.hanyi@gmail.com

story:
Who ?

Born and raised in Crete, I studied architecture in Thessaloniki, currently living & working in Crete. I 'm inspired by the works of Sam Peckinpah, Akira Kurosawa, Luis Buñuel, Nikos Kazantzakis, Weegee, Diane Arbus, Cristobal Hara, Martin Parr, Mark Cohen and others.

Links :

  • dirty blog​
  • iN-PUBLiC
  • info here​

​

​

Midtown Manhattan, 2014

What ?

I asked two of my favorite childhood books to help me put my thoughts together on paper; 'Warn'd in Vain' - the book of this campaign - is a NYC story inspired by the Argonautic myth. It is a twin book of 'Back to Nowhere', a parallel Minotaur tale from Crete, hopefully to be published at some moment in the future.

 

Williamsburg, 2015

'Warn'd in Vain' book :

  • photographs & design by dirtyharrry
  • A5 size
  • 116 color images from NYC in 160 pages
  • the campaign is about an edition of 1000 copies, the final number of copies might be less depending on the final amount raised

 

Downtown Manhattan, 2015

Where  / When?

'Back to Nowhere' was made between 2009-2017 in Crete;  the only place I 'll never have the chance to see how it looks in the eyes of a stranger.

'Warn'd in Vain' is a stranger's questionmark inside the world's most photographed city; made between the years 2014-2017 that I spent 7 months on the other side of the ocean.

 

Ground Zero, 2016

Why ?

I never considered photography as a project or a hobby, I always felt it is a world of no borders & limits or a motive that could keep me moving towards this world. With these 2 books I would like to put aside what I did in the last 10 years and try to move forward.

 

Queens , 2017

How ?

Since I got back from NYC last year I started editing & designing these 2 books, now I 'm trying to self-publish the first one through this fundraising campaign.

    The code-name objects described below - Indiegogo calls them 'perks' -  can be purchased from the list on the right side of this webpage.

    1. 'IOLCUS' : a 'WARN'D IN VAIN' standard copy  /  40$ early bird (100 total items​)
    2. 'COLCHIS ' :  a 'WARN'D IN VAIN' signed standard copy + a [10*15 cm] signed print + 25% discount for the future 'BACK TO NOWHERE' standard book  /  50$​ (200 total items​)
    3. 'SAMOTHRACE' :  a 'WARN'D IN VAIN' signed standard copy + a [15*20 cm] signed print + the hand made signed 'PHRIXUS' dummy booklet (A6 size, 32 pages with 21 B-side extra images) + 50% discount for the future 'BACK TO NOWHERE' book /  100$ (100 total items​)
    4. 'CORINTH' :  a 'WARN'D IN VAIN' white cover signed copy ( 50 numbered copies ) + a 'WARN'D IN VAIN' signed standard copy + the hand made signed 'ELLI' dummy booklet (A5 size, 32 pages with 21 B-side extra images) + 2 [15*20 cm] signed prints + the future 'BACK TO NOWHERE' standard book  /  300$​ (40 total items​)

    ​

    PLEASE CONSIDER THE FOLLOWING NOTES :

    A.'WARN'D IN VAIN' will be referred as 'W.I.V' in the perk list & 'BACK TO NOWHERE' as 'B.T.N'

    B.'Every item described & related to 'BACK TO NOWHERE'  (B.T.N. discount codes inside 'COLCHIS' & 'ERYX' perks ,  B.T.N. copies inside 'CRETE' & 'THERMODON' perks and prints inside THERMODON' perks) will be activated and sent at the time the B.T.N. book will be published in the future, hopefully after 1-2 years. The 'W.I.V' related items of these perks if this campaign is successful of course will be shipped this year with all the rest 'W.I.V' items.

    C.'All copies & prints are signed, except the 'Samothrace' early bird copies 

    D.'Shipping is included in the above prices. After the end of this campaign the standard 'W.I.V' book will be sold with an extra addition of the shipping to each destination) 

    E.'If the campaign is successful, the book and other items described (with the restriction of note B above) will be shipped at a time near December 2018

    F.'With the purchase of any of the above items your name linked to your instagram account  will be mentioned in this thanking list in dirty blog.

     

    Uptown Manhattan, 2016

    If ?

    This campaign will run with the 'fixed funding' (all or nothing) way; if it doesn't reach its goal, I 'll have to find other ways to make the book, since the printing/transfer/shipping costs are more than what I can fund by myself. Making the 'Warn'd in Vain' book with the help of this campaign will be a first step for the future printing of  'Back to Nowhere' too. By backing this campaign you will be charged only if the campaign reaches its goal. Any help by purchasing something from the items described above or spreading the word about this campaign is much appreciated.

     

    Thank you

    h.

     

    Midtown Manhattan, 2016

     

    Some words by Gus Powell from a 2016 Time magazine article :

      ' I had a great uncle Frank “Yaki” Yakimovich whom I met only once at a family reunion in 1982. He was what you call a rock hound. I remember he led me to his faded Arizona car, opened the trunk, and pulled out a roundish rock, a hammer, and a chisel. With a single strike, he cracked open the rock. The center was luminous with crystals. “It’s a geode!” Uncle Yaki put it in my hand. I stared at it, and at him, and then back at the rock. My eight-year-old mind was blown. I have never looked at a rock the same way. The work of Charalampos “Harry” Kydonakis makes me think of geodes and the wonder I felt when I first encountered them. Harry doesn’t use photography to stop time and describe space. He uses his camera and flash like a hammer and chisel to crack open time and space. He shows you what was there, and then he shows you a bit more than what was there. The work has some of the moody beauty I see in Gueorgui Pinkhassov, the deep regional and narrative integrity I feel from Cristóbal Hara, and the raunchy dark comedy of late Philip Guston. When Harry, who is known as “dirty harrry” online, speaks about his photographs he talks about “his island” and “his village.” He talks about girls, animals, and shadows. The pictures have details that repel and attract; they have a smell, they have a breeze. The more you look at the work, the more you think that there is indeed an island, a village, that looks like this all the time. A place where faces go black or are lit from below, where animals and kites appear unexpectedly, where people from the present, past, and future mingle. His pictures flirt with the ironic, at times they border on the insane, and yet the car stays on the road... I believe in this place, Kydonakis’ island, pictures that make me feel like I’m moving back and forth between the concrete and the imagined, revealing depths that surprise and inspire. I believe that Kydonakis knows how to find and open geodes. '

       

      Downtown Manhattan 2015

       

      PS : Special thanks to Fotoğrafevi in Istanbul, Gölnur Cengiz & Gökseli Cengiz, Gus Powell, iN-PUBLiC, Pavlos Fysakis, Adonis Volanakis, Barış Altan & Özgün Forta, Elena Mamoulaki, Engin Güneysu, Yorgos Yatromanolakis, Natalie Matutschovsky, Kenneth Bachor, Stelios Kalogerakis, Giorgis Kapelonis, Void in Athens, my family, friends and all the people I never met and stood by me along the way.

       

      Brooklyn Bridge 2015
story_txt:
Who ?Born and raised in Crete, I studied architecture in Thessaloniki, currently living & working in Crete. I 'm inspired by the works of Sam Peckinpah, Akira Kurosawa, Luis Buñuel, Nikos Kazantzakis, Weegee, Diane Arbus, Cristobal Hara, Martin Parr, Mark Cohen and others.Links :

dirty blog​
iN-PUBLiC
info here​

​​Midtown Manhattan, 2014What ?I asked two of my favorite childhood books to help me put my thoughts together on paper; 'Warn'd in Vain' - the book of this campaign - is a NYC story inspired by the Argonautic myth. It is a twin book of 'Back to Nowhere', a parallel Minotaur tale from Crete, hopefully to be published at some moment in the future. Williamsburg, 2015'Warn'd in Vain' book :
photographs & design by dirtyharrry
A5 size
116 color images from NYC in 160 pages
the campaign is about an edition of 1000 copies, the final number of copies might be less depending on the final amount raised
 Downtown Manhattan, 2015Where  / When?'Back to Nowhere' was made between 2009-2017 in Crete;  the only place I 'll never have the chance to see how it looks in the eyes of a stranger.'Warn'd in Vain' is a stranger's questionmark inside the world's most photographed city; made between the years 2014-2017 that I spent 7 months on the other side of the ocean. Ground Zero, 2016Why ?I never considered photography as a project or a hobby, I always felt it is a world of no borders & limits or a motive that could keep me moving towards this world. With these 2 books I would like to put aside what I did in the last 10 years and try to move forward. Queens , 2017How ?Since I got back from NYC last year I started editing & designing these 2 books, now I 'm trying to self-publish the first one through this fundraising campaign.The code-name objects described below - Indiegogo calls them 'perks' -  can be purchased from the list on the right side of this webpage.

story:
Change is good...

 

Earlier this year I got together with my best friend (a photographer in  my area) with the intent on pushing our careers to the next level. Me as a model and designer, and he as a photographer.

Unfortunately, after I decided to pick up a camera of my own to add another layer of variety to the content, misunderstandings and petty arguements arose. Breaking our 2 year long working relationship and subsequently our friendship as well.

As sad, frustrated and angry as I was I didn't want to let anyone down. After dealing with threats of legal action, fights over rights and wishy-washy investors, I was left carrying the full load of the financial and creative load.

I bear it happily!

Since then I have been able to collect several interviews, taken tons of photos and have 2 issues laid out. My goal is to have 4 done before releasing #1 so I am ahead of the game (since the content isn't dated material).

I am currently heah-hunting for consistant contributors for writing and photography as well as interesting people to interview.

I learned a lot about th behavior of people and the law. Now I have a better understanding of what an undertaking like this is and I am better prepared than ever to tackle it.

So thank you to everyone who has helped thus far and an future investors, and fans!

-Nikki Forte

story:
Beauty In Hell is an award winning, independent reportage and a personal photographic dream created to find and document the beauty present in some of the most difficult, poverty stricken and dangerous realities around the world.

My name is Tony Corocher and I am a documentary and fine art photographer.

BEAUTY IN HELL is a critical and personal artistic response to an increased awareness of living in a system that uses drama everywhere. I believe we are now unconsciously accustomed to consider an event interesting and noteworthy only if it contains some form of strong contrast, therefore if it is dramatic.

Without drama there is no news and everything becomes boring, dull and almost unworthy of our attention… we use drama to create sensationalism. But Drama is just one part of the story… if drama becomes the only thing mainstream media covers and the only thing we hold up, what can we expect to grow from it?

With Beauty In Hell I want to to express, through artistic sensibility, exactly the opposite and show that beauty within the human spirit is always present, in every situation, even in the most difficult and dangerous realities around the world.

Find and follow us:
Official Website | Twitter | Facebook | Instagram

BEAUTY IN HELL was born as a dream, and I’ve spent the last 3 years developing it, injecting all of my passion and experience in to it, and dealing with the associated risks and dangers.

  • In 2011 I started the project by researching and documenting everyday situations in Vietnam, Kenya and Nepal .
  • In 2012-13 I documented beauty inside the frightening realities of the Mathare and Kibera slums (Nairobi, Kenya), of the refugee camps in North Kenya and other hard situations in the Middle East and Asia (more info and a backstage video about Mathare and Kibera Slums at the end of this page).
  • Last year BEAUTY IN HELL received several international awards and was exhibited in venues around the world (more info and a video about the awards and the exhibitions at the end of this page).

This recognition has helped me realize that, maybe, we are finally ready to see things from a different perspective … THAT OF BEAUTY! And not just through the lens of drama, which breeds fear, which in turn breeds drama... a vicious circle that needs to be exposed and stopped!

Starting next January, and during the course of 2015, I will be documenting the beauty in difficult and dangerous realities across Asia. At the moment the selected stages are in Vietnam, Cambodia, Myamar, Bangladesh, Nepal/Tibet, China/Mongolia.

Unfortunately, it is not possible for me to explain exactly where, when and what the exact situations are. As I am sure you will understand, for reasons concerning security, safety and to avoid further risks for both me and my guides, these situations cannot be revealed until they have been fully documented and the work is finished.

It is essential that each and every situation develops in a spontaneous, true and natural way… and one of the best ways to do this is to come across them unexpectedly, in order to find the story while you are there, directly from the local people and everyday situations.

Beauty In Hell is an ongoing project, and this is our first IndieGoGo campaign developed to raise the funds needed to produce the new artwork for the BEAUTY IN HELL Photographic Exhibition that will be held in galleries and venues around the world in 2015-16.

At present we have received availability from venues in Venice, Milan, Switzerland & USA (we will keep you informed of new venues with regular updates).

The final objective remains that of informing and raising awareness of these desperate situations, but at the same time we want to do so in a different way... we are committed to showing that beauty, humanity and real people matter… not just drama! This is what we believe defines all of us.

First of all, we ask you to believe in us and in the Project, as we do. To accomplish the next step, to be able to travel to the locations, document and show you new realities, we now need external support too… YOUR SUPPORT!

If you love photography, if you care about independent photojournalism or if you simply appreciate what BEAUTY IN HELL stands for, we hope you will join us in our attempt to show the power of Beauty over drama and sensationalism!
Help us recognize that Beauty! that Humanity! and the truth that real people matter!

EVERY SINGLE DONATION REALLY COUNTS… EVEN SMALL ONES ARE VITAL!

We ask for the support of the press, from photographers, from editors, from educators and schools, from professionals in every field… You are the recommendations we need and count upon!

Each Contributor will support the project in two parallel ways:

  • On an artistic and personal level: by helping us develop the new Artwork for the traveling Exhibition.
  • On a social, educational and cultural level: by exposing frequently overlooked  realities and bringing awareness to difficult situations around the world.

At the same time every Contributor will receive one or more of our artistic reward and become a collector too (see perks and rewards in the next chapters).
In fact, the Unique Copy & Limited Edition Prints from last year’s campaign have now become collectors' items. For more info and details please visit:
- http://tonycorocher.com/photo-blog (articles & news about my work)
- http://beautyinhell.com/exhibitions (Awards & Exhibitions page)
- http://tonycorocher.com/beauty-in-hell-prints (Details about the Fine Art Prints)

I believe that we can’t ask you for donations if we are not also willing to personally invest in this project. We put our own money, work, experience, resources, passion and knowledge in to it, and will be doing the rest of the work ourselves.


WHAT WE NEED NOW IS TO RAISE AT LEAST 30 THOUSAND US$ WITHIN THE FIRST DAYS OF FEBRUARY 2015 in order to pay for flights/travel, living costs, documents, visas, local guides, medical/safety requirements and insurance for 2 people, plus the live costs of production on location, registration to  international awards and costs for the photographic Exhibitions.

The realistic amount needed to cover a project like this and ensure a professional, high quality output, is approximately 50 thousand US$.
A large chunk of this sum (20,000 US$) has already been covered by us and our work (initial research, editing & post-production, social networks, hosting, website, equipment and more).

IMPORTANT: This budget does not include any compensation for us. All donations will be used only to finance, support and complete the project.

The process is very simple! Just select the perk you prefer and click on it! You will be taken to a details page. From here follw the online instructions:
1. Click on“CONTINUE TO PAYMENT”
2. Click on“GO TO PAYPAL”

Once on the Paypal page you can contribute either by using your Paypal account or your Credit Card. THE ENTIRE PROCESS IS PROTECTED, VERY SAFE AND EXTREMELY FAST.

INDIEGOGO is TRUSTe Certified, and have been an accredited member of the Better Business Bureau (BBB) since 2012.

  • BY MAKING SOME NOISE ABOUT THE CAMPAIGN!
    Get the word out and make some noise about our Beauty In Hell campaign. Convince a friend to get involved and support us with a donation... even a very small one. Share the video, the campaign, the website (www.beautyinhell.com), the Facebook page  (https://www.facebook.com/BeautyInHell) with friends, family and colleagues.
  • BY CONNECTING AND REPORTING TO US! Your help in providing us with research, information and direct contacts on location is extremely important... especially when relevant to difficult/hard situations you are familiar with and that we may be able to document.

We have great PERKS and INCENTIVES for you... one or more for each contribution.

From the official Beauty In Hell 2015 pins/magnets, to tickets to the opening of the Exhibition, to photographic e-books, to signed high quality Collectors' Photobooks, to photographic workshops personalized to your needs with myself as tutor, to very Limited Edition and Unique Copies Fine Art Collectors' Prints, and lots more.

A full and detailed list of the Perks is available on the right side of this page.


WHO AM I
Tony Corocher (Treviso, Italy – 1974) – Documentary/Fine Art photographer & Art Director based in Italy. I’ve spent the last 20 years switching between graphic design and photography while working in different locations around the world. In the last 2 years my photographic work (documenting humanitarian situations) has been recognized by various international awards and exhibited in venues around the world.
For a full BIO and more info please refer to:

Personal Website | LinkedIn | Facebook | Download CV/Resumè

THE TEAM
The team behind BEAUTY IN HELL is composed by a few very special individuals. People with professional backgrounds in different fields who believed in me and in the project from the very start. These individuals, also personal friends of mine, have sustained me in many different ways and helped develop the project over the years.


For a full list of International Awards, Prices & Exhibitions obtained by the Beauty In Hell Project during 2013-2014 click here.



Giving up the safety and comfort of my home to go into these difficult situations is not an easy task and the risks involved are quite high. But when I look back at the work produced in the last 2-3 years in Africa (www.beautyinhell.com) and the recognitions obtained, I know that what we can bring back and what we’ll be able to show you is well worth the risks and sacrifices, and maybe, will help us understand a bit more of what is going wrong in our modern society.


Beauty In Hell è un reportage indipendente, vincitore di diversi premi internazionali e, allo stesso tempo, un sogno fotografico personale sviluppato negli anni con l’obiettivo di trovare e documentare la bellezza presente in alcune delle realtà più difficili, povere e pericolose al mondo.

Mi chiamo Tony Corocher e sono un fotografo documentarista e fine art.

BEAUTY IN HELL nasce come critica personale e risposta artistica alla consapevolezza di vivere all’interno di un sistema che fa uso del dramma in tutto. Noi ormai ci siamo inconsciamente abituati a considerare una cosa interessante e degna di nota solo se contiene dei forti contrasti, quindi se è drammatica.

Senza dramma non c’è notizia e tutto diventa noioso… utilizziamo il dramma per fare sensazionalismo. Ma il dramma è solo una parte della storia…. se il dramma diventa la sola cosa che i media ci trasmettono e quindi la sola cosa a cui facciamo riferimento, che cosa possiamo aspettarci di diverso dal prossimo futuro?

Con “BEAUTY IN HELL” voglio esprimere, attraverso la sensibilità artistica, esattamente l’opposto e mostrare che la bellezza dentro lo spirito umano è sempre presente, in ogni situazione, anche quando le condizioni sono veramente drammatiche e i luoghi molto duri e difficili.

Potete seguirci su:
Official Website | Twitter | Facebook | Instagram

BEAUTY IN HELL è nato come sogno personale 3 anni fa… è stato sviluppato, finanziato e portato in mostra con le mie forze iniettandoci tutta la mia passione e la mia esperienza, e affrontando i rischi e pericoli correlati (e anche con l’aiuto in vari campi di alcune persone a me vicine in diversi paesi).

  • Nel 2011 ho iniziato il progetto svolgendo ricerche e raccogliendo documentazione in Vietnam, Kenya e Nepal.
  • In 2012-13 ho documentato la bellezza dentro le spaventose realtà delle baraccopoli di Mathare e Kibera (Nairobi, Kenya), i campi profughi nel Nord del Kenya ed altri luoghi molto duri in Medio Oriente ed Asia (più informazioni a riguardo ed un video del backstage nelle prossime pagine).
  • L’anno scorso BEAUTY IN HELL ha ricevuto diversi premi internazionali ed è stato esposto in diverse sedi in giro per il mondo. (più informazioni ed un video a riguardo nelle prossime pagine).

Questi riconoscimenti mi hanno aiutato a capire che, forse, siamo finalmente pronti a vedere quello che succede sotto una  luce diversa… QUELLA DELLA BELLEZZA! non solo attraverso il dramma che produce paura che produce dramma... un circolo vizioso che deve essere esposto e fermato!

A cominciare dal prossimo gennaio, e nel corso del 2015, cercherò di documentare la bellezza in realtà difficili e pericolose all’interno dell’Asia. Al momento le tappe previste sono Vietnam (dove arriverò il 5 gennaio), Cambodia, Myamar, Bangladesh, Nepal/Tibet, China/Mongolia… ma sono probabili variazioni durante il percorso.

Sfortunatamente non mi è possibile spiegare con precisione dove, quando e quali saranno nello specifico i luoghi e le situazioni che incontrerò. Per ragioni legate alla sicurezza, protezione e per evitare ulteriori rischi sia a me che alle guide che mi accompagneranno, queste situazioni non possono essere svelate almeno fino a quando non sono state documentate ed il lavoro completato.

E’ essenziale che ogni situazione si sviluppi in modo spontaneo, vero e naturale, e uno dei modi migliori per farlo è di trovarsi lì inaspettati, quasi per caso, così da trovare la le immagini e le storie direttamente dalla gente locale.

E’ importante ricordare che BEAUTY IN HELL è un progetto in fase di sviluppo, creato nel corso degli anni. Il goal di questa fase è di raccogliere i fondi che mi permettano di produrre il nuovo Artwork per la mostra fotografica che si terrà nel corso del 2015-16 in gallerie e sedi varie in giro per il mondo. Al momento ho ricevuto disponibilità a Venezia, Milano, Svizzera e Stati Uniti (vi terremo informati sulle nuove sedi con aggiornamenti regolari).

L’obiettivo finale rimane sì quello di informare e portare consapevolezza di queste situazioni, ma allo stesso tempo cercare di farlo in un modo diverso… ci stiamo impegnando a mostrare che la bellezza, l’umanità e le persone reali sono la cosa più importante… non solo il dramma! Questo, credo, è ciò che definisce tutti noi.

Prima di tutto vi chiediamo di DI CREDERE IN NOI E NEL PROGETTO.
Per portare il Progetto al livello successivo, per raggiungere questi posti, documentare e mostrare nuove realtà, ORA ABBIAMO NECESSARIAMENTE BISOGNO DI SUPPORTO ESTERNO… DEL VOSTRO SUPPORTO!

Se amate la fotografia, se vi interessa il fotogiornalismo indipendente o se semplicemente apprezzate quello che BEAUTY IN HELL rappresenta, vi chiedo di unirvi a noi nel tentativo di mostrare la forza della Bellezza sul dramma e sul sensazionalismo!

OGNI SINGOLO CONTRIBUTO CONTA VERAMENTE TANTO… E, ANCHE SE PICCOLO, E’ DI FONDAMENTALE IMPORTANZA!

Ci serve il supporto della stampa, da parte dei fotografi, degli editori, degli insegnanti e delle scuole, da parte di tutti i professionisti in ogni campo… Voi siete le raccomandazioni di cui abbiamo bisogno e su cui facciamo affidamento!

Ogni Contributore promuoverà lo sviluppo del Progetto su due binari paralleli:
  • quello artistico e personale: aiutandoci a sviluppare il nuovo Artwork per la Mostra.
  • quello sociale, educativo e culturale: permettendoci di esporre realtà spesso trascurate, portando così consapevolezza di situazioni dure e difficili nel mondo.
Allo stesso tempo ogni Contributore riceverà una ricompensa artistica derivata dall’Artwork finale e diventerà anche un collezionista (dettagli sulle ricompense nel prossimo paragrafo). Infatti le stampe in Copia Unica ed in Edizione Limitata dell’anno scorso sono ora diventate articoli da collezione. Per maggiori informazioni e dettagli vi invito ad andare ai seguenti link:

- http://tonycorocher.com/photo-blog (articles & news about my work)
- http://beautyinhell.com/exhibitions (Awards & Exhibitions page)
- http://tonycorocher.com/beauty-in-hell-prints (Details about the Fine Art Prints)

Non credo sia corretto chiedervi contributi e donazioni se noi, per primi, non siamo pronti ad investire sul progetto di tasca nostra. Abbiamo già messo i nostri soldi, molto lavoro, l’esperienza, le risorse, la passione e le conoscenze, e faremo tutto il resto del lavoro con i nostri mezzi.

QUELLO DI CUI ORA ABBIAMO BISOGNO È DI RACCOGLIERE 30.000 US$ ENTRO GLI INIZI DI FEBBRAIO 2015 per riuscire a pagare voli, trasporti, vitto ed alloggio, documenti, visti, guide ed assicurazioni, visite mediche per 2 persone, più coprire i costi di produzione sul posto, di registrazione ai premi internazionali e per preparare/organizzare le Mostre.

La cifra realistica per coprire un progetto come questo e assicurare un prodotto finale professionale e di alta qualità, è di circa 50.000 US$, e ovviamente coltiviamo la speranza di raggiungere quella cifra. Comunque una grossa parte di questa somma è già stata coperta da noi e dal nostro lavoro (20.000 US$ per: ricerche iniziali, editing & post production, social networks, sito web, hosting, attrezzatura e altro ancora).

IMPORTANTE: Questo budget non comprende nessuna forma di retribuzione economica per noi. Tutte le donazioni verranno utilizzate per finanziare, supportare e completare il progetto.

Il processo è molto semplice! Selezionate la Ricompensa/Perk che più vi aggrada e cliccateci sopra. Verrete portati su una pagina di dettaglio. Da qui seguite le indicazioni:

1. cliccare su “CONTINUE TO PAYMENT”
2. Cliccare su “GO TO PAYPAL”  Una volta arrivati sulla pagina Paypal potrete mandare il contributo attraverso il vostro conto Paypal oppure utilizzando la vostra carta di credito. TUTTO IL PROCESSO E’ PROTETTO, MOLTO SICURO E VERAMENTE FACILE.

La piattaforma INDIEGOGO è certificata TRUSTe Certified, ed è un membro accreditato del Better Business Bureau (BBB) dal 2012.

  • FACENDO SAPERE A PIU’ GENTE POSSIBILE DI QUESTA CAMPAGNA! Spargete la voce, fate un po’ di “casino” online riguardo la campagna BEAUTY IN HELL! Convincete un amico/a a supportarci, a fare una donazione… anche piccola. Condividete il video, la campagna, il sito web (www.beautyinhell.com), la pagina Facebook (https://www.facebook.com/BeautyInHell) con amici, famigliari e colleghi.

  • COLLEGANDOVI E FORNENDOCI INFORMAZIONI! L’aiuto che potete dare fornendoci ricerca, informazioni e contatti diretti sul posto è di estrema importanza… specialmente quando collegato a situazioni dure e difficili di vostra conoscenza e che si potrebbero documentare.

Abbiamo diversi tipi di RICOMPENSE ed INCENTIVI… uno o più per ogni donazione.

Dalle spille/magneti ufficiali BEAUTY IN HELL 2015, ai biglietti per l’apertura della Mostra, ai Libri Fotografici da Collezione firmati, alle stampe Fine Art Museali da Collezione in Copia Unica o in tirature molto limitate tutte di altissima qualità, e altro ancora.

Una lista completa e dettagliata delle Ricompense ed Incentivi è disponibile sulla destra di questa pagina... sfortunatamente qui è solo in inglese ma potete trovarla in italiano a questo link: clicca qui




CHI SONO
Tony Corocher (Treviso, Italy – 1974) – Fotografo documentarista/Fine Art & Art Director con base in Italy. Ho passato gli ultimi 20 anni muovendomi tra il graphic design e la fotografia lavorando in diversi luoghi in giro per il mondo.
Negli ultimi 2 anni il mio lavoro fotografico (documentazione di situazioni umanitarie) ha ricevuto diversi riconoscimenti internazionali ed è stato esposto in varie sedi in giro per il mondo.

Per un curriculum completo e altre info andare ai seguenti link:
Personal Website | LinkedIn | Facebook | Download CV/Resumè


IL TEAM
Il Team dietro a BEAUTY IN HELL è composto da pochi individui, ma molto speciali. Persone con un background professionale in campi diversi, che hanno creduto in me e nel progetto fin dall’inizio. Questi individui, che sono anche degli ottimi amici, mi hanno sostenuto in molti modi diversi e mi hanno aiutato a sviluppare il progetto nel corso degli anni.


Per una lista completa dei Premi ed Esposizioni Internazionali ottenute dal progetto Beauty In Hell nel 2013-2014 cliccare qui.


Lasciare la sicurezza e le comodità della mia casa per entrare in queste realtà molto difficili non è un compito facile e i rischi che mi sto prendendo sono abbastanza elevati. Ma quando guardo indietro al lavoro fatto negli ultimi 2-3 anni in Africa (www.beautyinhell.com) so per certo che quello che riuscirò a portare indietro e a farvi vedere varrà sicuramente i pericoli e, forse, ci aiuterà a capire cosa c’è di così sbagliato nella nostra società moderna.
story_txt:
Beauty In Hell is an award winning, independent reportage and a
personal photographic dream created to find and document the beauty present
in some of the most difficult, poverty stricken and dangerous realities around
the world. 
My name is Tony Corocher and I am a documentary and fine art photographer.

BEAUTY IN HELL is a critical and personal artistic response to an
increased awareness of living in a system that uses drama everywhere. I
believe we are now unconsciously accustomed to consider an event interesting
and noteworthy only if it contains some form of strong contrast, therefore if
it is dramatic. Without drama there is no news and everything becomes boring, dull
and almost unworthy of our attention… we use drama to create
sensationalism. But Drama is just one
part of the story… if drama becomes the only
thing mainstream media covers
and the only thing we hold up, what can we expect to grow from it? 

With Beauty In Hell I
want to to express, through artistic sensibility, exactly the opposite
and show that beauty within the human spirit is always present, in every
situation, even in the most difficult and dangerous realities around the world.


Find and follow us: Official Website | Twitter | Facebook | Instagram

BEAUTY IN HELL was born as a dream, and I’ve spent the last 3 years developing it, injecting all of my passion and experience in to
it, and dealing with the associated risks and dangers.



In 2011 I started the project by researching and
documenting everyday situations in Vietnam, Kenya and Nepal .


In 2012-13 I documented beauty inside the frightening
realities of the Mathare and Kibera slums (Nairobi, Kenya), of the refugee camps in
North Kenya and other hard situations in the Middle East and Asia (more info and a backstage video about Mathare and Kibera Slums at the end of this page).


Last year BEAUTY IN HELL received several
international awards and was exhibited in venues around the world (more info and a video about the awards and the exhibitions at the end of this page).


This recognition has helped me realize that, maybe, we are finally
ready to see things from a different perspective … THAT OF BEAUTY! And not just
through the lens of drama, which breeds fear, which in turn breeds drama... a vicious circle that needs to be exposed and stopped!

Starting next January, and during
the course of 2015, I will be documenting the beauty in difficult and dangerous
realities across Asia. At the moment the selected stages are in Vietnam,
Cambodia, Myamar, Bangladesh, Nepal/Tibet, China/Mongolia. 

Unfortunately, it is not possible for me
to explain exactly where, when and what the exact situations are. As I am sure you will understand, for
reasons concerning security, safety and to avoid further risks for both 
me and my guides, these situations cannot be revealed until they have 
been fully documented and the work is finished.It is essential that each and every
situation develops in a spontaneous, true and natural way… and one of the
best ways to do this is to come across them unexpectedly, in order to find the
story while you are there, directly from the local people and everyday situations. 





Beauty In Hell is an ongoing project, and this is our first IndieGoGo
campaign developed to raise the funds needed to
produce the new artwork for the BEAUTY IN HELL Photographic Exhibition that
will be held in galleries and venues around the world in 2015-16. At
present we have received availability from venues in Venice, Milan, Switzerland
& USA (we will keep you informed of new venues with regular updates).
The final objective remains that of
informing and raising awareness of these desperate situations, but at the same time we
want to do so in a different way... we are committed to showing that beauty, humanity and real people matter… not just
drama! This is what we believe defines all of
us.





First of all, we ask you to believe in us and in the Project, as we
do. To accomplish the next step, to be able to travel
to the locations, document and show you new realities, we now need external support too… YOUR SUPPORT! 

If you love photography, if you
care about independent photojournalism or if you simply appreciate what BEAUTY IN HELL stands
for, we hope you will join us in
our attempt to show the power of Beauty over drama and sensationalism! Help us recognize
that Beauty! that Humanity! and the truth that real people matter!

EVERY SINGLE DONATION REALLY COUNTS… EVEN SMALL
ONES ARE VITAL!

We ask
for the support of the press, from photographers, from editors, from
educators and schools, from professionals in every field… You are the recommendations we need and count upon!



Each
Contributor will support the project in two parallel ways: 



On an artistic and personal level: by helping us develop the new Artwork for the
traveling Exhibition.


On a social, educational and cultural level: by exposing frequently
overlooked  realities and bringing
awareness to difficult situations around the world.

At the same time every Contributor will receive one or more of our artistic
reward and become a collector too (see perks and rewards in the next chapters). 

In fact,
the Unique Copy & Limited Edition Prints from last year’s campaign have now become collectors' items. For
more info and details please visit:
- http://tonycorocher.com/photo-blog
(articles & news about my work)- http://beautyinhell.com/exhibitions (Awards & Exhibitions page)- http://tonycorocher.com/beauty-in-hell-prints (Details about the Fine Art Prints)
I believe that we can’t ask you for donations
if we are not also willing to personally invest
in this project. We put our own money, work, experience, resources, passion
and knowledge in to it, and 
will be
doing the rest of the work ourselves. 

WHAT WE NEED NOW IS TO RAISE AT LEAST 30 THOUSAND US$ WITHIN THE FIRST DAYS OF FEBRUARY 2015 in order to pay for flights/travel,
living costs, documents, visas, local guides, medical/safety requirements and
insurance for 2 people, plus the live costs of production on location,
registration to  international awards and costs for the
photographic Exhibitions. The realistic
amount needed to cover a project like this and
ensure a professional, high quality output, is approximately 50 thousand US$. 

A large chunk
of this sum (20,000 US$) has already been covered by us and our work (initial research, editing & post-production, social networks, hosting, website,
equipment and more).




IMPORTANT: This budget does not include any compensation for us. All donations
will be used only to finance, support and complete the project.The
process is very simple! Just select the perk you prefer and click on it! You will be taken to a details
page. From here follw the online instructions:
1. Click on“CONTINUE TO PAYMENT”2. Click on“GO TO PAYPAL”

Once on the Paypal page you can
contribute either by using your Paypal account or your Credit Card. THE
ENTIRE PROCESS IS PROTECTED, VERY SAFE AND EXTREMELY FAST. INDIEGOGO is TRUSTe Certified, and have been an accredited member of the Better Business Bureau (BBB) since 2012.
 




BY MAKING
SOME NOISE ABOUT THE CAMPAIGN!Get the word out and make some noise about our Beauty In
Hell campaign. Convince a friend to get involved and support us with a
donation... even a very small one. Share the video, the campaign, the website (www.beautyinhell.com), the Facebook
page  (https://www.facebook.com/BeautyInHell)
with friends, family and colleagues.


BY
CONNECTING AND REPORTING TO US! Your help in 
providing us
with research, information and direct contacts on location is extremely important... especially when relevant to
difficult/hard situations you are familiar with and that we may be able to
document.




We have great PERKS and INCENTIVES for you... one or more
for each contribution. 
From the official Beauty
In Hell 2015 pins/magnets, to tickets to the opening of the
Exhibition, to photographic e-books, to signed high quality Collectors' Photobooks, to photographic workshops personalized to your 
needs with myself as tutor, to very Limited Edition
and Unique Copies Fine Art Collectors' Prints, and lots more.
A full
and detailed list of the Perks is available on the right side of this page.




WHO AM I Tony Corocher (Treviso, Italy – 1974) – 
Documentary/Fine Art photographer & Art Director based in Italy. 
I’ve spent the last 20 years switching between graphic design and 
photography while working in different locations around the world. In 
the last 2 years my photographic work (documenting humanitarian 
situations) has been recognized by various international awards and 
exhibited in venues around the world. For a full BIO and more info 
please refer to:Personal Website | LinkedIn | Facebook | Download CV/Resumè THE TEAMThe team behind BEAUTY IN HELL
 is composed by a few very special individuals. People with professional
 backgrounds in different fields who believed in me and in the project 
from the very start. These individuals, also personal friends of mine, 
have sustained me in many different ways and helped develop the project 
over the years.
For a full list of International Awards, Prices & Exhibitions obtained by the Beauty In Hell Project during 2013-2014 click here.Giving up the safety and comfort of my home to go
into these difficult situations is not an easy task and the risks involved are quite high. But when I look back
at the work produced in the last 2-3 years in Africa (www.beautyinhell.com) and the recognitions obtained, I know that what
we can bring back and what we’ll be able to show you is well worth the risks
and sacrifices, and maybe, will help us understand a bit more of what is going
wrong in our modern society.










Beauty In Hell è un reportage indipendente, vincitore di diversi premi
internazionali e, allo stesso tempo, un sogno fotografico personale sviluppato
negli anni con l’obiettivo di trovare e documentare la bellezza presente in
alcune delle realtà più difficili, povere e pericolose al mondo.


Mi chiamo Tony Corocher e sono un fotografo documentarista e fine art.
BEAUTY IN HELL nasce come critica
personale e risposta artistica alla consapevolezza di vivere all’interno di un
sistema che fa uso del dramma in tutto. Noi ormai ci
siamo inconsciamente abituati a considerare una cosa interessante e degna di
nota solo se contiene dei forti contrasti, quindi se è drammatica. 

Senza dramma non c’è notizia e tutto diventa noioso… utilizziamo il dramma
per fare sensazionalismo. Ma il dramma è solo una parte della storia…. se il
dramma diventa la sola cosa che i media ci trasmettono e quindi la sola cosa a
cui facciamo riferimento, che cosa possiamo aspettarci di diverso dal prossimo
futuro?
Con “BEAUTY IN HELL” voglio esprimere,
attraverso la sensibilità artistica, esattamente l’opposto e mostrare che la bellezza dentro lo spirito umano
è sempre presente, in ogni situazione, anche quando le condizioni sono
veramente drammatiche e i luoghi molto duri e difficili.

Potete
seguirci su:Official Website | Twitter | Facebook | Instagram






BEAUTY IN HELL è nato come sogno personale 3 anni fa… è stato sviluppato,
finanziato e portato in mostra con le mie forze iniettandoci tutta la mia
passione e la mia esperienza, e affrontando i rischi e pericoli correlati (e
anche con l’aiuto in vari campi di alcune persone a me vicine in diversi
paesi).

Nel 2011 ho iniziato il progetto svolgendo ricerche
     e raccogliendo documentazione in Vietnam, Kenya e Nepal.
In 2012-13 ho documentato la bellezza dentro le spaventose realtà delle
     baraccopoli di Mathare e Kibera (Nairobi, Kenya), i campi profughi nel
     Nord del Kenya ed altri luoghi molto duri in Medio Oriente ed Asia (più informazioni a
     riguardo ed un video del backstage nelle prossime pagine).

L’anno scorso BEAUTY
     IN HELL ha ricevuto diversi premi internazionali ed è stato esposto in
     diverse sedi in giro per il mondo. (più informazioni ed un video a
     riguardo nelle prossime pagine).


Questi riconoscimenti
mi hanno aiutato a capire che, forse, siamo finalmente pronti a vedere
quello che succede sotto una  luce
diversa… QUELLA DELLA BELLEZZA! non solo attraverso il dramma che produce paura
che produce dramma... un circolo vizioso che deve essere esposto e fermato!



A cominciare dal prossimo
gennaio, e nel corso del 2015, cercherò di documentare la bellezza in realtà
difficili e pericolose all’interno dell’Asia. Al momento le tappe previste sono
Vietnam (dove arriverò il 5 gennaio), Cambodia, Myamar, Bangladesh,
Nepal/Tibet, China/Mongolia… ma sono probabili variazioni durante il percorso.
Sfortunatamente non mi è possibile spiegare con precisione dove, quando e
quali saranno nello specifico i luoghi e le situazioni che incontrerò. Per ragioni
legate alla sicurezza, protezione e per evitare ulteriori rischi sia a me che
alle guide che mi accompagneranno, queste situazioni non possono essere svelate
almeno fino a quando non sono state documentate ed il lavoro completato. 
E’ essenziale che ogni situazione si sviluppi in modo spontaneo, vero e
naturale, e uno dei modi migliori per
farlo è di trovarsi lì inaspettati, quasi per caso, così da trovare la le
immagini e le storie direttamente dalla gente locale.






E’ importante ricordare che BEAUTY IN HELL è un progetto in fase di sviluppo,
creato nel corso degli anni. Il goal di questa fase è di raccogliere i fondi
che mi permettano di produrre il nuovo Artwork per la mostra fotografica che si
terrà nel corso del 2015-16 in gallerie e sedi varie in giro per il mondo. Al momento ho ricevuto disponibilità a Venezia, Milano,
Svizzera e Stati Uniti (vi terremo informati sulle nuove sedi con aggiornamenti
regolari).


L’obiettivo finale rimane sì quello di informare e portare consapevolezza
di queste situazioni, ma allo stesso tempo cercare di farlo in un modo diverso…
ci stiamo impegnando a mostrare che la
bellezza, l’umanità e le persone reali sono la cosa più importante… non solo il
dramma! Questo, credo, è ciò che definisce tutti noi.





Prima di tutto vi chiediamo di 
DI CREDERE IN NOI E NEL PROGETTO. Per portare il Progetto al livello successivo, per raggiungere questi posti,
documentare e mostrare nuove realtà, ORA ABBIAMO NECESSARIAMENTE BISOGNO DI SUPPORTO ESTERNO… DEL VOSTRO SUPPORTO!

se semplicemente apprezzate quello che BEAUTY
IN HELL rappresenta, vi chiedo di
unirvi a noi nel tentativo di mostrare la forza della Bellezza sul dramma e sul
sensazionalismo!

quello artistico e personale: aiutandoci a sviluppare il nuovo Artwork per la Mostra.
     

quello sociale, educativo e culturale: permettendoci di esporre

Allo stesso tempo ogni Contributore riceverà una

le stampe in Copia Unica ed in Edizione Limitata dell’anno scorso sono ora

anni in Africa (www.beautyinhell.com) so per certo
che quello che riuscirò a portare indietro e a farvi vedere varrà sicuramente i
pericoli e, forse, ci aiuterà a capire cosa c’è di così sbagliato nella nostra
società moderna.

story:
The uniqueness of every country are established by its beautiful people, animals and originality. Many times the true beauty of a country is not captured due to the negative labels a country may adopt. While bringing awareness about world issues is important, it is usually all we see when talking about certain countries.

I have been a professional photographer for many years and it has been my desire to bring the true beauty of these countries that have been wrongfully labeled due to their economic issues and impoverished circumstances. For this to be done correctly, I will need the highest quality in equipment. All of the monetary gifts will go towards the funding of my first trip, which is to Haiti and the equipment. I thank you in advance for helping me bring the beauty of other countries to America and around the world through photography.

story:
We are OBSESSED with selfies! And why shouldn't we be? What's wrong with appreciating our own bodies and loving how we look? Flaunt it because you are rocking it! Selfies are beautiful! And you know what else is beautiful? Planet Earth! Unfortunately, Earth is not able to take selfies of all its wonders. That's where I come in! European Selfie Tour is a once in a lifetime opportunity to visit just a sampling of the beauty the Earth has to offer and capture it! There's something amazing about combining that first look of wonder on a person's face upon visiting a historic site and the beauty of the site itself. European Selfie Tour is not just a collection of photos and stories from one continent on this planet, it is a movement to love yourself and explore every wonder on this Earth while you have time.

All funds go directly to support European travel to historic and environmental landmarks in order to create the European Selfie Tour Selfie Anthology, a collection of carefully-framed photos from around the globe as well as memoirs.

There is beauty in this world. Help me share it!

Traveling Europe is expensive! Dang, it's expensive. I am fortunate enough to be able to take a semester to study abroad to an undecided country in Europe where I will be taking some classes. But I also have that whole semester to travel around IF I can afford the transportation to get me there. That's where you come in. With your help, this dream of spreading the message of beauty can become a reality!

Risk: I make money, but not enough to do everything I want.
I will go with the flow and alter my plans to do as much as I can within the budget allotted.

Risk: I won't have enough time.
I have a whole semester and not many credit hours. I am a determined traveler!

Any amount helps... check out the STRANGE and INCREDIBLE perks! Thank you for every share, every view, and all feedback.
