story:
Why A Coffee Table Photo Book?

A coffee table is universally at the center of conversation. Literally. And the books on it are picked up and read by Christian and agnostic alike. We have visited some of the most desolate parts of the world and have seen things that we simply cannot un-see. 

Just before launching on this mission trip, William purchased a camera "just in case I wanted to take a couple pictures." Photography has now turned into a passion and over the last five months he has been afforded the opportunity to document some of God's most incredible warriors.

While photography is also an interest of Sarah's, her passion lies more in writing. The experiences from the past five months have exploded within her words and stories that no longer should be left hidden in remote villages in India or buried in the heart of the weathered traveler.

It is our hope that this photo book, compiled of at least 20 pages of William's photography and Sarah's stories from 11 countries, will spark a conversation between Christians and non-Christians alike. You never know who might pick it up.

Previous to the World Race, both William and Sarah lived in America, she on the Oregon coast and he in New York City. Through a fantastic and crazy roller coaster (to put it simply), both were whisked off on an 11-month mission trip to 11 different countries called the World Race. No, this is not televised and it is NOT like the "Amazing Race."

We are halfway through the Race now and so far we have walked the plunging valleys below Mount Everest in Nepal, have ducked into huts made from palmetto branches in India, have laughed with awesome men and women in one of Thailand's last remaining government protected leprosy colonies, have lived with and taught English to 51 orphans in Cambodia, and have passed out over 400 cabbages (yes, cabbages) at one of Swaziland's care points which aids over 6,000 local African children, 60% of which are HIV/AIDS positive.

Now we're ready to share these stories. 


Why $4,000?

We each have a financial deadline of $16,264 by January 1st, 2015.  William recently found out he is fully funded (*fist pump*) but Sarah is still in need of $1,740. If she does not reach this deadline, she will have to leave the Race early. These photobooks are a way you can help her stay on the Race and go to Botswana in January!

We have found a book publisher who has given us the following rates for a premium coffee table photo album with the following qualities:

  •  Standard Landscape 10" x 8"
  •  Dust Jacket Cover
  •  Standard Black Linen Covering (Hardback Cover)
  •  At least 20 pages of glossy printed photography
  •  Short descriptions accompanying various photos telling the location
The more photo books sold, the lower production costs will be leading to a higher net going into our World Race accounts. Here are the rates the book publisher has given for the above qualities:
QUANTITY   PRICE PER COPY
1-9 US $30.99
10-50 US $27.89
51-100 US $26.34
101-300 US $24.79
Assuming that each person donates only the minimum of $50 for a hardback photo album and assuming that at least 10 - 50 people purchase a photo book, then $21.66 goes straight to our support accounts for each book sold.

Each book we sell will get a personalized thank you note from us on the inside cover. (We will contact you beforehand to confirm the photo book is not a gift for another.)

If we raise the funds needed, we land back on American soil on June 1st, 2015. We will work the month of June to get the photo album ready for print by July 1st and mailed out by August 1st.



The Impact

ALL PROFITS will go to our support accounts. This means that with every book purchase, we are that much closer to staying on the Race until the official end date of June 1st.

This is a dream that you can help make happen. Like we said, a coffee table is universally at the center of conversation. It's our dream that through this photobook, a conversation between Christians and non-Christians can be sparked.

 


What Qualifies Us?

    • Sitting as Creative Director for a local non-profit in New York and overseeing the graphic design of their press releases and website, William developed an eye for photography and digital design.
    • Sarah discovered her love for writing through blogging. Enter her personal creative space at http://www.passageofapilgrim.org
    • In Thailand, William volunteered to set up a local church's first website: http://www.selaphum.org/
    • Check out William's Vimeo and Youtube Channels for more information about his past work and videos of the recent months. https://vimeo.com/102656726  & http://youtu.be/u3LJOgNKhoE
    • Follow our journeys on Instagram at http://instagram.com/monumentalliving  & http://instagram.com/sarahbbaker_
    • William recently began a website where he briefly posts a bit of his photography  http://monumentalliving.tumblr.com/
    • We try to update our blogs consistently. Read about our adventures at www.williamreed.theworldrace.org  & www.sarahbaker.theworldrace.org


Other Ways You Can Help | MAKE SOME NOISE

If you are not in a position to be able to support financially, you can still help MULTIPLY the audience this campaign gets to. IndieGogo has some killer share tools so please, share this on facebook, twitter, and instagram. 

To reach us, feel free to email williambenjaminreed@gmail.com . Internet is sparse here but we will do our best to respond swiftly. 

Now go and make a room brighter! (You guys rock.)

-William Reed and Sarah Baker

story:
With instant pack film being slowly discontinued, this is an effort to preserve one of the rarest pack films ever produced in book form.

The film is known as Polaroid Chocolate film which hasn't been produced since 2008.  As a matter of fact, it was one of the last films that Polaroid manufactured in very limited quantities. It has been a labor of love to search and obtain this film for this project.

The subject matter is art nude found in natural surroundings. The goal was to include an all encompassing array of subjects.

My hope is that others will have the same passion as I to preserve this rare film presented in a unique art publication and contribute to this worthy project. 

All the best,

Brian Bruno / Brunoroids

story:
Off With Whose Mask?

 

This album is my chance of sharing with you my interpretations of how we perceive ourselves and others, which I am going to separate into three different angles:

             

Surviving - A lack of self-esteem pushes people to prove themselves to others.

 

Existing - A lack of appreciation by others causes people to question the purpose of their existence.

 

Living - Accepting oneself, and a stable focus on one's happiness. 

 

These angles deal with different manifestations of our perceptions and feelings of superiority, and I am also integrating the component of animals by reversing roles to explore those experiences. The above angles I shall categorize into three individual sections in the book.

During this exploration, I will, among other elements, play around with metaphors and idioms that represent our customary perceptions, and I will turn them on their head in order to unearth a different POV.

 

"Fish out of Water"

 

What I Need

In order to realize this project and fill a self-printed album that I can publish, I will need to raise 6,000 US dollars. This amount will cover:

  • Cost of animals masks, other props, clothes: $1,200
  • Compensation, catering, travel for models: $1,000
  • Printing cost of the album: $3000
  • Shipping cost: $800

 

 

The Book

I am aiming to produce a photo album of up to 100 photos, in this format:

  • Matte hardcover
  • Trim size - Large square 10 x 10
  • Binding - Adhesive case wrap

 

"At a Snail's Pace"

 

Other Ways You Can Help

I would be grateful if you like this project enough to support it by telling your friends and social media connections.

You can find me on Facebook and Instagram via @offwithyourmask, where I will post ongoing information about my realization of this project, the making of, and my journey of completing it.

Thank you for your support!

Elizabeth

story:
„You always find a way to make your day a little brighter.“

Wien, Europa, die Welt – jeder Platz unseres Planeten steckt voller Geheimnisse, Schlupfwinkel und unentdeckter Perspektiven. Als Fotograf sehe ich es als meine Berufung, solche Orte ausfindig zu machen, zu dokumentieren und somit Teil der Zeitgeschichte zu werden. Dabei geht es sehr stark darum, die Orte spürbar zu machen, das Gefühl einzufangen, Eindrücke zu vermitteln, Plätzen Leben einzuhauchen und so Gedankenspiele anzuregen. Eine Aufgabe, die für mich das Zusammenspiel mit dem Ort zum Hauptfokus gemacht hat, die Liebe zu Wien, dem unerschöpflich kreativen Potential dieser Stadt, wachsen lassen hat und die Idee eines Bildbandes entstehen ließ.

Eine Ode an Wien also! Ein Bildband, der 10 verschiedene Areale in Zusammenarbeit mit 10 verschiedenen Models in den Blickpunkt rückt, um Charakteristiken festzuhalten, Horizonte zu erweitern und dazu inspirieren soll, mit neugierigen und offenen Augen durchs Leben zu ziehen. Vom Böhmischen Prater bis nach Nussdorf, von der Großfeldsiedlung bis zu den Steinhofgründen, jeder Ort ist einzigartig und lebt für sich, doch gemeinsam bilden sie eine eindrucksvolle Gesamtperspektive dieser Stadt. Dein/mein/unser/euer Wien.

Plätze und Inhalte: Böhmischen Prater, Großfeldsiedlung, Wien Nacht, Sightseeing-Tour durch Wien, Otto Wagner, Wiener Prater, Kaisermühlen, die 6er Linie, Seestadt, Steinhof.

An meiner Seite: Sarah Walder, Maja Petrovic, Dajanka Kuban, Christa Wackenreuther, Natália Muchová, Julia Schwarz, Doris Kemptner, Viktória Orlicka, Iris Shala, Katerina Polakova.

Texte zu den Kapitel von: Anna Ullrich, Darija Kasalo, Andrea Heyer, Fabolus Vienna, Gini Liedl, Stil Laden Wien, Martin Tardy (Viereck), Andi Joska, Stefan Wessel.

Fakten über das Buch:

  • Format 210x270 mm
  • Softcover, 260g matt gestrichen + Cellophanierung
  • 210+ Seiten, Kern: 130g  Premium Offset Papier, matt gestrichen

 

Wie sieht das Buch "Glanz Wien" aus?

Hier sind noch ein paar weitere Bilder zum Thema "Glanz Wien"

 

Danke für die Unterstützung! Für Fragen stehe ich euch gerne per Mail unter info@lichterwaldt.at und auf Facebook zur Verfügung.

www.lichterwaldt.at
www.facebook.com/lichterwaldt

peace out,

 

 

„You always find a way to make your day a little brighter.“

There are breath-taking areas to enjoy on Planet Earth if you are ready to depart in order to get in touch with daily wonders. Based on years of experience as a photographer and an absolute Vienna lover I invite local people as well as visitors to explore hidden gems not far away from the place where they live. In fact, it is part of my philosophy to document places by taking photographs to show various aspects of today`s life-styles, so that people get curious about alternative, especially, least predictable highlights by going on tour and feeling another stunning atmosphere inside and outside the City. In addition to this people might be inspired to leave the tourist trail now and then to share and feel the spirit of adventure led by one`s heart. For so many reasons the idea of „The Vienna Book“ – an Ode on the City - was born. My photo tour across Vienna, accompanied by a model, leads to 10 different Viennese areas and communicates various impressions taken with an analog camera. Just to mention the Bohemian Prater or the Großfeldsiedlung with its characteristic housing estates or the Green Prater and the so called Steinhofgründe. Every place is unique and worth a visit for its diversity. By the way, together they form a breath-taking perspective of the City.

Areas and Topics: Böhmischen Prater, Großfeldsiedlung, Wien Nacht, Sightseeing-Tour durch Wien, Otto Wagner, Wiener Prater, Kaisermühlen, die 6er Linie, Seestadt, Steinhof.

Models: Sarah Waldner, Maja Petrovic, Dajanka Kuban, Christa Wackenreuther, Natália Muchová, Julia Schwarz, Doris Kemptner, Viktória Orlicka, Iris Shala, Katerina Polakova.

Thoughts (Text): Anna Ulrich, Darija Kasalo, Andrea Heyer, Fabolus Vienna, Gini Liedl, Stil Laden Wien, Martin Tardy (Viereck), Andi Joska, Stefan Wessel.

Book details:

  • Format 210x270 mm
  • Softcover, 260g matt + cellophane
  • 210+ pages, Pages: 130g  Premium Offset paper, matt

 

€25 - Earlybird - Glanz Wien Book: Earlybird price so you will save 15€. Goodies: Stickers, Post cards and many more...

€30 - Glanz Wien Book: You’ll get the "Glanz Wien" book. Signed. Goodies: Stickers, Post cards and many more...

€32 - X-Mas Special Glanz Wien Book: You’ll get the "Glanz Wien" book. Signed and packaged. Goodies: Stickers, Post cards and many more...

€55 - 2 x Glanz Wien Book: You’ll get two "Glanz Wien" books. Signed and packaged. Goodies: Stickers, Post cards and many more...

 

Thank you for your support! If there are any questions, please contact me: info@lichterwaldt.at or Facebook.

www.lichterwaldt.at
www.facebook.com/lichterwaldt

peace out,

By the way, together they form a breath-taking perspective of the City.Areas and Topics: Böhmischen Prater, Großfeldsiedlung, Wien Nacht, Sightseeing-Tour durch Wien, Otto Wagner, Wiener Prater, Kaisermühlen, die 6er Linie, Seestadt, Steinhof.Models: Sarah Waldner, Maja Petrovic, Dajanka Kuban, Christa Wackenreuther, Natália Muchová, Julia Schwarz, Doris Kemptner, Viktória Orlicka, Iris Shala, Katerina Polakova.Thoughts (Text): Anna Ulrich, Darija Kasalo, Andrea Heyer, Fabolus Vienna, Gini Liedl, Stil Laden Wien, Martin Tardy (Viereck), Andi Joska, Stefan Wessel.Book details:
Format 210x270 mm
Softcover, 260g matt + cellophane
210+ pages, Pages: 130g  Premium Offset paper, matt
 €25 - Earlybird - Glanz Wien Book: Earlybird price so you will save 15€. Goodies: Stickers, Post cards and many more...€30 - Glanz Wien Book: You’ll get the "Glanz Wien" book. Signed. Goodies: Stickers, Post cards and many more...€32 - X-Mas Special Glanz Wien Book: You’ll get the "Glanz Wien" book. Signed and packaged. Goodies: Stickers, Post cards and many more...€55 - 2 x Glanz Wien Book: You’ll get two "Glanz Wien" books. Signed and packaged. Goodies: Stickers, Post cards and many more... Thank you for your support! If there are any questions, please contact me: info@lichterwaldt.at or Facebook.www.lichterwaldt.atwww.facebook.com/lichterwaldtpeace out,

story:
Professional Equipment

I would love to have professional grade equipment to take my photography to a new level. This would put me in a place where I can spend part of my time doing freelance photography for client restaurants and food vendors, magazine or cook book prints, and to document food culture in my own city as well as being able to travel to a number of cities, towns and countries. I will also spend part of my time working through different professional kitchens all over the city cultivating my skill to newer levels.


I am a professional cook who has a great deal of passion for my chosen profession and adding professional photography to what I do only adds greater dimension to my character and love of food culture.


Sharing My Love of Food with My Audience

With the ability of professional equipment I can dedicate more of my time in sharing my thoughts, recipes and suggestions through my blog as well as developing more artistic range with my photography and my creative process when developing dishes to share. I want others to feel a greater intimate relationship with the food they put in their bodies.


Having such equipment would give me the ability to make photography part of my daily work and passion, and therefore a freelance business. Your help will allow me to stay away from using credit schemes to pursue this dream, and too many of us know what it feels like to be stuck with debt.


What I Need

Camera body $700-1000

2 lens $1600-1700


Please Consider Donating to My Passion for Great Food and Great Art

Any left over funds will be donated to Slow Food an organisation that promotes sustainability, biodiversity, ethical food sources, and empowerment to new gardeners, farmers or ranchers finding their way into the market.



**Alternate Donation means

Leave me a message if you would like to donate through Paypal to my husband's account or if you would like to donate the old fashioned way through snail mail and I can get you my address.

story:
To all my wonderful friends: Thank you!

For all the support and love, and amazing generosity. 

Because of your help, I will very soon be back on the tracks with a new camera! 

If you are coming here from a link on my web site: www.normanericfox.com

welcome!

Take a look at some of the updates to get a better idea of how wonderful this project has been!

Thank you everyone.

Sincerely,

Norman

story:
History

The first photograph I have from this alley dates back to 1989 - it was already in full swing visually. Struck by its 'art installation' vibe, I became enamored with it's ever changing imagery, rough and ready attitude, and a full range of human emotion – liberally applied to its walls, doorways …


Project

After more then 20 years of interacting with this weird and wonderful creature, I feel its time to take stock - mark the passage of time. Create a visual document that celebrates this landmark, which, for all its visual incarnations, remains remarkably unchanged - in its architecture as well as function. This alleyway needs to be acknowledged - it has contributed greatly to the flavour of downtown Toronto, and will continue to do so for years - decades to come!


Where your contributions will go

I envision this book to be about 60 to 90 pages (depending on your generosity). Full colour and roughly 8"x10" in size. Because for the first decade of this project, I was shooting on film, there are thousands of negatives (in 35mm and mid-format) to go through. I am hoping to digitize at least 100 of the best ones. I also have a few thousand digital images that have been reduced to around 300 at this point.

Thanks to my graphic design training and experience in corporate publishing -  design, writing and editing won't cost any money, but the biggest expense will be printing. Here's how I think the budget will break down:

          Image preparation (canning, colour correction, etc): apx $1,500

          Production / printing: apx $6,500

This is flexible funding campaign, so if I don't raise the full amount, the book will still happen - it will take longer and probably will be on the modest side as far as number of pages and images is concerned. So here I go - trying to get you excited - telling you about the wonderful perks I've thought up in hopes of making your minds moist with motivation.


Perks

To begin with - you can have the entire book (in pdf form) for the smallest contribution of $5! As well as having your name mentioned in the 'thank you' section … a pretty good deal, no?!

Here are the samples of greeting cards, your $10 contribution gets:

Your $15 contribution will get you a limited edition (of 100), archival 8"x10" print of this image:

If you're unable to contribute, but really digging the project, there is lot you can do to help. Please share this page with your friends and anyone you think might be remotely interested. Befriend me on Facebook (https://www.facebook.com/leonid.rozenberg.7). Follow me on Twitter (https://twitter.com/Leonid2605) and Instagram (http://instagram.com/leonidr65/). In general please help me spread the word.

Thank you very much for your time  … let's make this thing real!

The Indiegogo share tools on this site can help get the word out!

story:
Hi! My name is Dan Efram and I'm a photographer and producer from New York City. 

The main trailer explains the project. For the deeper story, scroll down past the photos.

The Campaign: The Book, The Postcards, The Distribution, The Curators, The Gallery Show

Mission
The purchase of 1 book pays for the printing of your book + another book to be shipped to a curator, photo editor or gallery either in the United States or abroad. My ultimate goal is be invited to the prestigious Les Recontres del Arles in France.

Sample Pages
Above you see some sample pages of my Curiosities book prototype. Please note that images and order will likely change, but this is the approximate shape, size, and appearance. I'd like to call my style nouveau noir. Maybe you have a better suggestion? Happy to hear it.

My Background & The Book's Genesis 

For most of my life, I have been involved with producing and managing artistic endeavors for predominantly music projects. My main client over the last 18 years (!) has been the indie-rock group The Apples in stereo, but I've worked on the marketing, promotion, and development of dozens of music albums, television programs and live music productions. 

In 2016, I curated Modular Synthesis, two shows for the painter Steve Keene. One was at the Brooklyn Public Library, the other at Shepard Fairey's Los Angeles gallery, Subliminal Projects. 

My world has seemingly always involved being around creative minds with both serious and not-so-serious creative visions.  

The longer story, a little sad and hopefully a little uplifting...

In 2008, my mother became seriously ill and it had a profound effect on my career and lifelong objectives. At the same time, my desire to pursue more personal creative endeavors came to light, while I still had the energy to do so. During this period, I had increasingly less personal time, and I needed to make it count. If I had 30 minutes to spare, I needed to get away from the pressures of caring for the family. One day,  I picked up a camera and got to lose myself in the moment. Photography became my go-to for cleansing my brain of the weight of family illness and care - which had become a full-time job.

After my parents had both passed and I was done taking care of family legal obligations, I traveled to Europe, the first time I had been able to get away in years. I hoped it would take my mind off of the dark realities that had occupied my world. It turned out to be a life changer. 

On that trip, I took a lot of photos and got into an excellent regimen each day of really studying what I was capturing. Everyone knows, when you want to hone your skills at anything, repetition is key. Practice! That Summer, I took literally thousands of photos, each day, going home and analyzing what was taken. Though it was fun, it was also bordering on compulsive. 

Upon my return to NYC, I showed some shots to my friend Deb Caponera who curates a wonderful cafe' series in Windsor Terrace, Brooklyn, who was nice enough to ask me if I was interested in showing my work. Another friend, Andrea, ended up offering me opportunities to show my art in a similar way at the restaurant she worked at in Warwick, NY.  

These were inspiring times and I am forever grateful. Without any expectations at all, I sold a bunch of prints and more importantly, realized I was hooked creatively. A year later, I was fortunate to have a show at Howl Happening in the East Village. My friends Ron Ward & The Dream Lovers played improvised music to my abstract films and stills.  The show involved making three, 45 min films that showed concurrently. A ton of work, but with an amazing outcome! Specifically inspired by this event, Ron Ward & The Dream Lovers recorded an album with producer/guitarist Jon Spencer. Inspiring stuff! 

What Photography Means To Me

Looking back on this period, I never expected anything from photography, but it has given me so much. Most importantly, it's now my inspiration, something I was lacking for a few years. We all need to dream. In dark times - like the last 2 years - it has been very important to find inspiration.  Because of photography, I feel like I've made a creative comeback, a rebirth if you will. 

Because I'm ambitious and don't like to make things easy for myself,  this project is not simply a photo book, it's a campaign that includes the limited edition book, prints & postcards, a potential gallery premiere show and distributing the book to a large group of galleries and festival curators around the world. Every book that you purchase, goes toward the printing and distribution of another book to an influencer around the globe! 

(Psst: As mentioned way above this, my ultimate goal is to get the attention of the curators of The Rencontres d'Arles which is perhaps the most prestigious photography festival in the world and with the intent of showing there at some point in the future. Attending the  festival in 2015 was a huge inspiration for me.)

Dreams are important. This is mine. There are a variety of pieces and packages available for pre-purchase. If you like my work, I want to make it accessible and fairly priced. I've read that supporting these campaigns early is really important to its ultimate success. So choosing to support it early will offer an even better deal. As an early adopter,  (re: "early bird deals"), you are raising your hand at an important time for this campaign's success.

Goals include:

* Printing of the limited edition, first edition
* Sending copies to backers
* Making archival prints
* Distributing the book to international curators and tastemakers
* Promoting the book with online and print reviews and/or PR
* Extended goal: potentially create a pop-up show in the NYC area (a big stretch but you never know)

It means a lot that people want to help this campaign. The broader the number of supporters  (on any level) will help reach the people in power in the art world. 

Though I've helped guide the success of many of these campaigns, it's a different feeling when it is my project. Thank you for supporting my Curiosities!

story:
NEWS FLASH:  SPECIAL LAST MINUTE BONUS PERK ADDED!!

See the "Apple Tree" in the Perks box to the right for how to get a copy of this image The Gate (from my series The Dominion of Trees) for just $35!  I decided to add this image since it's a favorite of mine and as one of my friends commented after seeing it: "This kind of represents life. We think we have this obstacle in front of us - but in this case we don't even need to figure out how to open the gate - we just need to walk around it." So for all those obstacles you think are stopping you from moving forward in your life - take a second look at them - they might not be as hard to get around as you think!


Now back to our previous programming:

The Witness Tree is a series of photographs of landscapes that are being affected by climate change. I plan to spend the next year documenting sites around the world that are being affected. I am targeting locations that represent a diversity of natural environments and cultures to demonstrate that this is indeed a global epidemic. From the melting Arctic ice cap to wild fires in Australia, I have selected places that will represent how geographically widespread the climate crisis is. Through a blog during my travels as well as exhibitions and slideshow presentations when I return to the States, I hope to create awareness and inspire others to be proactive in the fight against climate change.

Many experts in the field of environmental science agree that the earth is warming and that humans are largely responsible. (For more information on climate change please see link below.) The more I learned about climate change the more I knew I wanted to respond as an artist to this issue and that’s how The Witness Tree was born.


What is a Witness Tree, you may ask?

By tradition, a witness tree is used in land surveying to mark a property corner that cannot be reached because it lies off a cliff or in a body of water. The term also refers to trees that have witnessed historic events; i.e. an old honey locust that existed during the battle of Gettysburg. I will be photographing many trees that are observing the changes in the land around them.  In essence, my eyes and my camera will also be witnesses and the resulting pictures will act as permanent documents of these precious and precarious environments.

 

In the Beginning …

I was first inspired to begin this project while Iceland on an artist’s residency and noted the increase in the melting of their glaciers since my previous visit there several years before. After doing a significant amount of research this past year I started photographing locations in the US such as Lake Erie, whose water level has declined over 3 feet in the past fifteen years and the lodge pole pines in Colorado that are being decimated by the pine beetle which has survived milder winters to attack the drought-weakened trees in greater force. In order to fully respond to and depict this crisis I plan to travel to targeted locations around the globe (see links below). I recognize that most methods of travel involve adding more carbon to the atmosphere. This is a concern for me but I weighed the factors and decided that this project is a worthy pursuit. I have been granted a yearlong sabbatical from Nassau Community College where I am a fulltime professor of photography. This gift of time to work is very important but I also need your support to help make this happen.

 

This is where Indiegogo and you come in

I know this is an ambitious endeavor but I am wholly committed to it as I feel very passionate about the environment and I hope you do too.  It’s the only world we have and the shifts in the climate we’ve been experiencing are getting pretty scary.

I have been saving my pennies, selling my artwork, shooting freelance jobs and applying for grants in order to raise funds for this project. I hope that those who are interested in environmental issues and/or just want to support my art will consider making a donation. My perks start at $15 but you can give just a $1 or $5 if you want. Your financial assistance will go toward my travel expenses (transportation, lodging, meals) and making work prints of the images when I return.

I travel very inexpensively and with as little impact as possible (I prefer bikes to cars, camping to fancy hotels) but any of you who have gotten on a plane recently know that the cost of travel has gone up. I plan to travel contiguously to keep costs and my carbon footprint down as much as possible and will purchase carbon offsets for the miles I fly. When possible I hope to take trains or buses instead of planes.


Hooray! Tax deductions! 

I am very grateful to have Fractured Atlas acting as my fiscal sponsor. Since they are a 501c3 nonprofit they can bestow tax deduction letters in return for your contribution (see “Perks” box to right for thank-you gifts and each level’s tax deductible amount). I have a “working” itinerary of sites I want to visit but the more funds I can raise, the more places I can photograph.

Whether you make a donation or not, one way you can help is by sending along the link to this campaign to your family, friends, coworkers, or favorite bloggers who you think might be interested in The Witness Tree. Or if you know of someone in my targeted locations who can offer me some advice or a couch to sleep on, that information is very valuable too. And, last but not least, if any of you are interested in joining me for part of my trip, drop me a note!

 

Feel free to write me with any questions. And please send this on to folks you think you might be interested in this project. Thank you for your support!

 

Links to more information and images: 

 

CarolynMonastra.com


Images from the Witness Tree


Targeted Sites to Photograph


Climate Change related websites

will go toward my travel expenses (transportation, lodging, meals) and making
work prints of the images when I return.
I travel very inexpensively and with as little impact as
possible (I prefer bikes to cars, camping to fancy hotels) but any of you who
have gotten on a plane recently know that the cost of travel has gone up. I
plan to travel contiguously to keep costs and my carbon footprint down as much
as possible and will purchase carbon offsets for the miles I fly. When possible
I hope to take trains or buses instead of planes.
Hooray! Tax deductions! 
I am very grateful to have Fractured Atlas acting as my fiscal
sponsor. Since they are a 501c3 nonprofit they can bestow tax deduction letters
in return for your contribution (see “Perks” box to right for thank-you gifts
and each level’s tax deductible amount). I have a “working” itinerary of sites
I want to visit but the more funds I can raise, the more places I can
photograph.
Whether you make a donation or not, one way you can help is by
sending along the link to this campaign to your family, friends, coworkers, or
favorite bloggers who you think might be interested in The Witness Tree.
Or if you know of someone in my targeted locations who can offer me some advice
or a couch to sleep on, that information is very valuable too. And, last but
not least, if any of you are interested in joining me for part of my trip, drop
me a note!
 
Feel free to write me with any questions. And please send this on to folks you think you might be interested in this project. Thank you for your
support!
 
Links to more information and images: 
 
CarolynMonastra.com

Images from the Witness Tree
Targeted Sites to Photograph
Climate Change related websites

story:
Short Summary

Hi my name is Ritchie from New Zealand and I love taking photos of my own flowering plants and other peoples. I like to share the pics with friends and family.

My campaign is about bringing people with a common interest in flower photography together, with a share and contribute website.

With your help I will be able to get an interactive website built that allows people from all over the globe be able to share their photos and discuss certain issues.

What We Need & What You Get

With the funding I am asking for I will be able to work with my web site builder guru friend to build a web site that has different categories for varieties of flowers, plant groups and care information. 

We will add a discussion forum page so together we can help each other grow great flowering plants and how to get the best results when taking our photos of them.

Internet high five perk - thanks for helping make my project become a reality and I will send you a link of the site

Membership Perk - You will have full access to all the features on the site

The Impact

Together we can build a website that we can share our passions with photography and the beauty of the art nature provides us!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you know anyone that loves photography and especially flower photography please share the link to my campaign with them 8)

story:
Help us get our float into our local 4th of July parade!

We had a great experience when we entered 2 years ago, and even won 1st place in one of the categories! Waving to the crowd will help promote our photography business, while giving the parade-goers a fun, nostalgic, good time!


We're not asking for much, just enough to cover the basic expenses. 
No donation is too small...or too big! :)
*If you pay through Paypal we can get the funds asap*

Our expenses include:

  • Parade Entrance Fee
  • Costume, style, feed and hydrate the PinUp girls and guys
  • Gas up and clean the car(before and after)
  • Insure the participants
  • Promotional materials
  • Goodies to hand out to the crowd
  • Kissing/Photo Booth!!

What you'll get:

  • Postcards
  • Autographed PinUp Prints
  • Autographed PinUp Posters
  • 2014 PinUp Calendar
  • Behinds the scenes video of the float

 

The Ashland Old Fashioned Fourth of July Parade has always been a magical day for locals and visitors. More and more, the majority of the parade entries are religious or politically based, and honestly, parade goers are getting bored.
We continue to get amazing feedback from the year we participated in the Parade, and have been wanting to do it again, but just can't raise the funds, since we're struggling to build our photography business.
Happy, smiling gals and fellas dancing along to old-time tunes really got the crowd boppin, and brought back a sweet feeling of nostalgia.
This is a great way to put your money where the good vibes are sure to be!

And we'll be uploading a video of the parade and kissing booth.. after it happens!

 <3

Spread the love!

Share this campaign on your favorite social media sites, anywhere, get the word out! We don't have much time!

Feel free to check out our Facebook page & Website to see what we do!
http://www.retroviva.com/
https://www.facebook.com/RetroVivaPhotography

story:
In the past 12 months I have travelled and lived in 24 countries. Within this time I have met people that have hitch-hiked to meet their neighbours on the other side of the globe, shared homes with friends who have skateboarded over 400km across Morocco and met artists that paint every day, dreamers that live in vans, entrepreneurs that have created their own world within this one. 

As a British artist, more now than ever I question my own identity and nationality. I believe I am more than a stereotype set by my place of birth and instead an amalgamation of the places and people I have experienced. This exhibition shares images from my trip but also in displaying these images allows other to question their own stories, identities and to look beyond them to lives that are far than ordinary.

I choose to photograph using natural life and try to capture as close to how I see the world as possible. These are moments that I long to share with you. 

As an artist it is not always easy to reach the people that need to see your work most. To get funding can be difficult and not seen as an essential expense to donate to. But I believe we all need to dream a little more, experience fresh perspectives and share our own stories. These photos are close to my heart but by funding this exhibition I hope they will help both you and others. 

By helping to fund this project you not only receive my up most gratitude but you support a way to do things differently, outside of a system which hasn't benefited most artists. 

What We Need & What You Get

The funding will help me to print my photography and frame them for the exhibit. The framing will be crafted where I am currently at in Iceland. 

+ Printing costs - $700

+ Framing - $300

+ Newspapers (with stories of the people) - $400

The perks are one of a kind and hold stories that I hope will resonate with each of you. From newspapers that share imagery and the stories of the people I met, to prints of chosen images, through to one-to-one photography sessions with me (in Iceland). (delivery of prints/newspapers will happen after the exhibit on 4th November)

If the full funding is not met you will still receive these perks!

Other Ways You Can Help

Get the word out, come to the exhibit, choose to dream big, live outside the path that wasn't designed for you,  get intrigued by something new, share your story, send me your story, live an extraordinary life!

story:
MY STORY

My name is Farizah Sedek. I have been living and working in the Czech Republic for the past five years. Last year, after four years of working with a local company, I decided to take the plunge to pursue my dream of building a business.

I am graphic designer by day; I've designed for companies big and small since 2005. However, at night I find myself sifting through my digital library of photographs, looking for that one photo to work on. I would bring my camera with me wherever I go and I would spend countless hours reading or watching videos on post-processing methods, refining my style.

Photography is where my heart is. When the camera that I have been shooting with was taken away from me (more on that story below) just at the time when I started getting serious about business, I thought professional photography was something I should shelve for a while. But when you feel it's your calling, you really can't ignore it, can you? So, while my iPhone is wonderful for capturing the beauty I see in things, I know that to go pro, I'll need to invest in a new DSLR. Pronto.

More about my work:
www.farizahsedek.com
www.farizahsedekphotography.com
www.etsy.com/shop/FarizahSedek

If you have any questions, don't hesitate to ask me via my email: farizah@farizahsedek.com


THE BACKSTORY

In 2009, I received a hand-me-down DSLR from the local company that I was working with. They were replacing it with a new one, and I was more than happy to inherit the camera. Yes, it was given to me as a gift. Or so they said.

In 2013, I left the company to pursue my dream of building a business. Little did I know, by an unfortunate turn of events, I was accused of keeping company property and, not wanting to have any negative energies mar my fledgling business, decided to give the camera back.

Maybe I should actually say it was a fortunate turn of events. Cos now I get to buy my own brand new DSLR. Positive thinking begets positive outcomes, right?


THE IDEA

I'm an INFJ. If you're unfamiliar with the Myers-Briggs type profiles, INFJs need a strong sense of intention behind everything they do. Every little thing we do, we question the purpose of doing it. Yes, it's both our gift and our bane. So, as much as I love photography and want to turn my photographic gifts into my vocation, still I question my intentions for it. What is the bigger picture here? What do I want to achieve with photography, other than simply making pretty pictures? Is there a higher purpose for me to go into it? What is my big why?

As I ponder on those questions, out of the blue, an idea surfaced amongst all of these thoughts floating around in my head, and I knew instantly that this is something I have been called to do.

The Czech Republic is my adopted home, and its people are my friends. Nevertheless, I came into this world rooted as a Malay-Muslim from a tiny country in South-east Asia. While Singapore herself has grown into a giant with large infrastructures majestically depicted in postcard-worthy photographs, not very much still is known about my culture, the Malay-Muslims, especially in this country who has had its doors closed for much of the 20th century due to confining ideologies.

My mission is to change that. And this is where your contribution matters.


THE PROJECT

My first planned exhibition will be to show my culture (Malay-Muslims) and the beautiful countries we inhabit (Malaysia and Singapore) to the people in my adopted home (the Czech Republic).

I am particularly interested in showing my perspective on how the Malay-Muslims in Singapore live and celebrate their auspicious days, and present this to a people who quite likely has little or no prior knowledge on the Malays and our ways. I think this will be a fresh introduction for them, besides the tired durian-and-boat-on-a-building architecture of a typical photo of Singapore. :)

I planned this exhibition for next year in Spring. In July this year, I will be going to Singapore during the Eid holiday celebration, where I will do most of the shooting. The one-year period will give me ample time to storyboard, shoot, post-process, print and mount, market, and do all the other necessary preparations.

I intend to open the exhibition in conjunction with the local Multi-cultural Week event here which attracts both local and foreign visitors from across the country. Potentially, if this is a success, I will want to take this exhibition to the capital city itself, the gorgeous Prague. I will also want to put the photographs in a limited edition pictorial coffee table book.

Your contribution, big or small, will help to set these gears in motion.


WHAT I NEED

First and foremost is a new DSLR. The camera that I plan to get is the Nikon D5300. It's a mid-range DSLR, and currently costs about 730 EUR / 990 USD in the Czech market. I already have some Nikkor lenses that I was using with the ex-camera, so buying a Nikon body is the obvious choice for me.

A tripod - Velbon Sherpa 803RD - costing 180 EUR / 250 USD.

A return flight ticket for the trip costing anywhere from 730 EUR to 1100 EUR.

The rest of the funding will go to printing, mounting, framing, booking a venue, and getting the word out, as well as in fulfilling your "perks". I will use it to print business cards, posters, invites, hire pr and social media tweeters, and possibly other ways my creative mind can think of!!


WHAT WILL YOU GET FOR YOUR CONTRIBUTION

Indiegogo allows me to set up "perks" that I can give to you for the contributions that you make. You can see it as a little "push", in a good way. :) It's also the ways that I can say Thank You for supporting me on this journey. There are different types of "perks" that I can offer for the different levels of contribution, but these are not set in stone. You can change the amount of your contribution in the next page, and whether big or small, I still thank you from the bottom of my heart.


MY PHOTOGRAPHY

Below are just some images from my photographic journey. These might give you an idea of the photo-documentation that I hope to create.


















SPONSORSHIP ACKNOWLEDGEMENTS

During the exhibition, as well as later on in the book, I'd like to put up a board to acknowledge you as a contributor, with your names up there, unless you've chosen to contribute anonymously. If you are contributing on behalf of your business, you can choose to have your logo up there.


OTHER WAYS YOU CAN SUPPORT

This project will grow in stages. Right now I'm building on the momentum from the ground up, and calling out to everyone who's on board in their support right from the beginning in this conceptual stage.

If you can’t contribute monetarily, that doesn’t mean you can’t help.

Please send this link along to your friends and family on Facebook, twitter or just to your email contacts who you think might be interested in supporting me.

The Indiegogo share tools on this site can help get the word out! Click on the Like button and share it on Facebook. Tweet it and GooglePlus it. These small actions will make a big difference.

On Twitter? Click here to tweet!


THANK YOU, THANK YOU, THANK YOU!!

story:
Short Summary

'Women in Contemporary Society' is a photography exhibition organised by SPACE:OCCUPIED, a collective from Edinburgh Napier University. 

Our exhibition focuses on the specific issues of form, gender identity, escapism, self representation and gender expression. As a collective, our individual projects will come together to form a larger body of work that revolves loosely around portraiture. We have chosen this particular subject as this a current and topical issue in the present day. Therefore, we felt that as young adults within this society, it would be pertinent to tackle this subject from a variety of perspectives through each of our projects and our specific interests within our chosen theme.  

The funds donated will be used to finance the production of the exhibition.

The exhibition will be held at Trinity Apse in Edinburgh, Scotland on 8th-15th April 2017. Free admission.

Rosemary Adler - https://r_adler.atavist.com

Cirstyn Brown - www.facebook.com/cirstynbrownphotography/

Jade Cofor - www.jadecofor.com

Oliver Forde - www.facebook.com/oliverfordeimagery/

Agata Kozlowska - www.agita-photography.tumblr.com

Sandi Macdonald-Haig - www.sandimacdonald-haig.format.com

Stewart Main - www.stewartmainphotography.com

 

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is to raise £700 for production costs related to our exhibition.
This includes:

  • building materials
  • heating and electricity for the venue
  • promotional materials (e.g leaflets, posters, flyers, catalogues)
  • transportation for materials
  • exhibition print production (incl. mounting and framing)
  • consumables

Other Ways You Can Help

In addition to any financial support, you can also help support our campaign by spreading the word. Talk to the people around you, follow us on Facebook and Instagram, share our posts and Indiegogo page! 

https://www.facebook.com/spaceoccupiedcollective/

https://www.instagram.com/spaceoccupied/

story:
Hello! 

Thank you to anyone reading this now, this means you have taken the time to show interest in my goal! 

Who am I?

I'm Rebecca, a 23 year old budding photographer. 

What are you donating to?

This crowdfunding project is geared towards supporting my passion and future career. When I sat down to write this, it took a moment to register, only because it's hard to put into words that you need help. When all you're ever told in life is that you need to succeed on your own. I have saved as much as I could from my photo shoots and my part-time job as a cashier, but as much as I saved, it is not nearly enough for the equipment I wish to purchase. 

This money would go towards the purchase of two lenses. These lenses are the suggested lenses for wedding, newborn, portrait, sports, etc. photography. They ARE the go-to that every photographer has in their bags. When I used them in college, they were a dream to work with. I absolutely loved them and they were generally the only ones I booked. However, now it being almost 2 years since I left college, I am sorely missing them. When I searched them up on Henry's website my jaw nearly hit the floor...

Nikon AF-S Nikkor 24-70mm f2.8E VR - $2,999.99 

NIKON AF-S NIKKOR 70-200 F2.8G ED VR II - $2,699.99

How could I, as a part-time worker, afford something like that? 

The end goal here is to get at least one of these lenses. I am currently awaiting notice towards a small business class that will allow me to apply for a small business grant, maximum of $5,000. And now you're asking me why I need help if I'll be receiving $5,000? That number is the max, which means that you are not guaranteed that amount. I may not even receive anything. So in respect to that I am asking for any sort of donation. Even a $1.00 will help as it is a $1.00 I did not have before. 

I currently have $785.00 saved and would appreciate anything that can go towards it! The goal is to purchase one of these by May. 

What is offered to you!

If you are someone I know in real life I can offer you a gift voucher worth up to $30.00 towards a shoot. My portrait shoots are generally $50.00 -$60.00 depending on how many shots you purchase. So you can be saving about 50%! 

I can also offer one free watermarked image for your social media! 

If you're interested in seeing my work, there is always something new on my Facebook page! 

www.facebook.com/RebeccaNadinePhotography

Thank-you! 

Thank you to anyone who has gotten this far in my description and I appreciate even the time you have spent reading this. Take care!
story_txt: Hello! Thank you to anyone reading this now, this means you have taken the time to show interest in my goal! Who am I?I'm Rebecca, a 23 year old budding photographer. What are you donating to?This crowdfunding project is geared towards supporting my passion and future career. When I sat down to write this, it took a moment to register, only because it's hard to put into words that you need help. When all you're ever told in life is that you need to succeed on your own. I have saved as much as I could from my photo shoots and my part-time job as a cashier, but as much as I saved, it is not nearly enough for the equipment I wish to purchase. This money would go towards the purchase of two lenses. These lenses are the suggested lenses for wedding, newborn, portrait, sports, etc. photography. They ARE the go-to that every photographer has in their bags. When I used them in college, they were a dream to work with. I absolutely loved them and they were generally the only ones I booked. However, now it being almost 2 years since I left college, I am sorely missing them. When I searched them up on Henry's website my jaw nearly hit the floor...Nikon AF-S Nikkor 24-70mm f2.8E VR - $2,999.99 NIKON AF-S NIKKOR 70-200 F2.8G ED VR II - $2,699.99How could I, as a part-time worker, afford something like that? The end goal here is to get at least one of these lenses. I am currently awaiting notice towards a small business class that will allow me to apply for a small business grant, maximum of $5,000. And now you're asking me why I need help if I'll be receiving $5,000? That number is the max, which means that you are not guaranteed that amount. I may not even receive anything. So in respect to that I am asking for any sort of donation. Even a $1.00 will help as it is a $1.00 I did not have before. I currently have $785.00 saved and would appreciate anything that can go towards it! The goal is to purchase one of these by May. What is offered to you!If you are someone I know in real life I can offer you a gift voucher worth up to $30.00 towards a shoot. My portrait shoots are generally $50.00 -$60.00 depending on how many shots you purchase. So you can be saving about 50%! I can also offer one free watermarked image for your social media! If you're interested in seeing my work, there is always something new on my Facebook page! www.facebook.com/RebeccaNadinePhotographyThank-you! Thank you to anyone who has gotten this far in my description and I appreciate even the time you have spent reading this. Take care!

story:
Welcome to Kat Ignatova's World Cup VII Indiegogo page!

The Story

Kat started photographing quidditch during the 2012 Western Regionals that were held at University of California, Los Angeles. Since then, she has gone on to photograph dozens of quidditch events (10 tournaments in 2013!), including the World Cup VI. Her work has been published on websites, blogs, newspapers, magazines, and the famous Quidditch Trading Cards. From 2013 to 2014, she worked as the photo editor for the International Quidditch Association. 

Her photography page can be viewed here.

The Book

While fundraising for the next World Cup is already exciting, what really spices up this fundraiser is that it is the first chance for everyone to purchase the very first quidditch photography book! Enjoy over a hundred pages of stunning photography (not to brag) that shows the best of what the previous World Cup had to offer.

One of the perks of getting Kat to the next World Cup is that it would mean another photography book would be in store.

Other Perks

But wait... there's more! Other perks include:

'Deserve Your Hug' postcard


Personalized Poster

Personalized Quidditch Phone Case

*Phone cases include iPhone 4, 4S, 5, 5S, and Samsung Galaxy S3 and S4. 

Photo Prints

Want to go back to the classical photo perk? Have a particular shot from a tournament that you can't seem to forget?

Never fear, for the photo prints are back! Now you can custom order either four (for $25) or eight (for $50) of your favorite photos. This perk has an added perk - you still get the epub version of the photo book!

NEW! - Quidditch Photographer T-Shirt

Want to support your local quidditch photographer and have another shirt to boot? I've got you covered. Love Portal as much as you love quidditch? I've got you covered there too.

Pick-Up and Delivery

All perks will be available for pick-up during World Cup VII and any tournaments following that. Delivery will require additional cost.

story:
WHO WE ARE?

We are experienced travelers, travelled to 40+ countries.

We are young and active. And we are so far from typical touristic ways of new places’ exploring. Trying to feel the spirit of each city, we find hidden sites, traditional markets, places for locals, etc. We discovered that every city, country or culture can give you a lot of exciting emotions if you dive in its casual life.

We also enjoy making photos. We don't like to make thousands “typical”pictures. One “live” photo can show nation’s specific, beauty of actions or positive emotions. So now we intend to create a dream book with “live” photos. And we believe this project will inspire others to discover the world.

OUR PROJECT

We want to collect photo-stories from different countries, but on the same themes, in one book. There will be topics of common life. For example: typical breakfast with a morning newspaper, seller on traditional market, street graffiti. We will talk to local people and add their comments into the book, to make our photos “real”. So everyone’ll be able to see the life through the eyes of citizens of diverse parts of our planet.

You can participate in campaign by ordering the book. Also you can try yourself as topic creator or even model. Read perks description for further details.

During our project we gather funds only for book release. All expenses for travelling are covered by our own, except rewards for access to “closed photo points” (like roofs or working areas)

  • Design: $700
  • Editing: $1 000
  • Production: $8 600
  • Charges for expensive topics: $1 500
  • Indiegogo fees: $590
  • Total: $12 390

If we don’t collect $12 390 we will decrease quantity of printed books. However, we are sure that our campaign will be successful. Anyway – you will receive your perks with 100% guaranty.

You can see the project’s timing below. 

UNDER THE COVER

Our World is as wonderful, as diverse. This will be the keynote of our book.

The book includes a few topics. Each theme begins with the blitz-interviews of locals - random passers, workers or any people who ready to talk. We will ask them about interesting and specific facts on selected topics and will try to discover emotional part of life in this concrete region.

Interviews will be in two languages - English and Ukrainian.

Then there will be photos on the same topic in different regions and countries. We'll use both - our travel experience and information received during the interviews, to find the most impressive moments and places.

When you decide to support our campaign, you will join our adventure and become the part of this story about beauty of our planet. We're sincerely grateful for your participation!

COOL PERKS!

Small book

Size 20*20 cm

Hard cover 

High quality photo print

+ YOUR NAME IN THE BOOKON “THANKS PAGE”

Big book

Size 25*25 cm

Hard cover 

High quality photo print

+ YOUR NAME IN THE BOOKON “THANKS PAGE”

Topic perk

The book will contain about 20 topics. We already selected 10 topics and you can be an author of the remaining 10 ideas. There are just a few conditions for ideas: close connection to project idea, nothing illegal, no risk for life. Just tell which photo-story is in your mind, and we’ll make it!

+ YOUR NAME IN THE BOOKON THE PAGE WITH PHOTOSTORY

Model perk

Minimal list of the cities for photos in project: Kyiv, Lisbon, New York, Tokyo, Bangkok, Dubai, Stockholm. If you are from these cities– welcome to be on the pages of our book! We will contact you and discuss the place and topic of your photo session.

+ YOUR NAME IN THE BOOKUNDER THE PHOTO

+ PERSONAL HANDMADE GREETING ON THE BOOK COVER

RISKS AND CHALLENGES

The only risk is to lose photos, taken during the project. And to be safe in this case we’re going to make back-ups every day.

WHY WE WILL SUCCEED

We are experienced travelers and photo-makers. We’ve seen a lot of exciting moments of common life in variety of countries and we know how to find them.

We have a strict plan, timing and strategy of realizing this campaign.

And we are ready to realize this project together with you!

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

If you can’t invest in our campaign, we ask you to help by sharing our story:

  1. Send this page to a friend who loves travelling or discovering the World!
  2. Share this campaign with your friends and relatives on social media!
  3. If you know someone from organizations, forums or social groups who can be interested in our campaign – share this information with them please.

MANY THANKS!

story:
mothers....

My name is Gloria Ferres, I am a photographer from paraguay, currently based in Milan.  My passion for photography started years ago when I was studying in Boston.  I was living with a writer who had worked for National Geographic. His house was filled with beautiful black and white photos which sparked my immagination and my love for telling stories through the lens.

"Mothers" is my first solo exhibition. The concept is based around women who are struggling with motherhood and all the changes that are happening in their lives. I myself have a four year old boy who has drastically changed my life. Through my pictures I want to show the beauty of the bond which develops between mothers & their children and also, I want to celebrate the strength of women who struggle to mantain the balance between what they were and what they have become.

Your contribution will help me materialize my first exhibition! I currently need the money to pay for prints & installation.

 

what you get for helping me out:

The 3,000 euros which I need will be used to pay for the prints and also, to pay for the  installation and lighting of the pictures. 

-black & white diapers  (25+ euro) : you will get by mail a set of postcards with the pictures from the exhibition.

-black & white onesies (50+ euros): you will get by mail a 18 x 24 cm signed photo from the exhibition, plus  your name will also appear in the contributor banner installed at the entrance of exhibition.

-black & white super pacifier (100+ euros): with this contribution you will get the postcard set, the signed 18 x 24 photo, your fancy name in the contributor banner and also a dvd with the video interviews which will be installed in the exhibition.

if you can't make a financial contribution, please make some really loud noise about this campaign. Share it with your friends, your families and your work colleagues. Thank you from all my heart!

story:
Hey, 

My Name is Santiago Arciniegas and I am a multimedia artist. As a photographer, I've been working with my own body in front of a camera for the past seven or so years. Now, I'm looking for your help, to publish a photobook I created called: School Lies.

Why, you ask?

Well, I told a lot of stupid lies when I was in high school. I guess I wanted make people believe... That I was better? (Laughs) Or maybe just normal. I lied about the most mundane stuff... Having friends, going on vacations... Silly childish lies. Then I came out and... that ended.

Now, I’ve made a book, a photo book, because being in school is weird. Being a teenager in school is weirder... and my time there was especially weird - In a very depressing suicidal way I may add, but weirder for me because I was both terrified and in love with the experience.

There are a lot of behaviors that are almost exclusive to school-like environments, some which are unexpectedly outrageous, or silly and simple and some that are... just fucking hot. Hehe... Especially if you are boy, a queer boy, in a boys-only Catholic school.

The problem of finding out that you are gay while going to a Catholic school wasn't without its consequences. Shy, introverted and scared. I developed an oppressing agoraphobia and barely socialized at all. Still, beyond my personal trauma I’ve come to realize that we live in a society in which the ideas of manhood and boys are in flux. During my time being in a traditional boys-will-be-boys type of setting, these behaviors set off in me, all kinds of conflicting feelings. Some, homoerotic in nature others much more complex in terms of power dynamics, aesthetics, basic social interactions, etc.

Even more interestingly, some of these behaviors were part of larger sets of actions; Actions that were both deeds of petty violence and random humiliation as well as shared moments of intense camaraderie and bonding.

For example, there is a crucial difference between, bullying and hazing. Among boys, bullying is done with the intention of shunning or rejecting, yet in hazing, the exact same kind of behaviors are carried out for an entirely different purpose. There is a complicity and permission given. There is a desire to show off, to perform. It’s geared toward a celebration, a need for contact, a quest for belonging. In a heterosexual normative all boy environment, hazing is something to be desired.

Now, during the past years I've kept those used teenage uniforms, and created images, that I hope to share with him and with you to give you an insight, not only into my trauma, but also to create a photo story that shares what happened there, what I saw, what it felt like.

This photographic recreation was a methodical effort. I stalked people's old photos on Facebook, I had a list (I keep a lot of lists) of moments, of memories from what I witnessed back then. I shot myself, all over the city of Bogotá, especially around the neighborhood I grew up in and reenacted through images, my experiences of those transgressive school moments as faithfully as I could.

The themes of bullying, boyhood and masculinity remain a part of me. They are an integral part of my worldview and pour into my work. After overcoming a 7-year long depression, I decided to embark on a performance journey during the past 18 months. I needed to change - who I am, who I was. I decided to go back and confront some demons, some memories, so I put on the old uniform, and pretended to be who I wanted to have been.

This book compiles the self-portraits I took during this time where I put myself out there for the world to see. Now with your help I can tell the details of my journey and the images that brought me catharsis. Maybe they will give you some insight, not of who I am, but of what you need to do, what you might have overlooked through the magnifying lens of what I saw, felt the need to rescue and what I needed to remember.

​

Since this is an entirely personal project, I have chosen to use a for hire self-publishing service to handle the workload of getting it done. The book will be made through local publishing houses in Bogota. I have already asked for quotes and they are standing by for printing.

I have already finished the book!

It’s a bit massive, including a full set of 260 images.

Meaning I am not asking money to complete the project. Photos have been taken, edited, and curated. The book has been typeset and layout has been completed. Unless it surpasses some stretch goals, all costs will go to the publishing house, ISBN, fees, taxes, shipping and logistics of the rewards.

​The book will be printed on 1x1 format, of approximately 22cm.

This is my first crowdfunding campaign, as with all new ventures I take, I enter it, reading all I can, but aware that there will be unexpected obstacles to overcome. However, I am freelancer, and I have managed to stay alive... and well, I find that just remarkable. I will do my best to bring this project to completion, and I will share with you the photography in one way or another if the goal is not reached.

For me it would mean the world, to be able to share this book with a broader audience. I would be so honored and happy if you would like to contribute. Please take a look at the perks.

story:
Our Story

My story is YOU.  Your imaging needs, your need for advertising, your need for self-promotion, your need to reach out to those interested in what YOU have to offer.  With over 20 years shooting Weddings, Sports, Product and events, your imaging needs require someone who is as concerned as you are about how you appear to others.


The Impact

Your Image is My Image.  I think that says is it all.  I am looking to boost someone else's image with my image making ability.


What We Need & What You Get

I am starting my own business.  I am not going to report to 16 different levels of management just to be informed the "company needs to scale back."  In this economy, actions speak louder than words.  My goal is $5,000.00.  With your help, that goal will be reached.  If my goal isn't achieved, I will try again until I am successful.  In return, I will advertise your business, publicly thank you and hopefully assist you and your endeavors in doing the one thing that makes a difference:  MAKE MONEY. 


Other Ways You Can Help

Talk to your friends, mention me to your associates.  Follow me on Twitter, chat with me on Facebook, send me an email!  I know of politicians who made millions by simple contributions over the Internet.  Let me help you by letting me know about you.

story:
Some people crave the spotlight.  Some people seek fame.  Some people want as much exposure as possible.  Graffiti artists definitely fall under this category, doing whatever it takes to be seen and known.  Of course, there are a lot of ways for a person to gain exposure, such as by shedding their clothing.

We live in a society where graffiti and public nudity are both illegal.  So I took pictures of both, at the same time.


"Exposure" is a 56-page book of photos I took over the past couple months.  I am trying to raise enough money for my initial run of self-published copies.  I will then send them out to publishers and see if anyone wants to pick it up and print it themselves.


By contributing you will be helping me get to the next step.  But this ain't charity!  You'll get a copy of the book!  And you'll be my new best friend.  Plus you'll get to see pictures of me and my friends naked, as well as some really good (and some really bad) Albuquerque graffiti.


Money is always tight for all us artist types, I know.  If you think this is a cool idea, but can't afford to pitch in, you can still help me out by passing or posting this link to anyone who might be interested. 


Thanks!  Much love.

story:
New Video! - http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9sk483huK_Q

Short Summary

My name's James Emmerson, and I'm a signed model for Aesthetic Clarity Ltd. In my near 8 months with this crazy crew, a hell of a lot has happened, and I've seen them help people grow in so many ways, whether it be through their confidence, their modelling abilities, their social prescence, or any of the above and more.
 
But in order to continue doing the wonderful jobs they do, Toya Harvey and Emma-Louise Bullions (our primary internal photographers and director/marketing manager respecitively) are in need of new cameras and equipment, and we need your help.

What We Need & What You Get

Cameras don't come cheap, and neither does the equipment they require to capture life at its finest quality. To cover the costs of lighting, flash guns, high-end Nikon model cameras, battery packs and lenses, I'm looking to raise about £5,000 for these girls. It's a lot to ask, but I really want to make this happen for them. They've already done so much for so many people, and I hope we can help them continue to do more.

Even if we don't reach our goal, every penny earned will go towards funding new equipment for Aesthetic Clarity, Ltd. so they can continue to change lives for the better.

The Impact

Aesthetic Clarity is home to over 50 signed models, from all backgrounds and walks of life, of all shapes and sizes, and all of them have come a long way since they started (myself most definitely included). If we're able to reach our goal, Toya and Emma will be able to continue shooting our models in the highest quality, and help so many more people to grow, both as models and as individuals

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're unable to contribute financially, you're more than welcome to share the campaign page or the Aesthetic Clarity Facebook page or Twitter feeds, and spread the good word.
 
I hope you're interested in this campaign, and am looking forward to seeing how this plays out. AC have done a lot for me since I've met them, and with your help, this would be a wonderful way to pay back the favour.

story:
Hi friends and followers! Thank you for taking the time to read my campaign.

Many of you have known me for sometime as a model, and when I started transitioning to being behind the camera you supported my ideas and creativity. 

Thank you for supporting me creatively. 

Now to put it out into the universe. 

I need to go full frame. 

I love my little tiny entry level compact crop sensor camera. I do. BUT

He just can't put out the results I need or want if I plan to do this as a profession. 

And I do. 

$2500 is a lot of money!


WHY I NEED YOU:


Moving here was a financial pain in the ass. We drained any savings and even used money from the husbands old college account.  When we received our tax refund it went to paying off everything we borrowed... and we are left with nothing. 
I don't just see this as you helping to invest in some "toy" for me to play picture maker on. I see this as a complete investment in my future as artist, photographer, and perhaps one day provider for my family.

What will the money be spent on?
Glad you asked!
Canon 6D with 24-105mm lens
Canon 50mm lens
Taxes
Accident protection (lets face, you know me)
Materials for your awesome rewards!!

This one donation is an investment into all of my future creative projects!!!

This is an investment in my artistic education, something grants won't cover on top of child care and other supplies.
This is an investment in a start up business. 
This is an investment in all future projects. So if I ever do something ground breaking you can say "I made that happen."


With these tools, I can start a business. With these tools I will be able work on projects in more detail and higher quality than I ever have before.  Thank you for your time.

story:
Everyone wants pictures of cute animals... but there are NOT ENOUGH. So I will go out and get more. BETTER pictures. Pictures of fucking OTTERS. And it will be MAGICAL.

I've been taking photos for about 17 years now, partially as a hobby, partially as a part time career. I've done a couple of weddings, some shoots with humans, landscapes, and animals. But never otters. And that should change. AND CHANGE NOW! So help me help you. We both win by getting pictures of otters, and clogging up the internet with super awesome pictures of the earth's most adorable creature.

I have had kids throw up on their picture day, I had extra clothes ready in my bag just in case. I had rain on wedding days (but no, that is not irony Alanis), and was able to use light filtering to make it look like the sun had just drifted beyond a cloud for a moment, and give them the look they wanted. I can use a combination of editing, magic, and mad skills (that's right, l33t sk1llz) to make a shit picture look great.

The point is, short of Godzilla showing up to the site, I am usually 110% prepared for just about anything. And if Godzilla shows up, then I guess this campaign just became about getting pictures of a giant lizard monster. 

I'm flexible as hell.

Plus I deserve to hang out with some super cute otters.

*Side note, that picture is not taken by me, see why we need better photos?*

*Update to the campaign:

Due to health issues I have had to put off a part of the photo shoot that I had planned on including with the otters.  A part of the shoot was going to be of some of the local flora and fauna in the botanical gardens here in Sheffield, however, due to an unexpected surgery, I had to put this off.  I will be doing that next weekend, before the surgery, and have added another week to the campaign for this purpose. 

This will be done fully with just my DSLR (as I'm saving the SLR for the otter pictures) so they will hopefully be up and you can see some of the gallery of photos then.  I apologise about this, as this was not something that was expected.  I did not expect to have to have surgery as I have.


Thank you,

Stacy

story:
Who, what, why?

Architecture student for 5 years and passionate photographer since 2005, i'm working for one year on a 365 days journey, to the antipode of Lyon France, which is located near Chatham Islands, New Zealand. 

Mostly in black and white, but in color as well for one year, my work try to catch the instant, while focusing on light and surrounding motion. this passion lead me to far places in the world such as New-York, Iceland, or Hong-Kong, and i am now willing to make one complete journey to document all the different lifestyles and landscapes along the way. During this trip I will be using only low carbon transportation which makes it responsible and respectful.

Mentioned in the 500 best amateurs photographers out of 50 000 photographs by PHOTO magazine in 2008, and exposed in Lyon architecture school in 2011 under the expo name "don't tell my mum i'm gone again", my work is serious and tries to be recognized. 

After trying a 365 days photographs experiment to show the beauty of everyday's sky and lights, this journey around the world has the goal to promote the beauty and diversity of life  , as well as freedom of movement across borders. It will lead to a photo exposition at the anniversary date of the departure, which has to be fixed. 

If the goal of this campaign is reached (or nearly reached) the trip and expo will happen and i will do my best to thank all of you contributors. If not, money will go to the photographer's Yann Arthus Bertrand "goodplanet" association, with of course any proof i can provide.

I may remind you that this is of course a project that counts a lot for me and that i hope it'll reach it's goal. So make some noise about it, pass the word, share. Help this happen.

http://anthonyspennato.wordpress.com/2012/02/09/bw_photo/

http://anthonyspennato.wordpress.com/2012/02/10/color_photographs/

The Journeys' map:

http://www.tripline.net/trip/RTW-4470477505011003905AD30EB8C903E4

GoodPlanet website:

http://www.goodplanet.org/
