story:
The exhibition and documentary project

Can beauty prevail when innocent people are disfigured by acid attacks? Can they rise stronger than before, more empowered and determined?

Award winning photographer Ken Hermann and videographer Tai Klan
travelled to Bangladesh to answer these questions.

Through the great efforts of the Acid Survivors Foundation (ASF) the numbers of acid attacks have gone down, however Bangladesh is a country
still plagued by acid attacks. In many cases the attack comes from within
the family, mostly due to disputes over honour, dowry, property or land.
Women, men and children are left with the painful physical and mental
scars that stay with them for the rest of their lives. 

Focusing on the positive and aesthetic aspects of these otherwise tragic
stories, Ken Hermann has created a strong portrait series, while Tai Klan
takes us really close to the portrayed with his moving short documentary. The project was in part realized in collaboration with the ASF in Bangladesh.

The complete project will be revealed at the KontraFrame gallery in Copenhagen duringthe annual Copenhagen Photo Festival June 7th 2013.

What we need

The money will go towards finishing the editing of the documentary, colorgrading & sound mixing and printing the photographs in a nice (hopefully) big format with framing for the exhibition. Beside that Suzette Frovin (journalist) is working on all the text for the project.

Supporting the project and helping to raise awareness about this worthwhile cause, we have put together some nice perks for you, ranging from 10-400 €. Hopefully you will like them but any donation amount is greatly appreciated.  

Support

We were lucky to get financial support from Amnesty International & The Danish Journalist Union to cover some of the expenses from the trip. 

The exhibition and documentary will require a total of 7.500€ to be completed. With 5.500 € pledged we feel confident to start the production and we will then cover the rest ourselves.

About

If you would like to know more about our work and us, you can visit our websites:

photographer www.kenhermann.com  

videographer www.taiklan.dk

journalist www.suzettefrovin.com

The End Result

After a hopefully successful exhibition, we plan to push the project to digital platforms, magazines, blogs and newspapers around the world. Our aim is that this will create a worldwide awareness about the cause and especially the foundation Acid Survivor Foundation (ASF) in Bangladesh and their great work. 

You can already support the ASF directly through their website, however we believe that engaging, rich and immersive content like the pictures and the documentary from the exhibition are capable of creating even more awareness and attention world wide. An awareness that wil eventually generate even more donations to this imporant cause.

If we reach our goal

If we reach our funding goal, we will ship the exhibition to the Acid Survivor Hospital in Bangladesh to lift up their spirit and let them enjoy the pictures we made together. 

Bonus info (out of budget)

If - by chance - this campaign catches wildfire and we raise heaps of cash, we would absolutely love to invite some of the survivors to Copenhagen and show them the exhibition. Although this might be a long shot, we think it would certainly boost the exhibition and would be a huge experience for the survivors. Further, their visit would help the message of acid survivors to reach an even greater audience within Denmark.

Please help spread the word...

If you are not able to help support the campaign financially, please share it with all your friends and network that might find it interesting. You never know, this might end up helping us even more! Thank you in advance.

story:
May Days is my first monograph. I have worked on this series of photographs in book form for the past three years.  What is May Days?   In 2014 and also the following year I went to Cuba to co-teach a photography class to a group of American students in Havana. We conducted our classes at the Center for the Studies of Jose Marti, where I met Cuban friends who introduced me to attitudes, views, and life of the island. This series of photographs are my visual record of my time-- during the days of May--and encounters with people and places which seemed to me significant about Havana and Cuba at this specific moment--a time of transition and imminent change.

Although I grew up in the former East Germany, it was important to me not to see things through the filter of socialism and economic hardship - although only too apparent -  but through social and human engagement that was serendipitous and open. I conceived the work in book format from the start and am excited to present it for publication in 2017.  

Making of the book mock up, 2016.

By contributing to the May Days project you will directly enable the final design, printing, and distribution of the book. The majority of production costs consist of the printing and that’s where we need help. We will print in a small limited first edition of 500. Through our pre-sale of signed copies of the limited edition, and through all the other perks listed, you contribute your funds directly to its production. 

The production costs:

Softcover, 6.75" x 9", 106 pages

  1. Text design of book: $300
  2. Production cost, incl. printing and packaging for shipment: $20.82 for each book, total $10,410
  3. Cost of high quality color proof: $15 per page, total $1590
  4. Shipment of 500 copies from printer to US: $1200
  5. Distribution: $1500

Fees for using the Indiegogo campaign service are not included in the overall amount and which I will pay out of pocket.

Exhibition prints are available, print size 18x27", paper size 24x30" (unframed).

The largest challenge for the production of the book is covering the costs of printing. However, the production costs of photography books used to be much more costly, in fact impossible for the majority of photographers. The beauty of the current independent book publishing movement and  access to printers have lowered those costs and made publishing possible for photographers and artists outside the mainstream.

Limited edition portfolios, 8x10" + 13x19". Archival pigment prints, signed.

Please check out the various ways in which you can contribute on this webpage and discover what your rewards are.  Even if we do not reach our entire goal - all contributions matter and make a difference towards publication.  If you are not interested in the rewards, you may also choose other amounts by clicking the Back It button underneath campaign title and to the right of video.

If we do not reach the full goal, I am committed to personally fund the remaining expense through affordable loans made available to working artists.

Once the book is published we will be able to distribute the monograph to a broader audience, especially to educational institutions and libraries nationwide and in Cuba. I would like to make the book available to communities who would not otherwise have access, instead of viewing the work in gallery settings.

Layout, editing and sequencing of the book dummy, 2016.

Not all of you will be able to contribute, but there are other ways to help.  Spread the word, you might know of someone who specializes in Caribbean cultural studies or is part of an institution who would have interest in promoting the project. Please use all of the sharing tools we provide here, whichever your preferred platform.

Thank you for your interest and consideration for funding. 

With deep appreciation,

Dana

story:
Levels of reading, 2016

Autumn up, 2015

 

2011 was the year when my adventurous journey started in the world of photography. In that year I bought a compact camera and I started taking photos. I especially liked capturing subtle subjects – moments, landscapes and nature. Then, I realized that I wanted to bring more out of my photos, so I decided to buy my first digital SLR camera, it was December 2012. With the new lenses, and the possibilities they offered, opened an almost completely new world to me and I started to use the camera more widely. I was interested in abstract themes, macros, architectures, cityscape and astrophotography, too. In the following years my passion about photography was intact and I have expanded my photo archive.

The last year (2017) was an important milestone in my photography work. For the first time I applied for the National Geographic Photographer of the Year contest in the cities category. I had a huge pleasure, because I won with my photo called Levels of reading. 
The book contains my favorite and best quality images that I made in the past years and among these photos there are also some images which were never seen before. They will be appear in the book the first time.

 

Options

What you can choose from:

  • Beautiful book
  • Limited edition prints (signed, signed and numbered)
  • The calendar 2019

 

Limited Edition Prints

With my sophisticated and eye-catching technique, the colors and details will impress you. It will look like you are looking at a painting, but you will see a photo.

 

Here are the details:

LIMITED EDITION PRINTS:

These are SIGNED LIMITED EDITION Giclée Prints on Hahnemühle Paper.

25 copies are available in each size. (medium and small)

Limited Edition Medium Prints: 76x50cm / 29.9x19.7”+ 5cm / 1.9” white border - signed print

Limited Edition Small Prints: 26x17,3cm / 11x7.2”+ 2cm / 0.8” white border - signed print

 

COLLECTOR EDITION PRINTS:

Collector Edition prints are SIGNED AND NUMBERED LIMITED EDITION Giclée Prints on Hahnemühle Paper.

Only 7 copies are available in each size (large and medium)!

Collector Edition Large Print: 90x60cm / 35.4x23.6” + 5cm / 1.9” white border - signed and numbered and includes a signed certificate of authenticity 

Collector Edition Medium Print: 76x50cm / 29.9x19.7” + 5cm / 1.9” white border - signed and numbered and includes a signed certificate of authenticity

 

The Calendar

The calendar consists of 12 images, based on a selection of pictures on which each photo was made in the current month. On the other hand every image was taken in my home country, in Hungary. So the final calendar is beautiful and moody.

You will get:

  • 1 calendar, 12 months,  12 photos from Hungary, format: 210x297mm / 8.3x11.7”
  • 1 covar page 12 different nature photos

 

The Book

I have designed the book so that it uses the higheset quality technology which makes it even more fun to turn the page. I wanted to give you the best quality book available and that's why I chose to print and produce it 100% in Hungary.

Some interesting details:

  • Landscape format: 250x200mm - 9.8x7.9”
  • 48 pages
  • 42 high resolution photos
  • Flat-opening sewn binding
  • Hard cover

The high quality paper is silky and is very pleasant to the touch.

 

How you also can help

 

If you can’t contribute right now, you can still be part of the project by sharing this campaign among your friends. I would appreciate it very much.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Alan Mildor and i'm an aspiring photographer from Brooklyn, New York.I'm seeking help to get a new professional DSLR camera.The money raised would be put towards furthering my business through purchasing a camera with better settings for sharper, more colorful images. This DSLR camera would help me shoot in all conditions and offering clients the highest quality as well as take better photos for future clients who may need headshots, photoshoots, and multiple events. To take a look at some of my work through my career, feel free to visit http://mistermildorphotography.4ormat.com  or http://www.mistermildor.com

What We Need & What You Get

A total of $5000 is needed. All of the money collected will go entirely to the professional DSLR camera(Canon 5d mark 3).  Even if this goal isn't reached by the deadline, funds will still used to purchase the DSLR camera. What you get in return for your smallest contribution ranges anywhere from a personal "Thank You" card to a photo from the Mister Mildor photo portfolio or a small photo shoot session, complete with photos on a  cd/dvd along with printed photos. (PLEASE NOTE: Client redeeming photoshoot "perks" must live NEW YORK CITY area or willing to travel to NYC in order to recieve "perks").

 

The Impact

 The impact your contribution would have is a ripple effect. NONE of your contributions would go to any "personal" aspects. These funds are stricly for the MISTER MILDOR photography business. In purchasing a new camera, I would be able to take better photos, offering my client(s) improvement on quality. The business of photography (like any other small business) works increasingly on word of mouth. The better quality, the more business. An improvement of business, provides an improvement of revenue, an improvement of revenue, provides endless possibilities. Not only would you be contributing to a better camera, but your contribution would have an effect on the MISTER MILDOR business. And for that I THANK YOU in advance. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
Hello! I'm Crissy.


I'm a part time student and co-own Squittle (http://squittle.storenvy.com)

I started up a photography business a year ago that I adore doing. (http://facebook.com/crissymacielphotography) I have this huge goal to upgrade to full frame this year as well as becoming a full time photographer during summer.

I love to shoot portraits in natural low light. I am looking to expand my business, provide higher quality images and shoot with my lenses at the normal focal length. I rely on my photography business for income since I am a mute and unemployed. This upgrade would help my business and myself financially when returning to school!

I have had my lovely Canon 7D for a couple of years now and lately I am having some issues with it. Camera shutting off mid shoot, several error messages and a overheating warning upon first turning it on. Instead of spending hundreds to get it fixed, I think this is a sign for an upgrade. That's where you come in. :)

What I Need

All of the money fundraised will be going toward:

(used if possible) Canon 5D Mark II

Perks

-A thank you on my blog and twitter!

-One handmade octopus crochet plush in blue or pink.
Contact me privately with your color choice.

 

Thank you for your time and contribution.

Any amount will be extremely appreciated!

story:
My name is Jonathan Levitt and I moved to NYC 3 years ago

  • In 2018 after a serious back injury I started taking daily trips to North Manhattan's Fort Tryon Park, where I would luxuriate in the beauty of the heather garden all while nursing my condition as I made my way around the park grounds.
  • In 2018 I started the facebook page "Fort Tryon Flower Power" soon after I began my walking trips and started with an old iPhone 6 documenting the beautiful flowers, bees and butterflies. I eventually graduated to a better phone and then finally was given a Nikon SLR camera by my sister.
  • Over the course of two and a half years my photography has improved as well as brought countless joy to the people who follow my posts.
  • Since this September I started to document the park's birds as the flowers were dying back. My explorations in the wildlife realm have been a daily dose of beauty to me and the friends around me.
  • The picture of the Red Tailed hawk is a photo of mine.

 

I need a semi professional lens for wildlife photos

  • I need to raise 1600$ to cover the purchase from B&H photo for one Nikon Nikor F200-500 lens. (cost is 1396 +tax= 1520.93 + Indie Gogo fees)  https://www.bhphotovideo.com/c/product/1175034-...
  • For your donation I will send you, digitally, a super high resolution photo of one of my photos with the new lens. I will also add you to the thank you's on the Fort Tryon Flower Power page so people will see that you supported my photography. 
  • If I don't reach the whole goal I will augment the funds with items I'm currently selling on eBay to make up the difference.

The Impact

  • You will be helping me take my photography to the next level
  • I encourage you to go to my facebook page Fort Tryon Flower Power to see how I've evolved as a photographer.
  • You will be helping me bring even more beauty to people especially during this difficult time for humanity.

In 2018 I started the facebook page "Fort Tryon Flower Power" soon after I began my walking trips and started with an old iPhone 6 documenting the beautiful flowers, bees and butterflies. I eventually graduated to a better phone and then finally was given a Nikon SLR camera by my sister.
Over the course of two and a half years my photography has improved as well as brought countless joy to the people who follow my posts.
Since this September I started to document the park's birds as the flowers were dying back. My explorations in the wildlife realm have been a daily dose of beauty to me and the friends around me.
The picture of the Red Tailed hawk is a photo of mine.

For your donation I will send you, digitally, a super high resolution photo of one of my photos with the new lens. I will also add you to the thank you's on the Fort Tryon Flower Power page so people will see that you supported my photography. 
If I don't reach the whole goal I will augment the funds with items I'm currently selling on eBay to make up the difference.


The Impact

You will be helping me take my photography to the next level
I encourage you to go to my facebook page Fort Tryon Flower Power to see how I've evolved as a photographer.
You will be helping me bring even more beauty to people especially during this difficult time for humanity.

story:
Our Event and WHY We Need Your Help:

The University of the Arts Photography Class of 2013 has been working relentlessly this past year on developing their Senior Theis projects- As a class we have decided to celebrate and share our artwork with the public by holding an off campus show at the Icebox Gallery in the Crane Arts Building (located in Philadelphia).

We hope for the opening of this show, which will take place on Friday, April 26th, to be a celebration of our accomplishments! We look forward to holding this event, however we need YOUR help in order to make it happen!

We need to raise $1,100 over the course of the next month to make sure that this event can successfully take place! Your donations to our campaign will go directly towards funding both the rental of the Icebox Gallery (for the time of April 24th to May 2nd), as well as the memorable event that we hope to make of our opening night! We plan to provide food, drinks, and entertainment for all of our guests on the night of April 26th, however these things don't come free-so we need to fundraise in order to make sure that our show will be memorable for all in attendance! 

Please consider donating to our campaign and then be sure to come and see the art we have created!

The Icebox Gallery is located in the Crane Arts Building at 1400 N. American St, Philadelphia PA.

Bring your friends and spread the word!

Thanks to all from The University of the Arts Photography Seniors!

story:
What We Need & What You Get

We are looking to raise a total of £1,000. 

This money will primarily go towards paying for the exhibition space, (alongside with contributions from the university and ourselves).

We have been granted an open space that will need panels fitted and lighting so we can all have space to exhibit our work in a professional manner. As well as materials, printing and framing.

The Impact

The show represents a culmination of three years of consistent hard work and dedication towards our craft as photographers. 

As a team we will be responsible for designing, setting up and curating the exhibition space. It is extremely important to make this show happen for all of us, as it is an exciting platform to show our work to a large audience and many great future opportunities are born out of exhibitions such as this one.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to donate, you can still help us just by letting people know about the show! Please share this page with all your friends, and we hope to see you all there.

If you are unable to donate, you can still help us just by letting people know about the show! Please share this page with all your friends, and we hope to see you all there.

story:
The Headshot Truck was developed by in late 2013 by a team of photographers, technical magicians, and entrepreneurs. The first version of The Headshot Truck launched in Southern California in 2014 to much fanfare. In fact, just a couple months after our successful West Coast launch, Los Angeles Magazine called us the "most LA thing to ever happen to LA". Thanks to the hardwork and dedication of our dream team, we were able to create the first all-inclusive mobile photography studio in the world. 


Our mission in 2014 was simple: help actors struggling to achieve their dreams acquire high quality, low cost headshots that wouldn't break the bank. We're proud to say we've helped countless actors pursue their dreams, land coveted series regular gigs, and become national spokespeople for Fortune 500 companies. 



We're not ones to rest on our laurels. Helping actors achieve their goals - while itself a wildly fulfilling task -  just wasn't enough to keep our rapidly expanding team busy. After moving into a new office, doubling the size of our staff, and throwing the most kick-ass launch party Southern California has ever seen, we decided to expand our offering to local businesses and weddings and events.

Now, in addition to providing actors with impressive theatrical and commercial headshots, we help small and medium sized business provide cost-effective individual and group composite shots of it's staff. With the rise in popularity of social media sites liked LinkedIn and Facebook, having a great profile image just isn't enough. You've got to sell your personal brand and stand out from the 500 million other users vying for the same job, opportunity, or sale. But don't just take our word for it; check out some of the companies we've worked with recently:



We also developed a interactive photo booth that can be used for weddings, parties, birthdays, corporate events, red carpet celebrations, and more. Utilizing the latest in digital technology, our truck makes every other photo booth look like, well, every other photo booth. Utilizing green screen technology, light painting, video and GIF capture, we create an interactive experience that is bound to be the highlight of your event or party. The parties are high quality and the price is spot on.

After two years of great success in Los Angeles, it's time to go bicoastal! Our team of experts aboard each truck includes a makeup artist, wardrobe consultant and a photographer. Rain or shine, our goal is to enable and empower every client that climbs aboard to produce a solid set of headshots, without breaking the bank or wasting time.



We've received countless emails, tweets, and direct messages from our fans on the East Coast. And, finally, we're happy to announce: WE'RE LISTENING AND WE'RE ON OUR WAY TO NEW YORK, NEW JERSEY, and CONNECTICUT as we speak. This is our first expansion, and we are all very excited. Help us make our New York City Truck just as successful as Los Angeles!

Spend a little, get a lot!

While a few of our perks are donation based, most of them serve as pre-sale packages for headshots and other services (such as corporate shoots and Photo Booth time!).

We aren’t just asking for your money, we’re inviting you to shoot with us as soon as the truck arrives! We want to meet you, and elevate your most essential marketing tool. 

Why Choose The Headshot Truck?

It’s been proven that you don’t need headshots that cost an arm and a leg. You need headshots that are high-quality, look like you and are compelling. We can deliver that at a fraction of the cost.  Plus, we can come to you! I mean, seriously that is huge! Whether you are an actor or business professional we can make your photos represent your type or brand. 


What to Expect

You will simply climb aboard the truck, we will choose a colored backdrop, adjust lighting, and we will take amazing headshots for you. You can see their photos in real time on our monitor that way you leave the truck knowing we got a shot you'll love, and we will email access to the photos to you in a few days! 

Every photo we take is color corrected PLUS we give you every image we take, which no other photographer does. This sets us apart from other photographers who only give you one image of your choice. With us you can download or print your images as you wish. We provide the images in multiple sizes that way you can select which size you need for what platform. You will have hi-resolution (print) and low resolution (web) formats included for each image. 


Actor-Tested, Agent-Approved

•Team of Experts. We've assembled a stellar team of experts to take care of you while you're on board the truck. Every session offers an experienced headshot photographer, makeup artist and wardrobe consultant to guide you through the process. No newbies. No experimenting. No guess work. 

•Fully equipped studio. We've packed a small space with all the amenities a full-sized studio has: a makeup station, wardrobe station, music, lights, cameras, and computer equipment.

•Wireless Review System. With our cutting edge wireless system, you can see your images on a large monitor in real time, as they are being taken! Make whatever adjustments you want, and know exactly what you're getting during your session. Instant gratification! 

•Mobile. We bring our expert team and tricked out studio to you! We will be able to operate and deliver what you need, anytime, anywhere. Rain or shine, any time of the year - you can be sure you're getting the photos you need, every time. 

•Fun. You're on a truck. With kindred spirits. Just hanging out. 

•Free and easy image delivery. You get a shareable online gallery that is easy to navigate. You get a free download of all of your high resolution, color corrected images without watermarks. No hidden fees. No waiting for a disc in the mail. 

•Affordable. Get a high quality process and product, with some fun and convenience, all at a fraction of the cost.

To help us reach our goal, simply:

1. Click on the "Back This Project" button at the top of the page. Enter your pledge amount and select your perk. (NYC Actors- The perks are your pre-sale packages- chose how many looks you want!)

2. Create your account and enter your credit card information.

3. Spread the word! This step is key. Share our campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, email or carrier pigeon. Even if you don’t pledge, shares are so important!

And you're done! Thank you so much for your support! 


So who are the people behind this awesome new project? Well, they say it takes a village and The Headshot Truck is more like a small metropolis. We've got team members based in Southern California, Northern California, Connecticut, New York, New Jersey, Toronto, and Atlanta. We couldn't do it without each and everyone of our team members. The truck is run by four partners and supported by twenty additional team members ranging from social media to customer service to retouching to sales - oh yeah, not to mention our world class photographers and make-up artists. You can read more about the team members in the coming weeks.




Have you followed us on Facebook, Instagram, Yelp, Pinterest, LinkedIn and all the other accounts the cool kids are using these days? If  you haven't, click above to follow us. You'll be glad you did.


HURRY, WE'VE ONLY GOT ONE MONTH LEFT!

It’s been proven that you don’t need headshots that cost an arm and a leg. You need headshots that are high-quality, look like you and are compelling. We can deliver that at a fraction of the cost.  Plus, we can come to you! I mean, seriously that is huge! Whether you are an actor or business professional we can make your photos represent your type or brand. 







What to Expect
You will simply climb aboard the truck, we will choose a colored backdrop, adjust lighting, and we will take amazing headshots for you. You can see their photos in real time on our monitor that way you leave the truck knowing we got a shot you'll love, and we will email access to the photos to you in a few days! 




Every photo we take is color corrected PLUS we give you every image we take, which no other photographer does. This sets us apart from other photographers who only give you one image of your choice. With us you can download or print your images as you wish. We provide the images in multiple sizes that way you can select which size you need for what platform. You will have hi-resolution (print) and low resolution (web) formats included for each image. 




Actor-Tested, Agent-Approved
•Team of Experts. We've assembled a stellar team of experts to take care of you while you're on board the truck. Every session offers an experienced headshot photographer, makeup artist and wardrobe consultant to guide you through the process. No newbies. No experimenting. No guess work. 
•Fully equipped studio. We've packed a small space with all the amenities a full-sized studio has: a makeup station, wardrobe station, music, lights, cameras, and computer equipment.
•Wireless Review System. With our cutting edge wireless system, you can see your images on a large monitor in real time, as they are being taken! Make whatever adjustments you want, and know exactly what you're getting during your session. Instant gratification! 
•Mobile. We bring our expert team and tricked out studio to you! We will be able to operate and deliver what you need, anytime, anywhere. Rain or shine, any time of the year - you can be sure you're getting the photos you need, every time. 
•Fun. You're on a truck. With kindred spirits. Just hanging out. 
•Free and easy image delivery. You get a shareable online gallery that is easy to navigate. You get a free download of all of your high resolution, color corrected images without watermarks. No hidden fees. No waiting for a disc in the mail. 
•Affordable. Get a high quality process and product, with some fun and convenience, all at a fraction of the cost.


To help us reach our goal, simply:
1. Click on the "Back This Project" button at the top of the page. Enter your pledge amount and select your perk. (NYC Actors- The perks are your pre-sale packages- chose how many looks you want!)
2. Create your account and enter your credit card information.
3. Spread the word! This step is key. Share our campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, email or carrier pigeon. Even if you don’t pledge, shares are so important!
And you're done! Thank you so much for your support! 








So who are the people behind this awesome new project? Well, they say it takes a village and The Headshot Truck is more like a small metropolis. We've got team members based in Southern California, Northern California, Connecticut, New York, New Jersey, Toronto, and Atlanta. We couldn't do it without each and everyone of our team members. The truck is run by four partners and supported by twenty additional team members ranging from social media to customer service to retouching to sales - oh yeah, not to mention our world class photographers and make-up artists. You can read more about the team members in the coming weeks.







Have you followed us on Facebook, Instagram, Yelp, Pinterest, LinkedIn and all the other accounts the cool kids are using these days? If  you haven't, click above to follow us. You'll be glad you did.









HURRY, WE'VE ONLY GOT ONE MONTH LEFT!

story:
Hey there! My name is Tanya, I'm a photographer who moved to Berlin a year and a half ago. For the second lockdown in Berlin I have started to photograph one stranger in a day to escape the loneliness and to fight the fear to speak with the people on Berlin’s streets. Lockdown was supposed to last only month of November 2020, but it prolonged till the end of January and most probably would be prolonged till the end of the winter.

I’m running out of the money and can’t afford to buy the medium format Kodak film any more. The Personal project turned out to be the documentary  project which captures quite important experience in our lives. If my project "Strangers" speaks to you - please support it financially or by sharing the information about it. 

 

When the second lockdown started in Berlin I decided to create a photography project called “Strangers”.  

The project started as a way to escape two things: my loneliness as a single person who recently moved to a new city and the fear of speaking with people on the streets of Berlin.

 

 

Since the 2nd of November, when the second lockdown was announced, every day I have been making one photo-portrait of a complete stranger. 

 

 

I walk the streets of Berlin and find fascinating characters that intrigue me and whose image I would like to keep as a memory of our shared Covid times. 

 

 

I use an electronic construction meter to measure out exactly one and a half meter between the person and my camera. 

 

 

While I photograph someone, I talk to them and use one of their quotes under their photo to give you a glimpse of who they are. You can find all pictures with quotes on my Instagram page - @tanyapomnish.

 

 

The second lockdown was supposed to last in Berlin only till the end of November. One month-long photo-project seemed realistic money- and time-wise. 

 

 

Now when the end of the lockdown is uncertain, and it has already lasted over 2 months, I am running out of money.

 

 

I make these portraits with a medium format analog camera, so every photo requires expensive film and development.

 

 

I would love to continue working on this project and finish it on the last day of the lockdown. Without you, I won't be able to do that. 

If my project "Strangers" speaks to you - please support it!

story:
Short Summary

For those of you who don't know me, I am Juliet Piper. I am a portrait photographer with a penchant for landscape photography in fine art. I live in Somerset, UK with my partner and our two kids. We moved here when I was pregnant with our second daughter three years ago. 

As a photographer I usually secure all my exhibition costs through my personal work and the funds I set aside for them specifically. However my photography took a step back to look after the girls and currently the funding pot is empty, transformed into nappies or some other child necessity. This campaign / exhibition, is me relaunching myself into the world of art after three years of zero time for myself and a new born strapped to my hip. She's still here, in case you were wondering... she's called Iris and she's wonderful! She can also walk and go to playgroups and I can actually get things done!

So here it is, the same old adage artists face around the world, and in all mediums, the same, just placed at different times in the production line: material costs... and boy do they cost!

I have signed up for a new exhibition in London to showcase my new body of work called "Remember, Last Summer". The other artists in this group exhibition are really talented, it was a must for me to pick this particular opportunity. However, I need to print and frame a few pieces and also have presentation cards printed along with a small catalogue of my work, possible even with some Hydros (previous series) in it.

The funds raised here would mean I can produce the frames and prints I need. It also means I would have professional promotional materials on display for potential clients, future clients, to take home with them.

It would, on a more intangible level,  give me that huge space in my mind currently filled with worry and endless plan B possibilities. I cannot tell you how much this would mean to me.

I don't expect something for nothing, I never have, and therefore you will find a list of perks and discounts on regular print prices and other pieces.

If you wish to take part and don't want anything in return, well yes, of course! please do! it all adds up in the end, there's no amount too small! 

If the funding exceeds my goal I will secure the funds in a new funding pot for future exhibitions. And the ball will roll again.

What We Need & What You Get

I am looking to raise £3000 to cover printing costs, framing and the promotional materials. This will also cover the costs of going to London to deliver the work (van rental and fuel), going to the opening a few days later and returning to pick up the work at the end of the show (van rental and fuel). Three trips in total.

If the total amount is not reached I will give priority to the printing and framing and will have to rethink the promotional materials.

See the perks for details of what I am offering in return of specific amounts of funding. When choosing a print perk, framed or unframed and for all sizes, please note I will be in touch to know which print you want. Unless stated,  all prints are available in all formats.

Same applies for the collector's box. I will be contacting  you to find out which four prints you want. The top lid is determined by the perk itself.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to help me with my funding at this time, please, it's fine! I've been there myself! not always being able to fund all the people I would have liked to. 

If you could make some noise about my campaign, pass it on to others.

As I mentioned above, no amount is too small and all shares are very much useful!

Thank you!

story:
. who am i and what am i doing .


|| My name is Alli and I'm a 25 year-old aspiring photographer and model. I also work with special needs as my day job. ||


|| I'm starting this campaign because my boyfriend and I have fallen on some hard times, financially. I was saving up to buy a new DSLR and lens, but I had to use that money to ensure I have rent, food, and gas in my car. ||


|| What you will be helping me achieve would be my dreams and ambitions. I have been trying to expand my own portfolio and require a DSLR to start heavily working towards my goals. ||


. this is what i'm aiming for .


|| All I require is $1000 for both the DSLR (Canon T5i) and a 50mm lens. 


|| My personal style and what I want to achieve is an intimate and artistic look for portraits and other projects. Some including special events, boudoir, and pin-up.  


|| If I do not reach my goal in the time span, I will put that money into a savings account I have set aside and save up my own money to purchase what I need. 


. what you would be doing for me .


|| As I continue to build experience in my photography skills, I would like to branch out and work towards pursuing a career. I want to show the world how I see things in my own unique way. ||


|| I've done personal shoots for other people already and continually look for more people to work with and scouting locations wherever I can. I've even been offered a few paid gigs already, but I don't feel comfortable taking them, currently. ||


|| I want to deliver my perception of the world through a lens. I see beauty in so many things and I feel I can't capture what I see with my point-and-shoot camera. I want to bring quality work to the table with the resolutions I need that I can feel confident and proud of. I love what I do. Even for fun and skewing the perspective of even the more mundane and mediocre things. I want to express the beauty in the people I work with and the places I see. ||


. what's stopping me .


|| The challenge I have is I'm trying to build a life with my boyfriend. I don't want to sacrifice necessities for desires. I try to be responsible and realistic in how I approach everything. Consequently, I'm required to throw most of what I want to do and what makes me happy on the back-burner. ||


|| However, my plan to overcome the challenges presented to me is to acquire help from you to get to where I need to be. Something as small as helping me in buying the proper camera and lens will help extraordinarily and I'd be forever grateful. ||


. anything will help .


|| I'm not insisting on help in the form of JUST donations. I know everyone is going through tough times and even just sharing this page would mean the world to me. Just the gesture and support would help. Anything would help. You just reading this helps me. ||

story:
What happens when no more Jewish survivors of World War II remain alive? Will they be remembered? Who will tell their testimony?

If the world doesn´t remember, if the world has no memory, will be at risk that it could happen again.

Support this project so a photojournalist can travel around North America and Europe to interview more survivors to ensure the continuity and their remembrance.

Time flies.

Will movies and books be enough? Would that be enough to encourage new generations to read and learn more about what happened?

Six million Jews were killed.

For your children, grandchildren, friends & family. This work will endure in what today seems to be the future of information with all the needs that this goal requires. It will be specifically prepared to be suited for all audiences.

When it is ready I´ll sleep a little easier because I have interesting and productive material in my power to show my children and grandchildren. And so will the whole world. As for you... Can you sleep easily?

(Español abajo)                                                                                                                   

The project

Abrigar Esperanzas (Embracing hopes) consists of a web site that shows the portrait of 10 survivors. From each of these 10 survivors you can enter to their different portfolios. Story of the survivor, their book, a quote, a message, more pictures, a small memory and an educational and didactic activity to do. 

The web is already on internet with 10 survivors that arrived to Argentina and is in Spanish. Now the challenge, and in this sense I will use the collection, is to continue with survivor around the world. Because the story of this people is different depending the country that they arrived. And if I have more survivors I can have more languages, more information and documentation to spread this work around the world.

Web Site  http://abrigaresperanzas.wix.com/sobrevivientes

Story and focus

 “What does it mean to be a jew? To be a jew in the first place means accepting your destiny, and then, choosing it. Anyone who passes through a challenge, anyone who witnesses a disaster or a miracle, it’s their responsibility to pass it on. Then, to be a Jew today is to be a witness. The idea that any of us are able to talk in the name of all of us has never been more real than now. However, today, any Jew talks also in the name of those who are no longer here. Is it hard? Being a Jew is chasing the difficult and overcome it. In relation to this, unless the witness feels identify with it, I don’t feel any testimony is valid.”

                                                           Eli Wiesel, article, “What does it mean to be a jew?


30 cups of coffee and tea, 20 pieces of cake, 60 buses, more than 600 photos, 8 books, 10 movies, 17 phone calls, 25 audios, to tell 10 stories. The words of Eli Wisel sum up the central argument of this project. Talk in the name of those who are not here, identifying, give testimonies.

This project was born after the very deep and known concern of what is it going to happen once no more WWII witnesses are alive. How are we telling the story? Would the message be the same?  It’s forgetting an option? Would it happen again?

I discovered a few years ago Eli Wisel’s words in my grandparents library. It was then when i realized the responsibility that I have as a Jewish human being and the power of Wisel’s theory if we get to understand it. I discovered in his words a high level of worry. He does not only defines what is it to be a jew, but also a willing to listen and to talk, to give testimony.

Taking that in consideration I began my task based upon his request. Make something that its now between us seen, that because of the human cycle its going to be gone soon. I listened, felt, and looked into their eyes, their glance. Happy, sad. They passed through war, they suffered because of being jews, and very kindly they opened me the door to their houses. “I can tell you my story, what happened. But I will never be able to transmit you what I felt”, this were the first words Francisco Wichter told me, the only Argentinean survivor from the schidlers list, the first day I met him, May 2012. That moved me even more to do this project. We will never be able to feel his suffering, to be in his skin. We can drink lots of coffees, read lots of books and watch lots of movies with them. But no matter how much we insist as jewish we would never be able to be their true reflect.

However, I didn’t stay with my arms crossed. I decided to cherish hopes with them. That’s why I did their portraits and built the diptych. On one hand the past, the vague identity, the scars, the memories, the lost. And on the other hand, the eyes that tell, the scars in their faces, signs that they lived, their lost looks, sad and happy smiles for what they were able to built. Their cold hands that hug.

I was blessed with the opportunity to listen to these 10 stories (more than 10 in reality). These are the ones that are uploaded in the web today; there are more to come soon. Not only reflects their experiences in the war but also this web is a bet to life. The messages for the next generations it’s a bet, their sayings are lessons for all ages. The educative proposals thought for each of these stories, related to the different themes from the war teaches us that there’s a lot to learn and think, but mostly it teaches us about love. The same happened with the 10 survivors. When their today was revealed, when they got merreid, their children and their grandchildren, their eyes shine, their mouths smile, and their souls reclaim. The portraits also show this part: the value of life. In this case Aron confessed: “us, the survivors, gave our people what they took from us; one generation, two, or even three in some cases”.

The 10 survivors have different survival stories. Hidden, fake identities, as Catholics, in concentration camps, escaping from countries where the Nazis were. From the different ways they survived, each of them had their own hope. They took care of those hopes, they nurtured and cherished those hopes.

Nusia survived as a Catholic and her hope was revealing one day her real identity. Motek passed the entire war in the concentration camps, his hope was to be free. Francisco cherished the little bit that he had left, he was the only one alive in his family, him and his future. Aron hanged only to the hope of surviving. The support of Moises Borowicz was his Jewish identity, if everything happened because of being Jewish that kept him alive. Gina prized the hope of love. Salomon however went for his dreams and left all the conflicts to the side. Moises Helman stood on his feet because of his parents. Catalina and Tomas Kerteszs’ hope was the deep strength that comes from the inside of your body and soul, that one that appears only when you think there is nothing left to do. 




About me

Photography is my passion. It keeps me grounded to believe i can change the world. I just finished my bachelors in Social Communication at the University of Buenos Aires (UBA) and I’ve been a photojournalist for three years.

I have lots of experience in the Second World Warsubject by researching and doing studies. I did different courses at the most recognized institution in the world regarding the holocaust: Yad Vashem. This place supports this work and is already posted on page of them.

I'm 23 years old and live in Buenos Aires, Argentina. I have many projects in mind. Today, the survivors are waiting for me and my camera is ready to go.

My website available for more photos

http://druscovichmagali.wix.com/fotografia

My feet in Auschwitz. I promised to do something on my visit there


How I'll use your donations:

I did this job with survivors of my country and Israel. After a long research I contacted survivors around the world, they hope my visit to be part of this project. Now is the time to fly.

Specifications

The funds are only for this project, to travel to different country and to live for 44 days. Now is the time to United State, Europe and Israel.

If that fails to raise the total of the money, I´ll be used for travel to less countries.

Flights  US$ 4600

Overland  US$ 600

Lodging  US$ 2100

Food  US$ 1700

Technical material   US$ 1500

Collaborations for materials in different languages  US$ 970

Domain web page  US$ 30

Total US$ 11.500




Español

Qué pasará cuando no haya más sobrevivientes judíos de la Segunda Guerra Mundial con vida? Se recordará igual? Quien contará su testimonio?

Si el mundo no recuerda, si el mundo no tiene memoria, estamos en el límite que vuelva a ocurrir otra vez.

Colabore con este proyecto para que una fotoperiodista viaje a Estados Unidos y Europa para entrevistar a más sobrevivientes.

El tiempo vuela

Alcanzaran los libros y las películas? Serán suficientes para estar al alcance de las nuevas generaciones y alentarlas a conocer lo que sucedió?

Seis millones de judíos fueron asesinados

Para tus hijos, nietos, amigos y familias. La interfaz de este trabajo es el soporte que será el día de mañana el medio de comunicación e información con mayor alcance. Preparado específicamente para contar con todas las herramientas acordes para su público.

Cuando esté listo, voy a dormir tranquila. Tendré materiales productivos e interesantes para mostrarles a mis hijos y nietos. E incluso el mundo los tendrá. Y ustedes, se iran a dormir bien?


El  proyecto

Abrigar esperanzas consiste en la exposición en una página web de los retratos de 10 sobrevivientes.   A partir de cada uno de estos se accede a diferentes portfolios. Historia del sobreviviente, su libro, una frase, un mensaje, más fotos, pequeño recuerdo y una propuesta educativa y didáctica para realizar.

El sitio web se encuentra en internet con testimonios de 10 sobrevivientes que arribaron a la Argentina. Ahora, el desafío y en este sentido se usaran las donaciones, es continuar con este trabajo con sobrevivientes de todo el mundo. La historia de cada sobreviviente esta involucrada con el país al que llegaron luego de la guerra. Si hay más sobrevivientes entrevistados habrá más lenguajes, además del español y más información y documentación para distribuir y dar a conocer al mundo.

Página web http://abrigaresperanzas.wix.com/sobrevivientes


Historia y fundamentos

“¿Qué es ser judío? El ser judío significa, en primer lugar, asumir su destino, y en segundo lugar, elegirlo. Cualquiera que atraviese una prueba, cualquiera que asista a un desastre o a un milagro, es su deber transmitirlo. Hoy, entonces, ser judío es testimoniar. La idea de que cada uno de nosotros está habilitado para hablar en nombre de todos nunca ha sido más verdadera ahora. Salvo que ahora cada judío habla también en nombre de los judíos que ya no existen. ¿e difícil? Ser judío es buscar lo difícil y enseguida sobrepasarlo. En relación a esto debo decir que ningún testimonio me parece válido, a menos que el testigo se identifique con él.”  

                                                                        Eli Wiesel, artículo ¿Qué es ser judío?


30 tazas de café y té, 20 porciones de torta, 60 colectivos, más de 600 fotos, 8 libros, 10 películas, 17 llamados, 25 audios, para contar 10 historias. Las palabras de Eli Wisel forman el argumento central de este trabajo. Hablar por los que no están, identificarse, dar testimonio.

Él trabajo se crea a partir de la premisa fundamental sobre qué pasará cuando ya no haya testigos de lo ocurrido en la Segunda Guerra Mundial. ¿Cómo se contará?, ¿El mensaje llegará igual?, ¿Existe el olvido?, ¿Volverá a pasar? 

Las palabras de Eli Wisel las descubrí hace algunos años en la biblioteca de mis abuelos. Allí comprendí la gran responsabilidad que tengo como judía y sobre todas las cosas el poder que podemos llegar a confiscar si entendemos a que se refería Wisel. Descubrí en sus palabras un cierto grado de preocupación. No solo define lo que es ser judío, sino que también es un pedido. Un pedido de escuchar y dar testimonio.

Tomando literalmente su discurso me aboque a esa tarea. Hacer ver algo que ahora está, pero que por el ciclo humano ya no va a estar más. Escuche, sentí, indague en sus ojos, en sus miradas. Alegres, tristes. Vivieron la guerra, sufrieron por su condición de ser judíos y muy amablemente todos, me recibieron en sus hogares. “Puedo contarte mi historia, como se sucedieron los hechos. Pero nunca voy a lograr transmitirte lo que sentí”, estas fueron las primeras palabras que me dijo Francisco Wichter, único sobreviviente en Argentina de la Lista de Schindler, el primer día que lo conocí en Mayo del 2012. Eso me movió aún más a hacer este trabajo. Nunca podremos sentir su sufrimiento, estar en su piel. Se pueden tomar muchas tazas de café, leer muchos libros y ver muchas películas junto a ellos. Pero pese a nuestra insistencia como judíos ser su fiel reflejo no podremos.

Sin embargo no por eso me quedé de brazos cruzados. Decidí abrigar esperanzas junto a ellos. Por eso la decisión de los retratos y la construcción de los dípticos. Por un lado el pasado, la identidad difusa, las marcas, los recuerdos, las pérdidas. Y por otro lado los ojos que transmiten, las marcas en sus caras, señales de que vivieron, sus miradas perdidas, sonrisas tristes y alegres por lo que supieron construir. Sus manos frías pero que abrazan.

Si tendría la posibilidad de hablar con Wisel debería agradecerle. Sus palabras inspiraron este trabajo. Ese deseo interno de dejar algo, de cumplir con la religión que me fue dada al nacer, pero sobre todo la que elegí tener.

Tuve la magnífica y dichosa oportunidad, de escuchar estas 10 historias. En verdad más de 10. Estas son las que están por el momento expuestas en la página web, en un futuro vendrán más. No solo se transmite sus vivencias en la guerra y en la Shoá, sino que también esta página web es una apuesta a la vida. El mensaje para las generaciones venideras es una apuesta, sus frases son enseñanzas para todas las edades. Las propuestas educativas pensadas para cada historia, relacionadas con diferentes temas de la guerra nos enseñan que hay mucho por aprender y reflexionar. Y por sobre todas las cosas, el amor. Con los 10 sobrevivientes se repitió la misma situación. Al relatar su actualidad, cuando se casaron, los hijos y los nietos sus ojos brillan, se iluminan, sus bocas sonríen y su alma se reivindica. Los retratos también muestran esta parte: el valor de la vida. En este sentido Aron me confesó: “Los que hemos sobrevivido, dimos a nuestro pueblo lo que nos robaron. Una generación, dos y hasta tres generaciones.”

Los 10 tienen historias diferentes de supervivencia. Escondidos, identidades falsas, como católicos, en campos de concentración, huyendo a países donde no estaban los Nazis.

De las distintas formas que sobrevivieron, a su modo, cada uno tuvo sus esperanzas. Las cuidaron, las abrigaron y las alimentaron.

Nusia sobrevivió como católica y abrigaba la esperanza de algún día revelar su verdadera identidad. Motek pasó la guerra desde que empezó hasta que terminó en los campos, su esperanza era salir y vivir libremente. Francisco abrigaba lo poco que tenía, nadie de su familia estaba con vida, solo él y su futuro. Aron se aferró únicamente a la esperanza de sobrevivir. El gran sostén de Moisés Borowicz fue la identidad judía, si pasó lo que pasó por ser judío él supo mantener eso para sobrevivir. Gina abrigo la esperanza del amor. Salomón se sujetó a distanciarse de los conflictos y apostar por sus sueños. Moisés Helman se mantuvo en pie por las esperanzas de sus padres. Catalina y Tomas Kertesz abrigaron la esperanza de la fuerza que viene desde adentro del cuerpo, esa que se saca cuando se cree que ya no hay nada por hacer.


Más sobre mi

La fotografía es mi pasión. Es lo que me mantiene a tierra para tener la posibilidad de cambiar el mundo. Soy fotoperiodista hace tres años y a poco de finalizar mis estudios en Ciencias de la Comunicación Social en la UBA.

Tengo una larga experiencia sobre la materia de lo sucedido en la Segunda Guerra Mundial. Investigaciones y estudios. Cursos realizados en la institución más reconocida en el mundo sobre materia de holocausto: Yad Vashem. Lugar que apoya este trabajo y ya está publicado en su página.

Tengo 23 años, vivo en Buenos Aires, Argentina. Tengo muchos proyectos por delante. Hoy en día, los sobrevivientes me están esperando y mi cámara ya está lista para ir en su búsqueda.

Mi página web disponible con más fotos de mi autoría

http://druscovichmagali.wix.com/fotografia


Como utilizare las donaciones

Hice lo que estaba a mi alcance con sobrevivientes de mi país y de Israel. Después de un largo trabajo de investigación me he contactado con sobrevivientes de todo el mundo que esperan mi visita para ser parte de este proyecto. Ahora es el tiempo de volar.

Especificaciones

Los recursos están destinados únicamente a este proyecto, viajar durante 44 días a Estados Unidos y Europa. 

De no ser posible recaudar el total del dinero, sera utilizado de todos modos para viajar a menos países. 

Vuelos  US$ 4600

Terreste US$ 600

Hospedaje  US$ 2100

Comida  US$ 1700

Material técnico  US$ 1500 

Colaboraciones con materiales en distintos idiomas US$ 970

Dominio de la página web  US$ 30

Total US$ 11.500
story_txt:
What happens when no more Jewish survivors of World War II remain alive? Will they be remembered? Who
will tell their testimony?
If the world doesn´t remember, if the world has no memory, will be at risk that it could happen again.
Support this project so a photojournalist can travel around North America
and Europe to interview more survivors to ensure the continuity and their remembrance.Time
flies.
Will movies
and books be enough? Would that be enough to encourage new generations to read and learn more about
what happened?
Six million Jews
were killed.
For your
children, grandchildren, friends & family. This work will endure in what
today seems to be the future of information with all the needs that this goal
requires. It will be specifically prepared to be suited for all audiences.
When it is ready I´ll sleep a little easier because I have interesting and productive material in my
power to show my children and grandchildren. And so will the whole world. As for you... Can you sleep easily?(Español abajo)                                                                                                                   The project
Abrigar
Esperanzas (Embracing hopes) consists
of a web site that shows the portrait of 10 survivors. From each of these 10
survivors you can enter to their different portfolios. Story of the survivor,
their book, a quote, a message, more pictures, a small memory and an educational
and didactic activity to do.  
The
web is already on internet with 10 survivors that arrived to Argentina and is
in Spanish. Now the challenge, and in this sense I will use the collection, is
to continue with survivor around the world. Because the story of this people is
different depending the country that they arrived. And if I have more survivors
I can have more languages, more information and documentation to spread this
work around the world.Web Site  http://abrigaresperanzas.wix.com/sobrevivientesStory and focus
 “What does it mean to be a jew? To be a jew in
the first place means accepting your destiny, and then, choosing it. Anyone who
passes through a challenge, anyone who witnesses a disaster or a miracle, it’s
their responsibility to pass it on. Then, to be a Jew today is to be a witness.
The idea that any of us are able to talk in the name of all of us has never
been more real than now. However, today, any Jew talks also in the name of
those who are no longer here. Is it hard? Being a Jew is chasing the difficult
and overcome it. In relation to this, unless the witness feels identify with
it, I don’t feel any testimony is valid.”
                                                           Eli Wiesel, article, “What does it mean to be a jew?
30 cups of coffee and tea, 20 pieces
of cake, 60 buses, more than 600 photos, 8 books, 10 movies, 17 phone calls, 25
audios, to tell 10 stories. The words of Eli Wisel sum up the central argument
of this project. Talk in the name of
those who are not here, identifying, give testimonies.
This project was born after the very
deep and known concern of what is it going to happen once no more WWII
witnesses are alive. How are we telling the story? Would the message be the
same?  It’s forgetting an option?
Would it happen again?
I discovered a few years ago Eli
Wisel’s words in my grandparents library. It was then when i realized the
responsibility that I have as a Jewish human being and the power of Wisel’s
theory if we get to understand it. I discovered in his words a high level of
worry. He does not only defines what is it to be a jew, but also a willing to
listen and to talk, to give testimony. 
Taking that in consideration I began
my task based upon his request. Make something that its now between us seen,
that because of the human cycle its going to be gone soon. I listened, felt,
and looked into their eyes, their glance. Happy, sad. They passed through war,
they suffered because of being jews, and very kindly they opened me the door to
their houses. “I can tell you my story, what happened. But I will never be able
to transmit you what I felt”, this were the first words Francisco Wichter told
me, the only Argentinean survivor from the schidlers list, the first day I met
him, May 2012. That moved me even more to do this project. We will never be
able to feel his suffering, to be in his skin. We can drink lots of coffees,
read lots of books and watch lots of movies with them. But no matter how much
we insist as jewish we would never be able to be their true reflect. 
However, I didn’t stay with my arms
crossed. I decided to cherish hopes with them. That’s why I did their portraits
and built the diptych. On one hand the past, the vague identity, the scars, the
memories, the lost. And on the other hand, the eyes that tell, the scars in
their faces, signs that they lived, their lost looks, sad and happy smiles for
what they were able to built. Their cold hands that hug. 
I was blessed with the opportunity
to listen to these 10 stories (more than 10 in reality). These are the ones
that are uploaded in the web today; there are more to come soon. Not only
reflects their experiences in the war but also this web is a bet to life. The
messages for the next generations it’s a bet, their sayings are lessons for all
ages. The educative proposals thought for each of these stories, related to the
different themes from the war teaches us that there’s a lot to learn and think,
but mostly it teaches us about love. The same happened with the 10 survivors.
When their today was revealed, when they got merreid, their children and their
grandchildren, their eyes shine, their mouths smile, and their souls reclaim.
The portraits also show this part: the value of life. In this case Aron
confessed: “us, the survivors, gave our people what they took from us; one
generation, two, or even three in some cases”.
The 10 survivors have different
survival stories. Hidden, fake identities, as Catholics, in concentration
camps, escaping from countries where the Nazis were. From the different ways
they survived, each of them had their own hope. They took care of those hopes,
they nurtured and cherished those hopes. Nusia survived as a Catholic and her hope
was revealing one day her real identity. Motek passed the entire war in the
concentration camps, his hope was to be free. Francisco cherished the little
bit that he had left, he was the only one alive in his family, him and his
future. Aron hanged only to the hope of surviving. The support of Moises
Borowicz was his Jewish identity, if everything happened because of
being Jewish that kept him alive. Gina prized the hope of love. Salomon
however went for his dreams and left all the conflicts to the side. Moises
Helman stood on his feet because of his parents. Catalina and Tomas Kerteszs’
hope was the deep strength that comes from the inside of your body and soul,
that one that appears only when you think there is nothing left to do. About me
Photography is my passion. It
keeps me grounded to believe i can change the world. I just finished my
bachelors in Social Communication at the University of Buenos Aires (UBA)
and I’ve been a photojournalist for three years.
I have lots of experience in the Second
World Warsubject by researching and
doing studies. I did different courses at the most recognized institution in
the world regarding the holocaust: Yad Vashem. This place supports this work and is already posted on page of them.
I'm 23 years old and live in Buenos Aires,
Argentina. I have many projects in mind. Today, the survivors are waiting for
me and my camera is ready to go.
My website available for more photos
http://druscovichmagali.wix.com/fotografiaMy feet in Auschwitz. I promised to do
something on my visit thereHow I'll use your donations:
I did this job
with survivors of my country and Israel. After a long research I contacted
survivors around the world, they hope my visit to be part of this project. Now
is the time to fly.

Specifications
The funds are only for
this project, to travel to different country and to live for 44 days. Now is the
time to United State, Europe and Israel.
If that fails to raise the total of the money, I´ll be used for travel
to less countries.

Flights  US$ 4600
Overland  US$ 600
Lodging  US$ 2100
Food  US$ 1700
Technical material   US$ 1500
Collaborations for materials in different
languages  US$ 970
Domain web page  US$ 30
Total
US$ 11.500Español
Qué pasará cuando no haya más
sobrevivientes judíos de la Segunda Guerra Mundial con vida? Se recordará
igual? Quien contará su testimonio? 
Si el mundo
no recuerda, si el mundo no tiene memoria, estamos en el límite que vuelva a
ocurrir otra vez.
Colabore con
este proyecto para que una fotoperiodista viaje a Estados Unidos y Europa para entrevistar
a más sobrevivientes.
El tiempo vuela
Alcanzaran los libros y las películas?
Serán suficientes para estar al alcance de las nuevas generaciones y alentarlas a conocer lo que sucedió?
Seis millones de judíos fueron
asesinados
Para tus hijos, nietos, amigos y
familias. La interfaz de este trabajo es el soporte que será el día de mañana
el medio de comunicación e información con mayor alcance. Preparado
específicamente para contar con todas las herramientas acordes para su público.
Cuando esté listo, voy a dormir
tranquila. Tendré materiales productivos e interesantes para mostrarles a mis
hijos y nietos. E incluso el mundo los tendrá. Y ustedes, se iran a dormir
bien?

El  proyecto
Abrigar esperanzas consiste en la
exposición en una página web de los retratos de 10 sobrevivientes.   A partir de cada uno de estos se
accede a diferentes portfolios. Historia del sobreviviente, su libro, una
frase, un mensaje, más fotos, pequeño recuerdo y una propuesta educativa y
didáctica para realizar.
El sitio web se encuentra en internet con testimonios de 10 sobrevivientes
que arribaron a la Argentina. Ahora, el desafío y en este sentido se
usaran las donaciones, es continuar con este trabajo con sobrevivientes de todo
el mundo. La historia de cada sobreviviente esta involucrada con el país al que
llegaron luego de la guerra. Si hay más sobrevivientes entrevistados habrá más
lenguajes, además del español y más información y documentación para distribuir
y dar a conocer al mundo.
Página web http://abrigaresperanzas.wix.com/sobrevivientes

Historia y fundamentos

“¿Qué es ser judío? El ser judío
significa, en primer lugar, asumir su destino, y en segundo lugar, elegirlo.
Cualquiera que atraviese una prueba, cualquiera que asista a un desastre o a un
milagro, es su deber transmitirlo. Hoy, entonces, ser judío es testimoniar. La
idea de que cada uno de nosotros está habilitado para hablar en nombre de todos
nunca ha sido más verdadera ahora. Salvo que ahora cada judío habla también en
nombre de los judíos que ya no existen. ¿e difícil? Ser judío es buscar lo
difícil y enseguida sobrepasarlo. En relación a esto debo decir que ningún
testimonio me parece válido, a menos que el testigo se identifique con él.”   
                                                                        Eli

story:
Short Summary

Hello,

I am Prashant Rana, A photojournalist living in Sweden. I like to make photo projects which I think are reflection of our society, but in a manner of discussion and not a statement. I like to talk about things through my photos, and would love to listen to your views through our discussions. My work has been exhibited in India, Bhutan, Sweden and Lithuania. Now through this campaign, I intend to bring forward a project that I did in Lithuania during the years of 2016-2017.

Kirtimai is a Roma tabor/village in the outskirt of Vilnius, the capital of Republic of Lithuania. What is Roma? You must be wondering. Roma are the nomads that came to Europe around 500 years ago from Indian subcontinent. The reason of their long travel which took hundreds of years and many generations was to reject the social segregation they faced. Roma are widely known by the terms Gypsies, Cigonu or Gitano etc. in various languages, but these terms are now rightly prohibited to be used, as they express racism.

Somehow it is unfortunate that although such terms are banned from use, the Roma community is yet to be accepted as a part of European society. So, I decided to do a photo project about it. Soon I realized that children are the victims of this prejudice. The widespread social division affects Roma kids adversely, and hinders them from attaining proper education and a healthy social environment. And, it ultimately poses obstacles for their positive contribute to the global society.

Through the book that I intend to publish with the help your generous contribution, I aspire to give voice to the dreams of these children. All the children and their parents who participated in the project by allowing me to take photos, expressed desires and hopes for a bright and prosperous future, like any of us would want. And, it is this expression that I tried to capture in all the photos that are to be published in the book.

Even though, the book could be taken as a piece of art for photography admirers, or a piece of history by lovers of photo documentary genre, I would say that your contribution will bring dreams of our future generations’ one step closer to realization.  

What We Need & What You Get

With your contributions, a book will be published. It will comprise of a brief text about history of Roma nomads, 40 photographs from Kirtimai tabor where approximately 400 Romani people live in wooden shackles without proper heating and water (Approximately half of these 400 people are children below 18 years of age.) And, statements of children and their parents, who opened their hearts and lives for you and me.

To accomplish this, 6000 euro is pledged. Your contributions to this will be used for the following.

  • Printing of the book
  • Publishing of the book (Registering of ISBN and other formalities)
  • Distribution of the book (To various Museums, Galleries and Libraries)
  • And, funding educational activities in Kirtimai tabor.

 Your contribution in any form is appreciated, and we will always be grateful for it. And, if you want, you can get various perks in return. Such as:-

  • Signed and numbered prints (customized sizes), of one of the most appreciated photograph from the project, when it was exhibited at Vilnius town hall with the support of ministry of culture and department of minorities of the Republic of Lithuania.
  • And, the book Nomads of the Future is also available for you at a discount price in return of your contribution. The copy will be signed for you before dispatch.

The gathered funds will still be used for publication of the book, even if the goal is not met here. And, contributors who opt for perks will eventually get it. Although, if the funds are not generated as aimed, there might be a slight delay in delivery depending up on the circumstances but, as a valued contributor we will try to deliver as promised.

The Impact

Apart from the perks that you can avail, your contribution will also add value to art, photography and society on a larger scale. So don’t hesitate to contribute whatever amount you can, because it will bring all of us, one step closer to our efforts of building a prosperous global society for generations to come.

The photos from the book were exhibited in Lithuania and Sweden. During those exhibitions, I had a great opportunity to discuss the work with numerous visitors. All those discussions motivated me to bring this discussion one step ahead with the book, because the book reaches more people than an exhibition.

And, with this ambition I am reaching to you, so that we all can collaborate in whichever way we can to take this discussion further.

Risks & Challenges

There are two challenges that I think should be dealt with through the campaign.

  • Gathering enough funds to publish the book
  • Making the book interesting for a global audience

To meet first challenge I have come to this platform to seek your support and contribution. And for the second one, I decided to translate the interviews of children and their parents from Lithuanian to English. And, in the final book, both versions will be published.

Other Ways You Can Help

Remember, you can contribute in many ways, and one of those is to spread the word. Use the link to share with your friends and their friends. And, please do share on your social media platform and discuss with your connections. We will love to have a shout out from you. Use the sharing tools on this page as many times as you want. We will appreciate your gesture of giving us space on your Facebook, Twitter and other social media platforms.

 

Thank you, with a warm hug.

Prashant Rana
story_txt:
Short SummaryHello,I am Prashant Rana, A photojournalist living in Sweden. I like to make photo projects which I think are reflection of our society, but in a manner of discussion and not a statement. I like to talk about things through my photos, and would love to listen to your views through our discussions. My work has been exhibited in India, Bhutan, Sweden and Lithuania. Now through this campaign, I intend to bring forward a project that I did in Lithuania during the years of 2016-2017.Kirtimai is a Roma tabor/village in the outskirt of Vilnius, the capital of Republic of Lithuania. What is Roma? You must be wondering. Roma are the nomads that came to Europe around 500 years ago from Indian subcontinent. The reason of their long travel which took hundreds of years and many generations was to reject the social segregation they faced. Roma are widely known by the terms Gypsies, Cigonu or Gitano etc. in various languages, but these terms are now rightly prohibited to be used, as they express racism.Somehow it is unfortunate that although such terms are banned from use, the Roma community is yet to be accepted as a part of European society. So, I decided to do a photo project about it. Soon I realized that children are the victims of this prejudice. The widespread social division affects Roma kids adversely, and hinders them from attaining proper education and a healthy social environment. And, it ultimately poses obstacles for their positive contribute to the global society.Through the book that I intend to publish with the help your generous contribution, I aspire to give voice to the dreams of these children. All the children and their parents who participated in the project by allowing me to take photos, expressed desires and hopes for a bright and prosperous future, like any of us would want. And, it is this expression that I tried to capture in all the photos that are to be published in the book.Even though, the book could be taken as a piece of art for photography admirers, or a piece of history by lovers of photo documentary genre, I would say that your contribution will bring dreams of our future generations’ one step closer to realization.  What We Need & What You GetWith your contributions, a book will be published. It will comprise of a brief text about history of Roma nomads, 40 photographs from Kirtimai tabor where approximately 400 Romani people live in wooden shackles without proper heating and water (Approximately half of these 400 people are children below 18 years of age.) And, statements of children and their parents, who opened their hearts and lives for you and me.To accomplish this, 6000 euro is pledged. Your contributions to this will be used for the following.
Printing of the book
Publishing of the book (Registering of ISBN and other formalities)
Distribution of the book (To various Museums, Galleries and Libraries)
And, funding educational activities in Kirtimai tabor.
 Your contribution in any form is appreciated, and we will always be grateful for it. And, if you want, you can get various perks in return. Such as:-
Signed and numbered prints (customized sizes), of one of the most appreciated photograph from the project, when it was exhibited at Vilnius town hall with the support of ministry of culture and department of minorities of the Republic of Lithuania.

The gathered funds will still be used for publication of the book, even if the goal is not met here. And, contributors who opt for perks will eventually get it.
