Photobook workshop in Ljubljana

story:
(Texte en français plus bas)

Presentation :

Lofos Athens is a very personal project, started in 2018 during my first long stay in the Greek capital. I was surprised to hear come up often in conversations with Athenians the idea that green spaces are lacking in the city. I had just moved there from Paris and this was not at all my impression. I saw Athens as a very rich city in terms of botanical life. It seemed as though plants were shooting out of every crack in the pavement. So I decided to confront these two feelings and explore the city’s green spaces. It was quickly clear that there are in fact not that many parks, as in organized green spaces. But that organic life was very present everywhere, from balconies to the streets and, of course, the hills or “Lofos”. 

As soon as I started exploring them I couldn’t stop, I felt fascinated by these spaces that are unlike any I had met before. The hills create a sense of wonder, as you explore them, the city fades away, only to appear through small windows in the trees. 

The book of Lofos Athens is a walk in these hills, an exploration of these utopic territories. Moving from a poetic aw to a look at the political and  social importance of their existence in the heart of Athens. 

The book is made of images taken between 2018 and 2021 and texts contributed by Marc Delalonde and Ioanna Gerakidi. The design will be overseen by Matto studio.

It is expected to come out in September of 2021

 

Why a book :

The idea of making the series into a book came quite naturally. It is a series of images that tell a strong story when put together, they create a narrative. The layout is meant to create a sequence of exploration, recreating the feeling of walking through the hills, stopping to admire a view, or details found along the way. This allows for an understanding of the geography and topology of the city. 

Making a book is also a way to look at multiple relationships between Athenians and the hills. The artists and designers involved in the project have a connection to the city and have explored the hills. These spaces are such strong and poetic territories, the relations with them is often quite intimate and by using a publication form I wish to recreate this feeling.

 

The contributors :

Nicolas Melemis is a Paris and Athens based photographer and artist. With a background in architecture, he works on sociability and relations between people in urban settings. He is one of the founding members of the creative Studio Acide and a regular collaborator to the design studio Diplomates.

 

Matto studio is  a creative studio and creator of Matto magazine. The studio, composed of Dominika Hadelova and Aldo Buscalferri is based in Paris. The magazine explores contemporary art and the creative process through curious conversations and studio visits.

 

Ioanna Gerakidi : is a writer, curator and educator based in Athens and Amsterdam. She has collaborated with and curated group shows/events for or within the context of Stedelijk Museum (Amsterdam), State of Concept (Athens), Amsterdam Art, Athens Biennale, Athens Digital Arts Festival, Hot Wheels Projects (Athens), Haus N (Athens) and more. Her texts have been presented at Kunstverein Amsterdam, Stroom (Den Hague), Künstlerhaus Stuttgart, CAC Vilnius, Carlos/Ishikawa (London), and NiMAC (Nicosia), among others. She has contributed in several publications and she has lectured or led workshops for Design Academy Eindhoven, Gerrit Rietveld Academie, Athens School of Fine Arts, Document & Contemporary Art PhD program, Onassis Air Residency, AKV St. Joost Den Bosch and Noiserr. Some of her past residencies include Rupert Residency, Syros Sound Meetings and NEON Curatorial Exchange Program. Projects of hers have been funded by Mondriaan Fonds, Outset Funds and Rupert Residency.

 

Marc Delalonde is a French curator, independent researcher and cultural practitioner currently based in Greece, where he lives in-between Mount Lycabettus and Strefi Hill. He works at the intersection of arts, community-building, environmental philosophy and political ecology. His practice stems from the intersection of concepts such as symbiosis, natureculture and the more-than-human.

 

The funding :

I already financed by myself a part of the book production + the expenses for the pictures, but we need your help to finance the last part of the production of the book. The money raised here will go to paying an honest wage to all the actors of the project : writers, designers, the translator and photographer. It will also go towards the production costs of printing and distribution. We worked towards making the object we wanted and making it the most affordable possible. The small amount of books made and the self published nature of the project make it difficult to minimise the costs.

If the amount raised is higher than the aimed amount, the extra money will go towards funding the next photo project (a study of the Eleonas area of Athens)

The object :

20x25cm, 130 pages, 65 images, 500 copies

Offset and risography printing

The book will be printed in Athens in the summer of 2021

 

Risks :

There is very little risk of the project not happening. We have secured the funds, the crowdfunding is mostly a presale campaign to be able to front the cost of production. 

 

Other ways to help :

This is a self published book and as such it is very personal and important to us. It is also a very big workload landing on a small number of people. Your support helps us financially, of course, in achieving our goal but it is also appreciated and is an essential boost in energy towards making this project happen !

If you cannot help us financially with this project please share this page on social media and through indiegogo’s website. 

 

Thank you for your support to this campaign.

 

Présentation :

Lofos Athens est un projet personnel initié lors de mon premier long séjour à Athènes, en 2018. J’ai été surpris d'entendre les athéniens se plaindre du manque de parc dans la capitale grecque. Arrivant moi-même de Paris, je ne partageais pas cette impression, en effet, la ville m’avait donné la sensation d’une présence botanique particulièrement forte. Les plantes semblaient sortir de chaque fissure de la chaussée. J’ai alors décidé de confronter les deux ressentis. Rapidement je me suis rendu compte qu’il y avait en effet peu de lieux ayant la fonction d’espaces verts. La vie organique était cependant omniprésente, dans la rue, sur les balcons et évidemment les collines ou “Lofos”.

Dès que j’ai commencé à m'intéresser aux collines, je n’ai pas pu m'arrêter. J’étais fasciné par ces espaces d’un genre que je n’avais encore jamais rencontré. Les collines créent un sentiment d’émerveillement et un échappatoire au milieu d’une mégalopole de 4 millions d’habitants. Lorsqu'on s’y enfonce, la ville s’efface pour n'apparaître que par les ouvertures dans le feuillage.

Le livre Lofos Athens est imaginé comme une balade dans ce territoire utopique. Il oscille entre un regard poétique sur l’espace et une analyse de leur importance politique et sociale au cœur d’Athènes.

Le livre se compose d’images réalisées entre 2018 et 2021, et de textes écrits par Marc Delalonde et Ioanna Gerakidi. Le design est supervisé par Matto Studio. 

Le livre est attendu pour septembre 2021.

 

Collaborateurs :

Nicolas Melemis est un photographe franco-canadien né à Paris en 1994. Après
des études à l’école d’architecture de La Villette, il intègre l’ENS Louis Lumière dont il sort diplômé en 2018. Il garde de ses années d’architecture un goût pour la fabrique du tissu urbain. Son travail porte sur le rapport entre les personnes et leurs environnements ainsi que le rôle du vernaculaire dans la construction urbaine. Il est un des cofondateur du studio de création Acide et un collaborateur régulier de l'atelier Diplomates.

 

Matto studio est un studio de création et un magazine indépendant créé en 2018 par Dominika Hadelova et Aldo Buscalferri à Paris. Le magazine explore l'art contemporain et le processus de création à travers de véritables conversations curieuses et des visites de studio.

 

Ioanna Gerakidi  est une écrivaine, commissaire et professeur basé entre Amsterdam et Athènes. Elle a notement collaboré avec et assuré le commissariat d'exposition pour notament les Stedelijk Museum (Amsterdam), State of Concept (Athens), Amsterdam Art, Athens Biennale, Athens Digital Arts Festival, Hot Wheels Projects (Athens), Haus N (Athens). Ses textes ont été présentés aux Kunstverein Amsterdam, Stroom (Den Hague), Künstlerhaus Stuttgart, CAC Vilnius, Carlos/Ishikawa (London), et NiMAC (Nicosia)... Elle a contribué à plusieurs publication et menée des workshop pour les Design Academy Eindhoven, Gerrit Rietveld Academie, Athens School of Fine Arts, Document & Contemporary Art PhD program, Onassis Air Residency, AKV St. Joost Den Bosch and Noiserr. Elle fut résidente des Rupert Residency, Syros Sound Meetings and NEON Curatorial Exchange Program. Ses projets ont été financé par, Mondriaan Fonds, Outset Funds and Rupert Residency.

 

Marc Delalonde est un commissaire, chercheur indépendant et practicien culturel basé à Athènes où il habite entre le mont Lycabette et la colline de Streffi. Son travail se place à l'intersection de l'art, du "community building", de la philosophy environementale et de l'écologie politique. Sa pratique se déploie à partir de concepts comme la symbiose, natureculture et le "plus que humain".

 

Pourquoi un livre ?

La qualité narrative des images a fait que le format du livre s'est naturellement imposé. J’aimerais créer par la mise en page, la sensation d’explorer, de se balader à travers les collines : s’arrêter pour admirer la vue, se pencher sur un détail...

Les rapports entre les athéniens et les collines sont souvent intimes et personnels. La forme du livre doit permettre de recréer cette intimité.

 

Le financement :

J’ai moi même avancé une part importante des frais de réalisation du projet et de production des images, mais nous avons besoin de votre aide pour la fin des frais de production. L’argent récolté ici servira à rémunérer correctement tous les acteurs du projet : écrivains, photographes, traducteurs et designers. Il servira également à payer l’impression et la distribution du livre. Nous avons travaillé à démocratiser l’objet final en limitant le prix, mais le projet étant auto produit ce n’est possible que dans une certaine mesure. 

Si toutefois nous réussissons à avoir plus de fonds que prévu initialement, ceux-ci iront vers le financement d’un prochain projet (un travail sur le quartier d’Eleonas à Athènes)

L'objet :

20x25cm, 130 pages, 65 images, 500 copies

Impressions en offset et risographie

Le livre sera imprimé à Athènes durant l'été de 2021

Risques :

Une grande parties des frais de production du livre ont été avancer et il y a peu de chance que le projet ne voit pas le jour.

 

Comment nous aider :

Le projet étant auto-édité, c’est une entreprise très personnelle et qui nous tient à cœur. C’est également une grande quantité de travail qui incombe à une petite équipe. Votre soutien financier nous aide évidemment à faire naître le livre mais tout soutien nous permet de trouver l'énergie d’avancer !  

Si vous ne pouvez pas nous soutenir financièrement, vous pouvez nous aider autrement en partageant cette page sur les réseaux sociaux ou sur le site indiegogo.
 

Merci pour votre soutien à cette campagne.

story:
Hi my name is Cate, 

I started doing fundraisers for the local community here in Bellingham, WA with my photography back in 2012, but I now have a tired camera that is on it's dying -- I need help upgrading it . . .especially if I am to continue doing fundraisers for at risk families with my photography and to get back to doing paying gigs.


Together the people of Bellingham, Modsock & I have raised a little over a $1000 in the 3 fundraisers we have done . . . each year our little fundraiser has grown as more families have discovered it & it feels good to be giving back to the community that I love so much. . . 

I have always donated my time, money and resources to the fundraisers not thinking about how my old Pentax K-10 or my other equipment was getting tired -- I was worried this last November my camera wasn't gonna make it; however, it did pull through, & since then I haven't been able to use it much for paying gigs.  It is at a point where I just can't guarantee quality anymore -- so I have started saving my pennies for an upgrade to the latest Pentax model, but I am afraid I may not have enough saved up before the next Holiday Season to do my fundraiser once more.

What I Need

I am looking to raise $2000 to help me upgrade to a Pentax K-3 camera, Pentax battery grip, extra batteries & a Pentax flash unit for the camera. . .


If I don't reach my $2000 goal the money raised will go into a savings account with the other funds I have been saving, until I can fully purchase my new Pentax K-3 camera.


What You Get

I have put together some fun perks In the way of cool note cards & Limited Edition prints (they will not be available anywhere else, so get them while you can) I created themfor you as a way of saying a special thanks for helping my little business and fundraisers out . . .

You will get anything from personal Thank You's, to Note Cards, A Limited Edition Print and even a Personal Photo Shoot.


Ways You Can Help

Donating is a great way to support this campaign, but if you can't help financially that doesn't mean you can't help out. . .

You can also help me out by spreading the word and by clicking on the share buttons, tools and by visiting my campaign on a regular basis-- help me by getting the word out about my campaign & help me keep doing fundraisers for the community I love so much -- also if you know some one who would loves Sock Monkeys they would probably love these really cool note cards, you should tell them to get them while they can. . .


Thanks for taking the time to watch my video & read about my campaign,

Cate

story:
This is a funding campaign to help me complete production of my book, titled “Generations: Following A Family Of Bald Eagles.”

After a series of personal setbacks, I was undecided about what to do with my life.  It was at that time I discovered a family of eagles nesting close by. I became fascinated by them and set out to get some pictures. My initial plan was to just get "some good pictures"....

Soon those few pictures turned in to a dream of documentating one year in the life of an eagle. Little did I realize that one year of photography would turn in to three years, and, that through the time I spent documenting this family of eagles, I would gain more insight about my life, my spirituality and my place in this world than I could ever have imagined.

I learned a lot about eagles but I also learned much about myself. And through it all, I was lucky enough to spend many mornings watching these majestic creatures raise their young.

Now after three years, it's time to share these photographs and to tell their story.

This 3 year photography project follows the life of two adult bald eagles and their offspring. Between spring of 2012 and fall of 2014, I spent countless hours watching and photographing two adult bald eagles that make their home in the Cuyahoga Valley National Park.

This project documents through photos the beauty, grace, power and majesty of our national bird. I photographed these eagles and their offspring year-round capturing rare moments in their life. Readers will get to view aspects of these birds that most people never see including hunting, building a new nest, mating, raising their young, feeding and preparing their offspring to leave the nest. I was lucky enough to even capture a rare moment of a baby eagle’s first flight.

This book will be a photographic/art book about the two eagles and their offspring. It is also a journal of my life during those three years and how nature and wildlife had a positive impact on me. It is meant to get people interested in these birds and encourage them to visit the parks and areas where these birds live and to have a new appreciation for these birds.

I also have quotes from various peoplpe that I met during this project who recall their stories about seeing these eagles for the first time.

This funding campaign will help to do the following:

  • Complete production of a self-published book entitled, “GENERATIONS; Following a Family Of Bald Eagles.”
  • Allow for production and distribution of FREE copies of an eBook version for students and teachers.
  • Provide a base funding amount for further documentation  of this pair of Bald Eagles to be incorporated in the eBook on future  updates.
  • Provide a base of support to cover expenses for the author to give free lectures and presentations.

There are many levels of funding options in which you can support my project. Each level includes its own perks/presents eg. copies of the book, signed prints from the photos in the books and even a guided tour of the CVNP.

Your support is appreciated and needed!

nesting close by. I became fascinated by them and set out to get some pictures.
My initial plan was to just get "some good pictures"....
Soon those few pictures turned in to a dream of documentating one year in the life of an eagle. Little did I realize that one year of photography would turn in to three years,
and, that through the time I spent documenting this family of eagles, I would
gain more insight about my life, my spirituality and my place in this world
than I could ever have imagined.
I learned a lot about eagles but I also learned much about myself. And through it all, I was
lucky enough to spend many mornings watching these majestic creatures raise
their young.
Now after three years, it's time to share these photographs and to tell their
story.
This 3 year photography project follows the life of two adult bald eagles
and their offspring. Between spring of 2012 and fall of 2014, I spent countless
hours watching and photographing two adult bald eagles that make their home in
the Cuyahoga Valley National Park.

This project documents through photos the beauty, grace, power and majesty
of our national bird. I photographed these eagles and their offspring
year-round capturing rare moments in their life. Readers will get to view
aspects of these birds that most people never see including hunting, building a
new nest, mating, raising their young, feeding and preparing their offspring to
leave the nest. I was lucky enough to even capture a rare moment of a baby
eagle’s first flight. 
This book will be a photographic/art book about the two eagles and their
offspring. It is also a journal of my life during those three years and how
nature and wildlife had a positive impact on me. It is meant to get people
interested in these birds and encourage them to visit the parks and areas where
these birds live and to have a new appreciation for these birds.I also have quotes from various peoplpe that I met during this project who recall their stories about seeing these eagles for the first time.
This funding campaign will help to do the following:

Complete production of a
     self-published book entitled, “GENERATIONS; Following a Family Of
     Bald Eagles.”
Allow for production and
     distribution of FREE copies of an eBook version for students and teachers. 
Provide a base funding amount
     for further documentation  of this pair of Bald Eagles to be incorporated
     in the eBook on future  updates.
Provide a base of support to
     cover expenses for the author to give free lectures and presentations.
There are many levels of funding options in which you can support my
project. Each level includes its own perks/presents eg. copies of the book,
signed prints from the photos in the books and even a guided tour of the CVNP.
Your support is appreciated and needed!

story:
OUR MANTRA

Beneath the beating heart of OneOfAKind Photography Adventures is a collective of landscape photographers who are working to change the way we share information about photography locations from all over the world. For those of us that love creating in the outdoors; location is everything. It is what inspires us, drives us and defines us. We no longer want to continue the tradition of “Chinese Whispers” about where to take a great photograph - We want to celebrate the beauty for all to see. We believe in collating the details of all these amazing places and rolling it into a neat little app, ready for use in the field. Whether you’re a photographer or just love travelling and exploring, this App will be essential for you. 

THE APP

The first App of its kind, is designed to be your photographic companion. It is your location bible, weatherman, tour guide, future planner and local tipster as you traverse the earth in search of beautiful locations, one after the other.
With its abundance of useful features, you will never find yourself short of inspiration or information: 
  • Ability to search for locations by photographer/contributor 
  • Ability to search for locations by type of image – ie, cityscape, abstract, landscape 
  • Search based on your GPS location or by a country 
  • How to get there, when is best to see a location 
  • Sunrise/Sunset azimuth locations 
  • Up to date weather information 
  • Map and Latitude/Longitude details 
  • Planner: add favourite locations to your planner for later reference 
  • Tips from the photographer who shot it 
  • Locations supplied are from worldwide professional landscape photographers, vetted for authenticity by the OOAK App management group

All of these amazing features are packed into a clean, delicate and beautiful user interface that is packed with features and enhancements to make the user experience as much fun as travelling.


THE PROGRESS

We launched our free OneOfAKind Location Guide to Apple iOS in November 2014 as proof of concept and the response has been nothing short of amazing. Since launching, we have amassed some pretty cool stats and reviews:


  • 200 contributors from industry leading photographers all over the world

  • 1500 amazing locations submitted

  • 7500 downloads


User Reviews such as:


“Congratulations on providing this tremendous App to photographers around the world. The app revolutionises the process of finding locations and will encourage photographers to share their work and expertise with a much wider audience.” - Peter Anthony


”Brillant app and a must for any travelling photographers tool kit!” - Bruce Hood


“This app is great. Easy to use and very informative about where locations are and best times to shoot them. I've already started planning an overseas trip using this app. Easy to contribute too also if you are keen to share some of your spots with others. 5/5 stars for me :)” - Brian Fairy


Industry Reviews from:

New ‘OneOfAKind’ Photography App is a Must Have



Location Guide App for Photography


WHO ARE WE

Our mantra here at OneOfAKind Photography Adventures has always been to spread the spirit of the adventure, to immerse yourself in the natural surroundings and embrace that driving force within all of us, to seek out the images from locations that most would see as too difficult. We love nothing more than travelling to remote places, creating the experiences with like minded photographers, to imbue the intense passion we have for what we are doing here at OOAK. We are always on the lookout for new members to join us, to come into the fold and show the world how amazing this group is, to make our mantra theirs as well.

Each and every one of us is a keen landscape photographer and understands the unique challenges and tribulations that come with pursuing this as a hobby, or as a practicing professional.

     

MEET THE ONEOFAKIND TEAM

THE PLAN

The demand for the Android version can not longer be ignored so we are asking for your support to take it further. We have been working night and day to fill our app with beauty from around the world. By funding our efforts you will not only be realising our dream of viewing these amazing locations on Android, you will also allow us to concentrate on building and drive a tool that will become invaluable to all photographers.


Whether you’re loving the iOS version, or eagerly anticipating the Android versions’ release, we kindly ask that you spread it far and wide, so that we can reach as many interested people as possible.

story:
What is Stand Alone Cosplay?

Stand Alone Cosplay (S.A.C.) is an academic research project being conducted by Sharon Elkind M.A. from the University of Sydney in Australia. Together with Sakura Yume Photography's founder, Candice Campbell M.Ed, the project is setting out over the next three years to document and study Cosplay performance in the United States of America, Australia, and Japan, as well as online. In order to cover such a wide area, we are asking for assistance in funding travel and shipping costs for Sakura Yume Photography to come to Australia where a third of the research is taking place. More about the project can be found on S.A.C.'s official website.

 About Sakura Yume Photography:

Sakura Yume Photography is a small business run out of New Hampshire, USA that specializes in Cosplay photography as well as also doing portraits and covering various community events throughout the New England region. Run by Candice Campbell M.Ed, the business has grown over the last year from a casual hobby to an ever expanding business. Up until now the business has been entirely self funded, including equipment, travel, and lodging.

A Note From Sakura Yume Photography's Owner:

And Hello to you! My name is Candice Campbell and I am from the beautiful White Mountains of New Hampshire. Normally an Early Childhood Educator, I have discovered that I also have a passion for photography, especially when it comes to Cosplay. I officially started a small business, loving known as Sakura Yume (Cherry Blossom Dreams) Photography last year and have worked at a number of events, as well as done private photography work since then. This year I have been promoted to become the assistant director of photography for Connecticon in Hartford, Connecticut USA and I have been asked to a number of other conventions in the region to be the official Cosplay photographer. In the past I have also Cosplayed myself and been a judge for Cosplay competitions at conventions.

Recently, a very good friend of mine, Sharon Elkind M.A., traveled back to Australia to continue her education. She has asked me to be the photographer for her Doctoral research on the Global Aspects of Cosplay and Identity. The thesis will be published by The University of Sydney with a tentative release in 2016.

As a small business owner, I have funded this business mostly by myself up until now. Last summer I lost my job now only have been able to teach part time. The travel and shipping costs for myself and my photography equipment to reach Australia are higher than any of my previous photography jobs, so I am turning to the community to help me reach my goal of bringing Sakura Yume Photography to Australia in 2014 to photograph and document Australian Cosplayers. 

The Impact:

Cosplay has become an international phenomenon over the last few decades, but the existing research that exists on the topic is lacking. Cosplay photography is also scattered and is generally done by the Cosplayers on an amateur level. S.A.C. will merge these two fields and provide for better analysis and documentation of modern Cosplay culture on an international scale. Together, Sakura Yume Photography and the researchers involved in the project, hope to provide informed analysis and detailed photographs to teach the world about Anime, Manga, and Gaming Cosplay. Contributing to this fund raiser if your chance to be an instrumental part of helping us achieve this goal.

Perks:

We will be adding new perks as time goes on. Keep checking back!

What We Need:

  • The goal for this campaign is to raise $5,000 (USD). All funds will be going towards purchasing new photography equipment, travel and shipping expenses for myself (photographer) and the equipment to Australia where the research will be taking place.
  • Any amount is extremely helpful and the perks are entirely optional.
  • Even if our goal is not completely reached, the funds raised will still go towards this project.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Even if you cannot donate, please spread the word of this campaign anyway you can via Facebook, Twitter, Website, word of mouth, or use the Indiegogo tools!

story:
Short Summary

ArtistsActivists.ORG is an affiliate of America Educates, a 501(c)3 nonprofit organization based in Washington, D.C.
Our mission is to provide design services and to conduct art and design workshops with kids around the world. 

Kids Peace Photography is ArtistsActivists' program to teach children who don't otherwise have access to cameras about the power of images. In unplanned settlements (slums), post-disaster areas, post-conflict areas, and poor neighborhoods around the world we help children find a voice through the artistic expression. Through photography, children show the world people and things that are important to them in their community. They process trauma, find hope, and focus on peace.

What We Need & What You Get

Artists Activists taught photography to children in Haiti and Africa. You can see the kids' photos from these workshops in the image above and many more photos that children took on our site, ArtistsActivists.org.

We did it with borrowed cameras.

What we need: We have contacts ready in Colombia, Haiti, and Kenya to teach more workshop, but we want to own cameras we can use again and again--not borrow them each time. in With $1000, we will buy 10 permanent high-quality cameras to keep teaching kids' peace photography in 2012. 

What you get:  Donations at $20 or higher get you perks like signed thank-you cards or mounted prints to hang on your wall featuring a photo taken by a child in one of our Kids Peace Photography workshops. But donate as much or as little as you can--it's about kids learning photography and knowing you made it possible!

The Impact

10 cameras teach a class of 30-40 kids: In our classes and workshops, we like to have three or four children per camera for a few reasons: 1) When one child is taking a picture, having at least two other kids on the other side of the cameras helps to make dynamic images. 2) Kids learn creativity and photography skills from each other, not to mention sharing and helping younger children. 3) we teach in areas that can be dangerous, like the notorious slums of Kibera and Cite Soleil, so having a group of children and one adult around each camera makes for a safer experience.

Please help us get to our goal! You can buy a pretty nice digital camera for $100, and for $1000 we can buy 10. If we buy more cameras, we will leave one camera at each new location, with a children's organization to make sure it is shared and properly used. If we don't make our goal, we will buy fewer cameras and teach smaller workshops until our goal is met.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute to this campaign, there may be other ways you can help! You can donate art supplies or cameras, suggest contacts and organizations through which we can reach children in new parts of the world, or offer other ways you can help. Write to us artistsactivists.org contact page and be an artist-activist!

story:
The Plan 

On July 1st, I will travel to a boarding school in Rome where I will spend 5 weeks as a staff member for two summer programs for high school students.  After the program ends, I will spend a few days traveling the country before flying back to the United States.
 
Why this is exciting: 
-This will be my first trip overseas.  Going to Italy has always been my dream and it's finally coming true.  
-I will have some free time every day to explore the city and take photographs.
-I will get to travel with the program (and on my own) to cities throughout Italy, and I will get to take photographs of those places as well. 
 

This is where you come in.

I want to print photo books of my journey, but I need your help to do it.  Your contribution would enable me to pay for the production of the photo books as well as the printing and shipping for my other awards.  Any extra money would enable me to travel to more cities where I could take more pictures.  If I don't reach the project goal, I will still use the money for the books and prints, but fewer of them will be produced. 

 

The photographs in the book will span my six weeks in Italy.  I plan to include photos from Rome, Florence, Pompeii, Orvieto, Venice, and anywhere else I have the opportunity to go.  I will post some of the photographs on Flickr (http://www.flickr.com/photos/kaylasmith/) during my trip so you can get a preview of the book and (for those who contribute $25 or more) pick which photos you'd like prints of. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word!  Tell your friends, post a link on your facebook, and send an email to others who can do the same.

story:
(FR en bas)

Songs of the Inner Chamber

I’ve had two callings in my life. One was to be an artist. The second was to be socially engaged, to give a voice to vulnerable communities. I’ve been calling myself an “artivist” for the last 15 years, but that’s what I have been for my whole life.

Since I started creating art, I tried to understand the rules by which gender identities are created. These rules have been systematically used to create inequality between people, often for reasons that are out of their control, like their ethnicity, their biological sex or their sexual preference.

Gender equality seems like such an obvious concept for me. I mean, who would be against women having the same opportunity as men, having the same access to education, health, equal pay or just the basic protection against violence.

Unfortunately, a lot of people believe that this should not be so! Maybe because of their culture, their religion or their family values have made them see these inequalities as natural, as a biological certainty that divides women and men. While it is obvious that nobody is the same we have agreed as a society, at least in principle that everyone should be equal in rights and obligations.

South Korea

Last year I went to South Korea through an artistic residency offered by the Museum of Modern and Contemporary Art of Seoul (MMCA) and the Arts Council of Quebec (CALQ). My goal was to study the history of gender inequality in East Asia, to learn about the current ideas and issues that persist. I wanted to be able to understand gender inequality from a global perspective. I have to say that this trip reminded me of the importance of doing what I do.

I prepared for moths, I studied Korean and I also contacted dancers that would be willing to collaborate.

I found that the roots of gender inequality are the same everywhere. That no matter where you are, there has been a history of depriving women of some of the most fundamental rights at that place. Inequality might be ravaging or it might be invisible, but one thing is sure, it is always present. Equal pay escapes even some of the most advanced countries.

While in Korea I quickly realized that more than sharing a point of view I needed to listen; I needed to let the women (and men) I was working with tell you their stories, their grievances, their unfulfilled potentials and their successes in this quest.

“This project reminded me why is meaningful to keep dancing” I hear a dancer say while struggling to fulfill her dreams and her role as a mother and wife. “ I want to show society that even though I’m in control of my body and my sexuality, I’m still a good Korean woman”, said another one of the dancers.

How will you help

“Songs of the inner chamber” is about giving a voice to those women that often go unheard, who’s potential is stifled and their spirit trampled under the weight of tradition and conformity. These images make their voices be heard beyond their country. They express themselves freely through movement, creating in unison visual poetry.

Your contribution will help the voices of these women go further, to have accomplishments outside of their possibilities and to build greater meaning for their lives. You will help the conversation stay alive around the topic of gender equality around the world.

____________________

La poésie des chambres

Dans ma vie professionnelle, j’ai eu deux grandes passions. La première est être un artiste. La deuxième est mon engagement social, plus précisément donner une voix aux communautés les plus vulnérables. Ça fait plus de sept ans que je me fais appeler artiviste, mais je l’ai été pendant toute ma carrière, peut-être toute ma vie.

Depuis que j’ai compris les outils que l’art me donnait pour saisir le monde, j’ai voulu comprendre les structures dans lesquelles les identités sexuées sont créées et régulées, et les déconstruire par la suite. Ces structures ont été utilisées systématiquement pour créer des inégalités entre les gens pour des raisons qui sont souvent hors de leur contrôle comme leur ethnicité, leur sexe ou encore leur orientation sexuelle.

L’égalité des sexes m’a toujours semblé comme un concept évident. Qui pourrait être contre le fait que les femmes aient accès aux mêmes opportunités que les hommes,  un véritable accès à l’éducation, un salaire équitable, ou des protections élémentaires contre la violence.

Malheureusement, il y en a beaucoup! C’est peut-être parce que leur culture, leur religion ou leurs valeurs ont normalisé ces inégalités, elles semblent naturelles, une certitude biologique qui trace une ligne entre hommes et femmes. Même s’il semble évident que personne n’est pareil, nous nous sommes mis d'accord, comme société qu’en principe, nous sommes tous égaux.

La Corée du Sud

L’an dernier j’ai fait une résidence artistique en Corée du Sud avec le but d’étudier l’histoire de l’inégalité des sexes en Asie de l’Est. Je voulais arriver à une compréhension globale de l’inégalité.  Je dois dire que ce voyage m’a rappelé l’importance de continuer ce que je fais.

Quelques mois avant je me suis mis à faire de la recherche, à apprendre un peu de Coréen et à commencer à contacter des danseurs qui deviendraient des collaborateurs.

D’abord, c’était clair que les racines de l’inégalité des sexes sont les mêmes partout. Peu importe où on est sur la planète on peut trouver des traces d’histoire où les femmes se sont fait enlever des droits fondamentaux.  Les sociétés du monde avancent différemment. L’inégalité peut être dévastatrice ou peut être invisible, mais ce qui est sûr c’est qu’elle est toujours là.

Pendant ma résidence artistique en Corée j’ai compris rapidement que le plus important c’était  de laisser les femmes (et hommes) qui ont collaboré avec moi vous raconter leurs histoires, leurs griefs, leurs potentiels inachevés, et leurs victoires.

«  Ce projet m’a rappelé l’importance de continuer à danser » j’ai entendu dire une des danseuses, tandis qu’elle trouvait difficile de combler son rôle comme femme mariée et mère.

« Je veux montrer à la société (Coréenne) que même si je suis en contrôle de mon corps et de ma sexualité, je suis une bonne femme »,  a mentionné une autre danseuse.

Avec ton aide

La mission  de  « La poésie des chambres »  est d’offrir une voix à ces femmes que souvent ne sont pas entendues, dont leur potentiel est étouffé et leur esprit piétiné sous le poids de la tradition et  la conformité. Ces images amplifient leur voix au-delà de leur pays. Elles s’expriment le plus librement à travers du mouvement, et créent à l’unisson une poésie visuelle.

Votre contribution aidera à couvrir les coûts reliés à la production de l'exposition. Notamment les impressions, le montage, l'encadrement et les frais de transport.

Mais encore plus important, votre support aidera à amplifier les voix de ses femmes et de maintenir l’égalité des sexes au centre des conversations que nous avons sur le futur de notre société.
story_txt: (FR en bas)Songs of the Inner ChamberI’ve had two callings in my life. One was to be an artist. The second was to be socially engaged, to give a voice to vulnerable communities. I’ve been calling myself an “artivist” for the last 15 years, but that’s what I have been for my whole life.Since I started creating art, I tried to understand the rules by which gender identities are created. These rules have been systematically used to create inequality between people, often for reasons that are out of their control, like their ethnicity, their biological sex or their sexual preference.Gender equality seems like such an obvious concept for me. I mean, who would be against women having the same opportunity as men, having the same access to education, health, equal pay or just the basic protection against violence.Unfortunately, a lot of people believe that this should not be so! Maybe because of their culture, their religion or their family values have made them see these inequalities as natural, as a biological certainty that divides women and men. While it is obvious that nobody is the same we have agreed as a society, at least in principle that everyone should be equal in rights and obligations.South KoreaLast year I went to South Korea through an artistic residency offered by the Museum of Modern and Contemporary Art of Seoul (MMCA) and the Arts Council of Quebec (CALQ). My goal was to study the history of gender inequality in East Asia, to learn about the current ideas and issues that persist. I wanted to be able to understand gender inequality from a global perspective. I have to say that this trip reminded me of the importance of doing what I do.I prepared for moths, I studied Korean and I also contacted dancers that would be willing to collaborate.I found that the roots of gender inequality are the same everywhere. That no matter where you are, there has been a history of depriving women of some of the most fundamental rights at that place. Inequality might be ravaging or it might be invisible, but one thing is sure, it is always present. Equal pay escapes even some of the most advanced countries.While in Korea I quickly realized that more than sharing a point of view I needed to listen; I needed to let the women (and men) I was working with tell you their stories, their grievances, their unfulfilled potentials and their successes in this quest.“This project reminded me why is meaningful to keep dancing” I hear a dancer say while struggling to fulfill her dreams and her role as a mother and wife. “ I want to show society that even though I’m in control of my body and my sexuality, I’m still a good Korean woman”, said another one of the dancers.How will you help“Songs of the inner chamber” is about giving a voice to those women that often go unheard, who’s potential is stifled and their spirit trampled under the weight of tradition and conformity. These images make their voices be heard beyond their country. They express themselves freely through movement, creating in unison visual poetry.Your contribution will help the voices of these women go further, to have accomplishments outside of their possibilities and to build greater meaning for their lives. You will help the conversation stay alive around the topic of gender equality around the world.____________________La poésie des chambresDans ma vie professionnelle, j’ai eu deux grandes passions. La première est être un artiste. La deuxième est mon engagement social, plus précisément donner une voix aux communautés les plus vulnérables. Ça fait plus de sept ans que je me fais appeler artiviste, mais je l’ai été pendant toute ma carrière, peut-être toute ma vie.Depuis que j’ai compris les outils que l’art me donnait pour saisir le monde, j’ai voulu comprendre les structures dans lesquelles les identités sexuées sont créées et régulées, et les déconstruire par la suite. Ces structures ont été utilisées systématiquement pour créer des inégalités entre les gens pour des raisons qui sont souvent hors de leur contrôle comme leur ethnicité, leur sexe ou encore leur orientation sexuelle.L’égalité des sexes m’a toujours semblé comme un concept évident. Qui pourrait être contre le fait que les femmes aient accès aux mêmes opportunités que les hommes,  un véritable accès à l’éducation, un salaire équitable, ou des protections élémentaires contre la violence.Malheureusement, il y en a beaucoup! C’est peut-être parce que leur culture, leur religion ou leurs valeurs ont normalisé ces inégalités, elles semblent naturelles, une certitude biologique qui trace une ligne entre hommes et femmes. Même s’il semble évident que personne n’est pareil, nous nous sommes mis d'accord, comme société qu’en principe, nous sommes tous égaux.La Corée du SudL’an dernier j’ai fait une résidence artistique en Corée du Sud avec le but d’étudier l’histoire de l’inégalité des sexes en Asie de l’Est. Je voulais arriver à une compréhension globale de l’inégalité.  Je dois dire que ce voyage m’a rappelé l’importance de continuer ce que je fais.Quelques mois avant je me suis mis à faire de la recherche, à apprendre un peu de Coréen et à commencer à contacter des danseurs qui deviendraient des collaborateurs.D’abord, c’était clair que les racines de l’inégalité des sexes sont les mêmes partout. Peu importe où on est sur la planète on peut trouver des traces d’histoire où les femmes se sont fait enlever des droits fondamentaux.  Les sociétés du monde avancent différemment. L’inégalité peut être dévastatrice ou peut être invisible, mais ce qui est sûr c’est qu’elle est toujours là.Pendant ma résidence artistique en Corée j’ai compris rapidement que le plus important c’était  de laisser les femmes (et hommes) qui ont collaboré avec moi vous raconter leurs histoires, leurs griefs, leurs potentiels inachevés, et leurs victoires.«  Ce projet m’a rappelé l’importance de continuer à danser » j’ai entendu dire une des danseuses, tandis qu’elle trouvait difficile de combler son rôle comme femme mariée et mère.« Je veux montrer à la société (Coréenne) que même si je suis en contrôle de mon corps et de ma sexualité, je suis une bonne femme »,  a mentionné une autre danseuse.Avec ton aideLa mission  de  « La poésie des chambres »  est d’offrir une voix à ces femmes que souvent ne sont pas entendues, dont leur potentiel est étouffé et leur esprit piétiné sous le poids de la tradition et  la conformité. Ces images amplifient leur voix au-delà de leur pays. Elles s’expriment le plus librement à travers du mouvement, et créent à l’unisson une poésie visuelle.Votre contribution aidera à couvrir les coûts reliés à la production de l'exposition. Notamment les impressions, le montage, l'encadrement et les frais de transport.Mais encore plus important, votre support aidera à amplifier les voix de ses femmes et de maintenir l’égalité des sexes au centre des conversations que nous avons sur le futur de notre société.

story:
In 1910, when the world map had achieved its final shape, and it seemed as if there was nothing left to be discovered, 65 men decided to take the ultimate adventure: reaching the South Pole. The Terra Nova, a British expedition named after its supply ship, was established. It was led by Robert Falcon Scott.

Scott’s expedition aimed to carry out extensive exploration and scientific experiments. Unfortunately, the Norwegian Amundsen who lead a rival expedition with the same goal, outrun it by 34 days. Not only that, but Scott and his crew died on their way back.

But this was not the end of it.

A century later, the summer melt of 2013 at Scott’s Hut (Cape Evans, Antarctica) revealed a hidden relic from the Terra Nova Expedition. It was George Murray Levick’s notebook. Levick, who was the expedition’s surgeon and zoologist, took many photographs during the trip.

Somehow Levick’s notebook was left behind when Terra Nova departed from Antarctica in February 1913, but it has now been restored by the Antarctic Heritage Trust and returned to Scott’s hut at Cape Evans. Our project was inspired by this rare find that remained hidden for more than 100 years. This notebook was titled the “Wellcome Photographic Exposure Record and Diary 1910.” It included such details as the photograph dates, descriptions and exposure times.

We cherish the photographers who took place in the Terra Nova expedition, risking their lives for the sake of universal knowledge. They took photos under the harshest conditions, including severe winds, freezing temperatures, and lack of food. Their feat deserves to be acknowledged. For this reason, we are devoting this project to all the bold, adventurous photographers who give up their comfort, health, and sometimes even their lives, for the sake of stunning photographs.

We, Team Galaxy, have quite an extensive collection of photographers’ notebooks from the past. The oldest one goes all the way back to 1907! This was even before Scott’s famed expedition. In our search for content, quality, and design we’ve looked through several types of notebooks.

Since George Murray Levick’s notebook is one of the reasons we’re creating our Galaxy Handbook, we’d like to dedicate it to the Terra Nova expedition and feature some real photographs from this trip in it. In addition, $5 from each pledge will be donated to the Antarctic Heritage Trust in New Zealand, who unearthed and restored the notebook.
To learn more about the Terra Nova expedition you can watch this wonderful documentary, “90 Degrees South,” comprised of footage by Herbert George Ponting, a professional photographer and member of Robert Falcon Scott's expedition. The introduction is by Admiral Edward Russell Evans, who was second-in-command and accompanied Scott to within 150 miles of the Pole.

Galaxy has developed a handbook that encompasses your entire photography activities, from jotting down daily plans, keeping information about major photo events, holding a special logbook for your pictures, and beyond.

When you shoot with a digital camera after having used an analog one, you realize that among the other advantages of a digital camera, you also get a lot of information (aperture, shutter speed, location, etc.) conveniently wrapped in a file as metadata for each picture. Analog photographers don’t have this luxury. If they want to keep up with their technologically enabled colleagues, they need to maintain a record of what, how and where they are shooting. That is why one of the most important tools in a photographer's bag is a professional notebook.

Galaxy Photographers’ Planner and Handbook is the hub for all your creative ideas, goals, inspirations and a source of handy information. Imagine this professionally printed and bound handbook where you will capture the things you are doing as well as the things you want to be doing. This handbook will give you the comfort of having all the essential information for your photo shoots handy. 

We strive to create a universal professional design for our handbook. 
It has a leather hardcover that comes in either Deep Red or Obsidian Black. 
Its thick paper is perfect for your notes. 
The size is compact enough to fit in any bag, yet large enough to let you take notes. 
The excellent printing will not fade away with time. 
And due to its informational compound, this handbook qualifies as a real book with its own ISBN-number, 978-0-9969884-0-7.

All types of analog photographers will find this Handbook useful:

  • Professionals. Professionalism goes hand in hand with perfectionism (and we mean it in the best way possible). This handbook is designed specially to keep all your photo notes in perfect condition so that you may precisely figure out the right recipe for your best shot.
  • Large Format Photographers. The section for large format photographs includes such graphs as Holder #, Film type, Lens, Bellows, Filter, Meter readings, Adjusted Exposure Value, Reciprocity.
  • Pinhole Photographers. Our brothers in arms sometimes unjustly forgotten... We have records sheets and a lot of useful information for you too.
  • Amateurs. Photographers who take pictures for pleasure, usually do it occasionally. It’s easy to forget what helped you achieve a great photography effect. Keeping notes will provide you material with which to work on your skills.
  • Students. Cheat sheets, infographics, recipes for the development process – no need to flip through textbooks as we have gathered all the needed info in one place.
  • Alternative Photographers. Our “Darkroom Records” section is great for writing down various development options and keeping track of what effect each option gives. 
  • Anybody who loves photography. This Handbook is the link between photography’s present and past. You have a chance to become part of photography’s history as we bring back to life a classic photographer’s notebook from the beginning of the last century.

It doesn’t matter if you are a professional photographer or a student; this handbook will become your best aide!

The Galaxy Photographer's Planner And Handbook (c) 2015–2016 is protected by US and International Copyright and may not be reproduced, distributed, or used commercially without Galaxy's express permission.

As usual, we are making a product that we’ll be using ourselves, and we are very serious about its design, quality, and functionality. In our ultimate photo handbook you will find everything a professional photographer might need:

  Design

Galaxy Photographer's Planner and Handbook is elegantly and practically designed and manufactured. It also feels great to the touch, so that you can get maximum enjoyment in daily usage. It is produced with the best materials and attention to every detail to ensure perfection.

  • Portable size. 6.25 X 4 in (or 16 x 10 cm) Galaxy Photographer's Planner and Handbook is small enough to take everywhere and large enough to make the records.
  • A luxurious and sophisticated cover. Smooth, soft to the touch and durable cover in Deep Red or Obsidian Black leather. Elegant debossed Logo. 
    PU Leather is a man-made material that will represent the look and feel of Genuine Leather. This material is very pliable and will stretch but will not crack. It has a more shiny appearance and generally is far less thick. Grooves similar to your fingerprints are mechanically pressed into the material to give it that REAL look. This material for the most part is waterproof and easily cleaned or maintained.
  • Total 256 pages. Full of useful information and forms for your records.
  • Thick, premium paper. The pages are made of high quality 80 gsm of bright white paper. Back side of front cover is made with 140 gsm of white paper.
  • Elastic band. The red band that fits into a special indenture in cover nicely stitched alongside holds your planner tightly closed when you are on the move. The pages stay crisp and clean.
  • Elastic pen holder. Keeps your pen handy.
  • Bookmark ribbon. Use the ribbon to mark your current page or a favorite resource. Ribbons come in black or white.

 Introduction Section

  • The owner’s Information Page. The information you will input in this notebook is too precious to lose. Make the handbook your personal accessory. 
  • Preface. The introduction will tell you the exciting story of Scott’s expedition that became our inspiration. 
  • Index. Our notebook has numerous sections, so the index here will help you navigate the information.
  • 2016, 2017, 2018 Calendar. he year 2016, as well as the two following years’ calendars are included to give you perspective on how much time has gone by and the amount of time that has yet to come. This can also be a good way to mark down any significant dates in 2016 or any days-to-look-forward in the following years.
  • Important Dates. For your convenience, the planner will include information about important dates in 2016 including all the major photographic contests and events. You will see the links to the websites of the contests, submission deadlines, the grand prizes as well as the dates and entrance fees for the major photo exhibitions.

  Records Section

  • Monthly Planner. The Records Section opens up with a convenient monthly planner. Have all your projects available at a glance. Keep your life on-track and priorities straight for every month, set objectives or schedule all upcoming photo shoots, etc..  
  • Exposures Records. A special log for inputting the technical data of the photos you took will be divided into three sections: 135/120/220 film Records, Pinhole Records, and Large Format Records. For each section, there will be special graphs such as aperture, exposure, ISO and so on.
  • Zone system Records. The Zone System is a photographic technique helping to determine optimal film exposure and development, formulated by Ansel Adams and Fred Archer. We have not only included the description of the zone system, but also a zone records form— the most optimal way of taking zone exposure notes.
  • Location Scouting Records. This section will help you keep track of all the places where you would like to carry out the next photo shoot. Even when photographers are running errands, their creative minds look for scenic places to photograph. Never miss a single inspiring location with this section! 
  • Darkroom records. This part will be especially useful for photographers who like to experiment with alternative chemistry and developing processes. There are numerous developing processes out there, so why not try something new? A true artist likes to experiment not only with the matter of the picture, but with the manner too! 
  • Memoranda. These pages are dotted so that they could be used as graph paper, for drawings, or as lined paper. The dots are soft and pale so that the pages can also be treated as blank paper for miscellaneous records such as inspirational ideas, addresses for photo shoots, or simply to make a list of photo supplies you need to buy. It is inspired by sketchbooks that are used in project design.

Handbook Section

  • Infographic / Cheat sheets. This section will be particularly useful for students as it has all the basic information about the aperture, ISO, shutter speed, and other parameters. This section only takes a couple of pages, yet it has the informational content of photography textbook. 
  • Practical Daily. Other uncategorized practical information for photographers that will help you master your skills.
  • Chemistry. This section will be useful for photographers of all ranges: from first-year photography students to seasoned professionals who want to try out a new development process. This section will include film development, photo paper development, and reversal process.

.

  General Info Section

This section is full of straight forward and useful information for photographers. It provides the most practical data about galleries, agents, major photo suppliers, photography media - magazines and publishers (including contacts, online links etc.). Very easy to read and find what you are looking for.

We are Galaxy, a group of photography professionals who are madly in love with analog photography and its paraphernalia. You might know us by our recent project on recreating the direct positive photo paper that Kodak manufactured about 70 years ago (https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/galaxy-hyper...) (you might even have supported our debut project, in which case, a big shout out to you, great friend!). The  community warmly welcomed this project, and we decided to devote our time to reviving the art and paraphernalia of analog photography.

story:
ABOUT BEYOND THE FOG

     Beyond the fog is an art project aiming to investigate a new aesthetic approach to the landscape in Photography and Poetry, developed from researching the history of Italian photography between World War I and II.
     The project will take the form of a photo book with 30 photos and 30 poems,
to be shared on the web and in Italian and French art galleries.

     Gradual updates about Beyond the Fog will become available online on my website: http://www.matteostorer.com/#!progetti-in-corso/c1en6.

 

Examples of  the photos I want to include in the project:

 

 

M. Storer, Omaggio a Fra Angelico, Firenze, aprile 2014.

  

M. Storer, Como, Como, luglio 2014.

  

 

INSIDE THE PROJECT

 

About the title

     “Fog” is a poetic concept to describe the contemporary condition in which we live our present. We live in a time of great potentiality for the Arts. At the same time, it is easy to lose one’s sense of direction among them; like in a foggy landscape. To try to see “beyond the fog” stands for my personal attempt to find and define a direction.

 

My idea of landscape

     I am very fascinated by the Photography and Literature of the 30s. This period fascinates me because of the synthesis between idealism and realism it presents: order and synthesis at once.

     For my Master Thesis in Fine Art I researched the Italian photographer Mario Bellavista (1907-1990) and Italian photography between World War I and II (see http://www.associazionetargaoro.it/mario-bellavista/fotografare-in-sintoniabrcon-i-tempi ). My particular focus has been on the approach of Bellavista, and his colleagues, to the landscape. Their thoughts and their works have influenced my way of thinking about the photographic image.

     During the 20s and 30s, with the arrival on the market of small size cameras and with the popularity of a modernist taste, many photographers explored new ways to represent the landscape. They abandoned the pictorial and romantic approach they had used until then – although historically key to the maturation of photography as a form of art. Foggy landscapes and large horizons were replaced
with small portions of reality, as fragments of the scenery of modern life.
The smallest detail in nature, filtered by the photographer’s personality, could show the expressive power of a work of art.

 

M. Storer, Origami, Milano, luglio 2014.

 

      I believe the approach I am describing has a significance with respect to our present situation and the potential to lead to a new way to represent and document the contemporary. Today anything can be photographed and immediately shared with the whole world. Thus, I propose there is an analogy between this contemporary mode and the aesthetics with which in the 30s anything could be represented with beauty. I believe that we have the possibility to learn from this parallelism.

    

M. Storer, Distanza, Milano, dicembre 2013.

 

     I believe, just like then, human questions on the sense of beauty and our need for it in our life are still persistently actual. Without stepping back from the challenges of the contemporary, I think we need to reconnect to the tradition of beauty that, through different forms and aesthetic outcomes, traversed the history of art and which today we tend to forget.

 

 

About my method

     The examples of photographs provided show that the language of this project takes a distance from the style of the photographic reportage. They favor instead a slow and meditative way of photographing, in adherence to the pictures of the art masters.

     For instance the pine tree I found in Florence during a walk can be documented and represented with the same elegance and delicacy of a Beato Angelico painting (see above Omaggio a Fra Angelico, also available at: http://www.matteostorer.com/#!matteo-storer-fotografia/csoj).


 

About my poems

     The research at the core of Beyond the Fog, will develop by engaging a dialogue between photography and poetry. The rhythm of the narration will adapt on the characteristics of the two expressive languages.

     As in my photography work, in the past years (2012-2013), I have often chosen the language of poetry to describe human life in relation to the landscape. My writings too are very much influenced by the poetry of the 30s: Italian poetry (Cesare Pavese over all) and international poetry (Thomas Stearns Eliot, Boris Pasternack, Jules Supervielle).

 

These are examples of my poems: http://www.matteostorer.com/#!vuoto/c16e2.

 

 

About the book

     I would like to realize a hard cover book of approximately 100 pages. The specifics of Beyond the fog book – size, paper, font, materials,... – will be decided according to the development of the project and published on my website: http://www.matteostorer.com/#!progetti-in-corso/c1en6.

 

 

WHAT I PLAN TO DO WITH THE FIRST 2000 € AND YOUR HELP

  • To carry out the first part of the work, I plan to do an artist  residency in Paris (I am presently searching for support structures to do this). Half of my pictures for the project will be of French landscapes. The reason for choosing Paris is because it is very modern in photography, both in the historical research and in its cultural proposal. Alongside, I plan to spend time studying the catalogues of French photographic exhibitions of the 30s, focusing my attention on landscape photographs made by Italian photographers of the period. From this study I expect to improve my knowledge about the relationships between Italy and France in the 30s. I hope to shape the cultural proposal of my project also on the interest of the French public. In fact, during my researches in Paris, I will look for art and photography galleries with an interest in my project.

  • Buy the necessary materials and equipment to shoot the photographs and
    write the poems. Meet the costs of high quality prints and to produce the first copy of the book.

 

With the other 2000 € and your help I will print the first numbered edition of
Beyond the Fog.


 

ABOUT ME

     I was born in Milan in 1988.

     I studied Set Design and Painting at Accademia di Belle Arti di Brera in Milan.

     I currently live and work in Milan.

 

     Last july I graduated in Painting with a thesis project titled La fotografia come arte del vivere per Mario Bellavista - Un fotografo amatore fra le due guerre.
In that occasion I presented some of the photos which have become the start point of Beyond the Fog.

 

 

Discussion of my Master thesis in july 2014. From left to right: me; Painting Professor Italo Bressan; History of Photography Professor Anna Maria Amonaci; Prof. Gaetano Grillo; Prof. Giordano Montorsi.

 

     In 2011 I realized a thesis project (in Set Design) titled Miquel Barcelò e un lavoro sul mare. On that occasion I also presented a performance project: Il nare - quasi mare (http://www.matteostorer.com/#!matteo-storer-arti-visive-2/c1wfd).


     My complete art work is available on the website www.matteostorer.com
divided in sections: Photography, Visual Arts, Set Design, Writings. The website is currently available only in Italian, but will be soon updated to an English version.

 

Website preview:

 

Please, remember to visit my website! Write to me if you're interested also in my other artworks.


My CV (Italian):
http://media.wix.com/ugd/0d4b22_6247a1a1b77a453693b64e8487243ef3.pdf


My Exibitions:
http://media.wix.com/ugd/0d4b22_d0a2aec92bf540bba4a15d06e670ba36.pdf


At the moment the book Beyond the Fog is not available as a perk. The reason is that it is still in progress. However, I am commiting to making an e-preview available on my website by May 2015. To that will follow a printed edition as soon as the work will be ready for it. Upgrades on the state of development of the book will be available at all stages on my website.


Thank you,

sincerely

Matteo Storer


matteo.storer@gmail.com

www.matteostorer.com
story_txt:
ABOUT BEYOND THE FOG

     Beyond the fog is an art project aiming to investigate a new aesthetic approach to the landscape in Photography and Poetry, developed from researching the history of Italian photography between World War I and II.     The project will take the form of a photo book with 30 photos and 30 poems,to be shared on the web and in Italian and French art galleries.

     Gradual updates about Beyond the Fog will become available online on my website: http://www.matteostorer.com/#!progetti-in-corso/c1en6.

 

Examples of  the photos I want to include in the project:

 

 

M. Storer, Omaggio a Fra Angelico, Firenze, aprile 2014.

  



M. Storer, Como, Como, luglio 2014.

story:
What do we do?

We at Made In America: Where Are My Rights? strive to educate the public on the struggles the Gay, Lesbian, Bisexual, Transgender and The Ally community faces. 

Our goal is to create a series of books to showcase the photos and stories of the LGBTA community. The only problem is that it is quite costly to create and publish them. That's where you come in. 

Why is this important?

Whether you realize it or not, members of the LGBTA community are all around you. You've probably already interacted with one today - at the bank, in your office, or on the sidewalk. They deserve the same rights as everyone else, and one way to help that happen is to tell their story. 

Where will the money go?

Travel expenses - there are LGBTA community members all over the country who deserve to have their story told - we just need a way to get to them!

Event Registrations - Pride organizations around the country charge a vendor fee... we definitely need to be where the people are.

Materials / Collateral - Cost associated with making flyers, posters, banners, brochures, etc.

Apparel Development - Continued development of apparel such as shirts, tags, stickers, etc. to spread the brand, cause, and awareness

Book - Funds for the book will go to the creation, development, layout, editing, publishing, and distribution.

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't donate, but like our mission? Please help us spread the word! Tweet about us, post a link to your facebook, and tell all your friends! We need all the help we can get!  

Video Update #1  

 

On-Going Photoshoots

Sample Photos with more in the gallery 

 

 

Facebook Followers submitting their stories.

 

  

 

Posted Stories

Excerpt #1

" ... I am "Buffy Lynn Hayes", An American.

Self-Submission by Buffy Lynn Hayes

I grew up in Clear water, FL., attended Largo Senior Votec Academy, and was a founder for helping kids deal & cope with homosexuality. I grew up in a very strict abusive step family that believed sending me to a Catholic boys school was going to cure me. "Ummm it cured me alright...lol" , and that i was doomed to hell and there was no saving me. ...."

 

Excerpt #2

" ... If you consider love and respect the foundation for a healthy marriage, Stephen and Adam have it.

What they don't have... is the support of the Commonwealth.

The love story began as a friendship, with the pair meeting their freshman year of college at Penn State Behrend Campus in Erie, PA.

It took 6 years but eventually the friends became lovers. And when he recognized the love was strong enough, Stephen proposed. The couple was married in New York.

"Our marriage is the same as any straight couple. We both love each other completely and are devoted to each other and our relationship," said Adam. ..."

 

Thank you for your support,

Made In America Board

story:
Hi there! My name is Peter Young and I am a photographer from Nova Scotia. I'm 32 years old and heading west to look for work. My goal is to be able to work hard in a job that is rewarding, while getting to do the kind of photography I really enjoy on the side - in the great outdoors. 

I have been taking photos since my Dad gave me one of his Canon film bodies and a couple of his lenses when I was 14. Now I am 32 and have been photographing professionally for the past six years. 

When I graduated high school, I went to Vancouver, BC, for my first year of art school at ECIAD. I planned on taking a train cross country then, but it didn't happen. Due to cost, I ended up flying. But I've always dreamed of crossing this massive country by ground - and I see this as an opportunity to do just that, while doing what I love most - taking photos.

With the resulting photos, I would like to put together a showing of images and produce high quality photo books printed on silk paper that will make my photographs look their absolute best.  

My aim is to hit the road between December 15th and December 18th, 2013.

It may seem like a strange time of year for this kind of trip, but I think heading into Winter and the Holidays that there will be no shortage of great photo opportunities across this great land.

To see a selection of my photographic works, please visit my website: http://www.peteryoungphotography.ca 

What I Need & What You Get

So, my goal here is to raise $4000.00 to make this happen. This money will be used to pay for gas, food and lodgings along the way. In reality, I could make the trip in a straight shot for $1000.00: $600 for gas, and $400 for a couple of motel stays and food. But in order to really make the most of the trip, I would like to take my time and stretch the trip out a bit longer, allowing me the time to really see the Country and capture the best images. The money will also go towards production of the postcards and photo books that will be heading your way! 

If you decide to help me out (which I will GREATLY appreciate!!) I have come up with what I think are some pretty great perks in return. From a simple hand-written thank you on a custom postcard (made from a photo from the trip) to high resolution digital files - so you can print one or several of the images from my trip as large or small as you see fit, blank postcards for you to do what you like with (each will be of a different photo from the trip), and a few options for photo books of the images from across Canada at the onset of Winter.   

If I don't reach my entire funding goal, it doesn't mean the trip is off - I am going no matter what! The amount of funding I receive will affect how much of the Country I get to see, and how many images I will be able to photograph. If I surpass my funding goal, it means I get to take a little longer, see a bit more, and photograph lots! 

The Impact

This project is valuable to me in so many ways! I will get to fulfill a major bucket list goal of driving cross country. I will be able to do that while fulfilling my greatest passion - creating images! It will help me reach Alberta having had the opportunity to really enjoy our Country. 

My project is valuable to you - and Canada - too! By helping me out, a great Canadian adventure gets to be had and told via photographs - and written stories of the adventure. It is a long way to go - about 5000 kilometers if I go straight to Calgary, but likely in the range of 7000 km when all is said and done. So much countryside, so many cities and towns, so much culture and wildlife lay between Nova Scotia and Alberta that there is no way this story shouldn't be told. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Of course, I know not everyone can help out financially - but that doesn't mean you can't contribute at all! At the very least, please share my campaign with as many people as you can through facebook, email, twitter - even over a phone call! Maybe someone you share my project with will want to help make this possible. 

Use the sharing buttons on this page to spread the word - I am eternally grateful for any and all help and support from everyone! 

Thank you!
